loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La emprendedora Señora de nombre Luz Marina R. M. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera Doña Luz tiene 1 hija que tiene la edad de 32 años que labora como doctora, sus deseos son de sacar adelante a su familia para que su hija siga profundizando mas en su carrera y así pueda obtener un mejor porvenir para ella, sus propósitos son trabajar muy fuertemente con su negocio para llegar a establecerse de una forma en la que sus clientes puedan recibir una mejor atención enfocados en sus productos por lo que este ocupa su mayor atención.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de Cosméticos y productos online 
la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, ella da inicio a su negocio estableciendo una pulpería en la que vendía productos de la coca cola y con los ingresos que obtenía de este negocio decide ahorrar para establecer otro negocio como lo es la venta de ropa y de cosméticos ya que con este prevalece mas tiempo y decide quedarse con el negocio de la venta de ropa, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar las compras de sus productos en las diferentes casas distribuidoras de los productos ya que tiene que viajar hasta Managua para realizar la compra.
texts.en:
Businesswoman Luz Marina R. M. is 51 years old and single. Luz has one daughter who is 32 years old and works as a doctor. Her wishes are to help her family get ahead as her daughter is continuing to grow in her career, and in this way she can provide a better future for her. Her goals are to work very hard in the business to establish herself in a way so that her customers receive the best attention, focused on the products which she offers today. Luz sells cosmetics and online products. She is a traveling vendor and has sold for 20 years. She began her business establishing a small convenience store where she used to sell Coca-Cola products and with the income she made from this business she decided to save and establish another business selling clothing and cosmetics and has stayed with this for quite some time, then decided to stop selling clothing. The financing is for working capital so that she can make purchases of her product from different distribution houses, and she has to travel as far as Managua to make her purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Rouaida

texts.en: Rouaida is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, living in Katermaya in Mount Lebanon. She used to sell clothes and shoes in her house. In 2006 she opened her first shop. Today, she is requesting $1,200 to buy new clothes and shoes at a good price in hopes that it will increase her sales.

loans.use: Buy more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Chômeur depuis 2 ans, il désire acheter une moto pour se lancer dans l’activité de taxi moto. Avec cette activité, il espère gagner plus d’argent pour mieux épargner afin de bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Dans la vue, il est celui qui s’est tenu debout habillé en chemise bleu.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is a young man of 37, married and the father of 2 children. Out of work for the past two years, he wants to buy a motorcycle to start up a moto-taxi business. With this business, he hopes to earn more money to be able to save so as to support his family adequately. In the photo, he is the one who is standing, wearing a blue shirt.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a motorcycle to use as a moto-taxi

loans.name: Chadulu O Group

texts.en:
Joha has been a fish seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 35. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Joha is married and has two children: 25 and 18. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Christina. Each woman has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more fish for re-sale in order to expand her business

loans.name: Sharafet

texts.en: Sharafet K. is a hard-working man who has always made sure, since his younger days, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married and has an adorable daughter. Sharafet has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With starting capital of $100, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise five years ago. Today his business has become domestic with his children and wife also engaged. Sharafet needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Carolina Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline G. is 41 years old and lives with her common-law husband, Cristhian, and their one daughter.  The family lives in Cusco, Peru, where they have several businesses. Cristhian owns an auto lubricants store, while Jacqueline has a number of different businesses of her own: she sells furniture, offers interior decorating services, and also runs a spa. She has had the furniture and interior decorating businesses for about three years  (it will be three years on April 17th). She also recently opened a spa, where she offers a variety of beauty services. When she first opened the spa, she dedicated most of her time to administering it, but she quickly found that the furniture business suffered as a consequence. Today, she splits her time between the businesses: she spends about 60% of her time on interior decorating and furniture sales, and the other 40% to running the spa. She has five employees at the spa and three employees selling furniture, and says that she serves a wide spectrum of the public with each of her businesses. 

Jacqueline is requesting a loan of 2300 soles to buy more furniture. She will buy furniture made from plastic and wood, especially entertainment centers to shelve DVDs, TVs and stereos. Her goal for the future is to see all of her businesses grow.

Jacqueline has pledged to repay this loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diakalia Traoré a 38 ans, marié et père de quatre  enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier de Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Diakalia n’ayant pas eu à fréquenter l’école  s’est très vite initié à une activité de menuiserie  auprès de son père  qui était un  contremaître qualifié, très connu et très sollicité par la population Sikassoise. Après des années passées auprès de ce dernier, il  décide de s’installer à son propre compte. Avec  sa  grande expérience, il reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais ses moyens sont insuffisants pour satisfaire tous ses besoins qui ne cessent d’augmenter. Il décida alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux  ans. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel après avoir remboursé sans difficulté le premier.
Avec ce deuxième prêt il compte constituer un important stocks en bois de construction avec  un chargement de camion “10 tonnes”  en chevrons et planches et  un demi chargement de contreplaqués.   
 Il achète ces bois dans les localités environnantes (Tinkrela, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) avant de les scier et de les ramener à Sikasso pour en faire des charpentes, des meubles, bancs, tables-bancs, bureau, chaises  etc  afin de les revendre. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakalia Traoré, 38, is married and the father of four children. He lives with his wife and their children in a big traditional extended family in the Bougoula Ville district, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having been able to attend school, Diakalia started up a carpentry business early on, together with his father who was a licenced master, well-known and much in demand in Sikasso. After some years of working together, Diakalia decided to set himself up alone. With his great experience, he receives lots of orders, but his finanacial means are not sufficient to satisfy all the ever-growing needs of his clientele. He decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. He is on his second individual loan after having reimbursed the first without difficulty.

With this loan he intends to stock up on construction wood with a truckload of 10 tons of rafters and boards and a half-load of plywood. He buys this wood in surrounding localities (Tinkrela, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) before sawing it and bringing it to Sikasso to make frames, furniture, benches, picnic tables, chests of drawers, chairs, etc. for sale.

With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 250,000 F CFA which will be used to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on his loan, investing any remainder in his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wood to make rafters, planks; purchase of plywood, etc.

loans.name: Gameli

texts.fr: Gameli D. est un homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi à Kpalimé, une ville situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. les dépenses engendrées par les réparations de sa voiture ne lui permettent pas d’épargner et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Avec ce crédit, Gameli souhaite acheter renouveler son moteur afin de mieux exercer son activité et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Gameli D., 37, is married and the father of 2 children. He is a taxi driver in Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. The outlay of money to repair his car doesn't allow him to save anything nor support his family appropriately. With this loan, Gameli wishes to upgrade his car's motor so that he can go about his work and better cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: upgrading his car's motor

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan generates her daily income through her food-vending business. Her husband, Ely, is working abroad so she serves as the mother and father to their children. She finds the task very difficult but, according to her, she needs to be patient and must sacrifice everything for their family.

She manages a humble eatery business in their village. She hopes that her business will grow and have high profit to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. She wanted to borrow a loan from lenders amounting to PHP 7,000 as additional working capital to make her vending bigger and more sustainable.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Haidar

texts.ru: Хайдар Темуров  1975 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей.  Имеет среднее образования.  Бизнес начал 5 лет назад . Для этого ему помогала мать. Она ездила в Китай за товаром и привозила различную посуду. Со временем она стала брать с собой Хайдара , что он мог научиться и в дальнейшем мог сам справляться с перевозкой и различать какие товары необходимы для потребителей. В настоящий момент торгует с женой в магазине. Продают вазы, тарелки, пиалы, касу (национальная посуда для шурпы) и многое другое.
texts.en:
Haidar T. was born in 1975, is married and has four children. He has secondary education. He started his business five years ago. His mother helped him in this. She traveled to China for the merchandise and brought different kinds of china. With time she started taking Haidar with her so that he could learn and could manage the transportation of goods himself and differentiate which goods are necessary for the consumers. At this time he sells in the store with his wife. They sell plates, bowls, pialas, kasu (national china for shurpa) and many other items.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina L. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Edina is separated from her spouse and has three adult children. To make a living, Edina owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Edina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Edina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah owns an automotive spare parts shop called Gatumah Enterprises which he has been running for the past 6 years. He is 30 years old and married. Isaiah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES in order to expand his business and purchase new products such as water pumps, pressure plates, and clutch plates. He hopes to one day open a second branch of his shop, as well as help his wife open her own clothing boutique. Isaiah describes himself as patient and industrious.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy pressure plates, water pumps and clutch plates for automotive shop.

loans.name: Berta Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora BERTA ALEJANDRINA V. D. R., tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to D. Primaria, tiene 5 hijos quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella .
BERTA   se dedica a  la venta D. insumos alimenticios en la tienda  D. su casa.
Su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos alimenticios para la tienda D. comestibles que tiene en su casa.
Este crédito D. 1,200 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra D. productos alimenticios para surtir la tienda D. comestibles que tiene en su casa.
BERTA sueña con ampliar y abastece su tienda para tener mayores ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: compra de productos alimenticios para surtir la tienda de comestibles

loans.name: Julie Grace

texts.en:
It is in Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya where Julie Grace and Rolando M. raise their family. They belong to a poor family but they have the strong determination to become successful someday. They are gifted with three children whom they called Arjay, Allan and Arvin who are now in elementary education. Julie and Rolando want them to finish their studies so that they will have a brighter future.

Despite the hardship and difficulties that life may bring, Julie Grace and Rolando are striving hard to earn a living and to finance the schooling of their children. The common source of their income is through farming: they till their parcel of land twice a year by planting rice and some vegetables. Furthermore, Rolando works as a carpenter while Julie Grace engages in selling barbecued food in front of their house to earn additional income. As a fruit of her patience and sacrifices, she is able to gain a net income of PHP 700 per week which they utilize to satisfy their needs and to support the schooling of their children.

Julie Grace aims to improve her business but she hasn’t enough capital. Fortunately, when one of the lending institutions offered their programs and services in their Barangay, Julie Grace decided to join purposely to borrow additional capital. She applied for PHP 5,000 to be used in the improvement of her business. She is so happy in joining the organization because it helps her to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 22 años, desde muy niño mostró gran cariño por la familia y desde que se casó trata de esforzarse para ser un buen padre y compañero. Vive en la casa de sus padres donde le brindaron una pequeña habitación para él y su esposa. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en un motocarro, para esto, se levanta muy temprano para iniciar sus actividades a las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, horario que es rotativo, pues en ocasiones tiene que trabajar por las noches en compañía de su padre. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que puede relacionarse con muchas personas en el transcurso de las horas de viaje y en los ocho años que lleva ofreciendo sus servicios considera que lo más difícil es manejar cuando hay mucho tráfico, lo cual altera la tranquilidad de sus pasajeros quienes exigen llegar temprano a su destino. Sus planes a futuro son de comprar un carro para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y alquilar la moto que tiene a sus vecinos chóferes.
Este en su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está decidido a trabajar con la misma responsabilidad y compromiso como lo hizo hasta hoy. Los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita los invertirá en el arreglo de su moto, pues tiene que pasar revisiones técnicas para su normal funcionamiento.

loans.use: Reparación de su motocarro

loans.name: Meu

texts.en: Meu F. is a 59 year old widowed mother caring for five children. All five children are still living in the family home and are employed in different jobs. Meu F. is a recycling seller - she buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she deals in is mostly leftover electricity wires. Meu F. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more stock to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more used goods to resell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: K. Ablavi est née en 1974 à Abatamè au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Ablavi vit à Takon  Aïdjèdo à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, il y a une vingtaine d’année. Mariée à DJISSOUKPE Marcellin un cultivateur, Ablavi est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Ablavi n’a jamais été à l’école ; elle a commencé il y a quinze ans, la préparation de sodabi (boisson alcoolisée locale) qu’elle vend à son domicile. Ablavi vend également de l’huile de palme à Ouando à Porto-Novo. Ablavi s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes et au marché Ouando. Ablavi est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Ablavi a bien remboursé les deux crédits précédents qu’elle a obtenus. C’est pour renforcer son activité et augmenter sa production journalière, afin de vendre davantage ses produits que Ablavi sollicite ce troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Ablavi K. was born in 1974 in Abatamè in Togo, a neighboring country of Benin. She has been living for 20 years in Takon Aïdjèdo in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is the wife of Marcellin Djissoukpe, a farmer, and the mother of four children who all attend school. The parents provide together for their family.

Ablavi never went to school. 15 years ago she began to produce sodabi, a local alcoholic drink, which she sells from her home. She sells also palm oil in Ouando in Porto-Novo. She gets her supplies in the nearby villages and at Ouando market. This is her third loan from Alidé. She repaid her previous two loans on schedule. Ablavi applies for this loan to boost her business and increase her daily production, so that she can sell more.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil and produce sodabi

loans.name: Khasay

texts.en:
Khasay M. is a responsible father of three children. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. 

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Khasay hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: Purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Joyce is a hairdresser by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. Joyce says she has seven apprentices who are currently under training. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy working materials such as artificial hair, pomade, shampoo, etc. so can improve upon her services.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair and other products for her salon

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La  Sra. Filomena es cliente que tiene su negocio de una tienda de barrio, tambien se dedica al cultivo de verduras y papa en los terrenos ubicado en Totorani que les dejó su mamá, quien fallecio el año pasado y quien tambien  fue cliente de Emprender. la señora Filomena tiene dos hijos pequeños que se encuentran en en edad escolar, el esposo es albañil que trabaja en Los Pinos, por el momento ella se solventa con el ingreso de la tienda y el salario de su esposo, pero ya por los meses de diciembre, enero hasta mayo ella trae los productos que cosecha para venderlos en el mercado campesino de Chasquipampa, donde tiene un puesto de venta, es una cliente buena y responsable.
texts.en:
Sra. Filomena is a client who runs a neighborhood grocery store. She also grow vegetables and potatoes on farmland located in Totorani. She inherited this property from her mother who passed away last year and was also a client of Emprender. Sra. Filomena has two small children who are in school. Her husband works as a mason in Los Pinos.

For the moment, she is able to cover her expenses with the revenues from her store and her husband’s salary. From the months of December through May, she brings in harvested products to sell at the farmer’s market in Chasquipampa where she has a vendor stall. Sra. Filomena is a good and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Paul Loka

texts.en: Paul is married and has children ranging from four to nine years old.  He describes himself as hardworking, dedicated and humble.  For the last six years Paul has been running a green grocer, and has one employee.  His business challenges are lack of proper storage and unreliable transportation.  He will use his loan of KES 50,000 to increase his stock so that he can operate another grocery store.  In the future, he wants to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to increase his stock so he can operate another grocery store

loans.name: La Unión Del Progreso Group

texts.es:
UBICADO A 6KM APROXIMADAMENTE  DE LA CIUDAD DE CUAUTLA SE ENCUENTRA LA LOCALIDAD DE APATACO, PERTENECIENTE AL MUNICIPIO DE AYALA MORELOS.
LA FORMA MAS FACIL PARA LLEGAR ES POR LA AVENIDA DEL SR. DEL PUEBLO TODA DERECHA PASANDO EL PUENTE DE APATLACO SE ENCUENTRA LA COMUNIDAD DE CUAHUIXTLA EN LA CUAL SE ENCUENTRA LA UDE LA UNION DEL PROGRESO LA CUAL SE HA CARACTERIZADO POR SU PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS.
TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES DE LA UDE SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO Y AL SERVICIO LA SRA. VERONICA SE DEDICA A VENDER FUNDAS PARA LICUADORAS Y LAVADORAS, LA SRA. FRANCISCA D. SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE CHILES ENVINAGRE Y ENSALADA DE NOPALES, DOÑA MARGARITA VENDE POR CATALOGO Y TAMBIEN VENDE BUÑUELOS, NOHEMI ES DIRECTORA DE MERY KAY Y TAMBIEN VENDE POR CATALOGO, FLOR VENDE POR CATALOGO Y UN POCO DE ABARROTES CUANDO HAY OFERTAS EN LA TIENDA QUE TRABAJA, CARLOS, GENOVEVA Y MAGDALENA TIENEN COMBIS DE TRANSPORTE PUBLICO, SOFIA Y ERIKA VENDEN POR CATALOGO Y ERICK VENDE PRODUCTOS DE HERBALIEF.
Y POR ULTIMO LETICIA B. B. ELLA SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE CATALOGO Y DE LA CUAL HABLAREMOS AHORITA.
ELLA SE ENTERO DE ESTE CREDITO POR UNA PRIMA LA CUAL LA INVITO A ELLA Y A SU MAMA SE FORMO EL GRUPO PERO TUVIERON ALGUNOS PROBLEMAS CON SU PRIMA DEVIDO A QUE SE QUERIA AGARRAR ALGUNAS BASES NADAMAS TERMINARON EL CREDITO Y DESCANSARON 2 MESES DE AHÍ LETI SE COMUNICO A LA EMPRESA YA QUE QUERIA FORMAR UN GRUPO PERO CON DIFERENTES PERSONAS SE FORMO Y AHORITA YA ESTAN EN EL TERCER CICLO EL CREDITO QUE TIENE ES DE $8000 EL CUAL LO VA A INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA UQE VENDE DE TODO UN POCO TOPPER, PERFUMES, CREMAS, ROPA INTERIOR, ETC. ELLA ES CASADA TIENE 2 HIJOS UNO ESTA EN CUARTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA Y EL OTRO TIENE CUATRO MESES DE NACIDO.
NOS COMENTA QUE CUANDO ELLA SE CASO SUFRIO MUCHO YA QUE ELLA TRABAJABA DESDE QUE ESTABA JOVEN Y LE GUSTABA TENER DINERO PROPIO PERO CUANDO SE CASO TODO CAMBIO POR QUE SU ESPOSO NO LA DEJO SEGUIR VENDIENDO. UN TIEMPO SU ESPOSO SE FUE A E.U. EN EL CUAL ELLA APROVECHO PARA VENDER DE TODO Y CUANDO EL LE AVISABA QUE YA IBA A REGRESAR ELLA SE DESHACIA DE TODO  PARA QUE EL NO NOTARA NADA PERO UN DIA LA CACHO Y EL SE PELEO CON ELLA PERO DESPUES HABLARON Y EL COMPRENDIO QUE YA IBA A HACER UNA AYUDA MAS LO QUE ELLA APORTARA PARA SUS GASTOS Y ASI PODER SACAR A SUS HIJOS ADELANTE Y DARLES TODO LO QUE SE MERESCAN.
POR ULTIMO AGRADECIO A LA EMPRESA DE FUNDACION REALIDAD POR EL APOYO BRINDADO PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE CON EL PRESTAMO Y PODER CONTINUAR CON SU NEGOCIO YA QUE HAY VECES EN LAS QUE NO SE CUENTA CON LOS SUFICIENTES RECURSOS PARA SURTIRSE Y ASI LO VAN ADMINISTRANDO PARA QUE LES ALCANSE Y PUEDAN VENDER SU MERCANCIA POCO A POCO
Y A KIVA POR CONFIAR EN FUNDACION REALIDAD Y DARLES LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CONOCERLOS Y CONOCERNOS POR MEDIO DE LA ENTREVISTA Y LA FOTO.
texts.en:
The village of Apataco, which is located approximately 6 km from the city of Cuautl, is part of the municipality of Ayala Morelos. The easiest way to come to that place is to go straight ahead on Avenida del Señor del Pueblo. The community of Cuahuixtla, which belongs to the village bank "La Unión del Progreso", is situated right behind the Apatlaco bridge. Their members are known for the punctuality of their repayments. All the members of the village bank are active in trade and services: Mrs Verónica sells protective covers for blenders and washing machines,Mrs Francisca Díaz prepares pickled peppers and nopal salads,Doña Margarita sells via catalog and also sells buñuelos,Nohemi is a manager with the cosmetics company Mary Kay and also sells via catalog,Flor sells via catalog and some groceries when there are bargains in the store where she works,Carlos, Genoveva and Magdalena operate public transport minibuses,Sofía and Erika sell via catalog,Erick sells nutrition products from Herbalife, and finallyLeticia B. B. sells via catalog; a detailed account of her story follows. Leticia initially was a member of a loan group to which she and her mother were invited. The group was created, but had problems with the repayments. There was some fighting, but finally the loan was repaid. Leticia waited for two months and then informed the microfinance institution that she wanted to set up a new group with other members. This group was created and is now in its third loan cycle. Leticia's share of the loan amounts to 8,000 pesos, which she will invest in her store where she has a highly diversified inventory: sportswear, perfume, creams, lingerie, etc. She is married and the mother of two sons: one is in fourth grade and the other is four months old. She told us that when she married, she suffered a lot. The reason is that she had been working since she was very young and she liked having her own money. However, when she married, everything became different, because her husband would not let her continue selling. There was a time when her husband was in the United States. She grasped the opportunity to open a store and sold anything she could. When her husband informed her that he was about to come home, she got rid of her entire inventory, so that he shouldn't notice anything. But soon he learnt the truth and had a fight with her. Finally, they talked about it and he understood that her contribution might help him to support his sons and give them everything they were entitled to. Finally Leticia thanked our microfinance institution for its support and continued lending. She was able to continue her business, because at times she did not have the necessary resources to restock her store. She used the loans to reach her goal and be able to keep selling her merchandise. She is grateful to Kiva to trust our microfinance institution and to give the lenders the opportunity to get to know the institution and the entrepreneurs through this interview and this picture.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, deodorants, creams, etc.

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es: Zenayda de 46 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos: Hector de 27 años que trabaja en el EMPA, alexander de 25 años trabaja en la UNAN, ambos le apoyan con los gastos del hogar; y el menor Jader de 8 añitos que estudia la primaria. Zenayda trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 22 años como responsable del cementerio de Juigalpa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en el hospital como camillero que asume los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su 9no credito y espera continuar contando con el apoyo de kiva y poder construir un cuarto para uno de sus hijos que se acaba de casar y tiene un bebito de meses y desea darle privacidad a la familia que acaba de formar. Con los creditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que con el ultimo logro cambiar el techo y levantar paredes de su cocina. Su mayor sueño es seguir mejorando su casa para brindarle comodidad a su familia puesto que es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Zenayda, 46, has three children: Hector, 27, who works for EMPA, Alexander, 25, who works at UNAN, both of whom contribute to household expenses, and Jader, 8, who is in elementary school. Zenayda has worked for Juigalpa's mayor's office for the last 22 years as caretaker at Juigalpa's municipal cemetery. Her husband, who is employed as a stretcher-bearer at a hospital, is responsible for household expenses. She is asking for her 9th loan and hopes to continue to have Kiva's support to build a bedroom for one of her sons, who has recently married and has a baby that is under a year old; she would like to provide him with more parivacy for the family he has just formed. Her previous loans allowed her to improve her family's living conditions in that she used the last one to reroof the house and to build the walls for her kitchen. Her greatest wish it to continue to improve her home so that her family will have more comfort since this is the main asset she plans to leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Groupe Sohkna Touré

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sokhna Touré est un groupement qui en est à sa deuxième demande de crédit  afin d’accroitre leurs chiffres d’affaires et faire face aux besoins familiaux. Ce groupement féminin qui porte le nom de la présidente  est composé de 8 membres tous habitantes de Diourbel.
 Elles s’activent toutes les 8 soit  dans le commerce, la teinture soit dans  la couture. Quant à la présidente Madame Sokhna Touré, elle vend des céréales locales, des légumes et détergents. Ainsi avec sa part du crédit, elle compte se réapprovisionner auprès de ses fournisseurs dans les plus brefs délais.  Elles sollicitent un crédit de 500 000  qu’elles vont se partager à part égale. 
Les autres membres du groupe sont Madame Fatou B., Madame Fary D., Madame Fatou N., Madame Ndeye Guèye, Madame Aïssatou S., Madame Oumou S. et Madame Faly T. toutes commerçants.
texts.en:
The Sokhna Touré Group is requesting a second loan to increase their turnover and meet their family needs. This group of women carries the name of its president and is made up of eight members, all from Diourbel. All eight are active in retail, dying or sewing. As for the president Mrs. Sokhna Touré, she sells locally grown grain, vegetables and detergent. With her portion of the loan, she intends to restock from her suppliers as quickly as possible. The group is requesting a loan of 500,000 that they will split equally among themselves. The other group members are: Mrs. Fatou B., Mrs. Fary D., Mrs. Fatou N., Mrs. Ndeye Guèye, Mrs. Aïssatou S., Mrs. Oumou S. and Mrs. Faly T., all running a business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cecelia will use the loan to purchase more maize and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis is 51 years old, married with one son. Her son is studying in 9th standard in a local school in Chichawatni. Chichawatni city is famous for its sweetmeats. Bilquis' husband is a farmer. Bilquis requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her husband to plant his crops and get a high crop yield come harvest time. The income will help support the family, especially in the domains of food, health, and education. 

Bilquis is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Sajida Baji and Majidan Baji each want a loan to buy mason's tools. Arshad Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Mumtaz Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

Note: Bilquis Baji is seated third from the right and the others are helping with her domestic work.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a shop where she sells microwaves, washing machines, fans, and other items in order to make a profit. With the profit from the business, she can save a little money and assist her husband in running the home. Her husband is a pastor, and he is also trying to meet his financial responsibilities.

Mary hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN in order to purchase more microwaves and washing machines to sell.

Mary is 48 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She works hard to assist her husband in meeting the family's needs. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more microwaves and washing machines to sell

loans.name: Dalmas

texts.en:
Dalmas is a 30-year-old entrepreneur who sells fish. He has four employees and has been in business for nine years. He has four children who go to school. Dalmas is a hard-working and visionary man who also rents out houses in the Kibera slums to earn extra income. He was previously in business in the transport industry.  

He has been saving his money with a group run by Faulu Kenya. He has previously benefited from the group because the members guaranteed his previous loan. 

He has requested a loan of Kes.50, 000 to buy a freezer for preserving fish. He hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Six people make up this group loan. They live in Trav Village in the Prey Veng province. Mr. Sok K. is the group leader selected by all the members, who will use the loan for different purposes in support of their businesses. 

Mr. Sok K. is a village chief and aside from this, he is a farmer who owns 1.2 hectares of land and cultivates rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Sarun KH., is a pig breeder. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand it. So to improve the pig breeding business, Mr. Sok K. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets. He is the father of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 21 años y vive en casa de su madre con su pareja Jaime de 22 años y su hija  Ángeles de un año. El tiempo es lo que mejor sabe aprovechar, pues desde hace 3 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en diversos negocios, es así que tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, pero los días que juega voleibol vende chupetes, dulces y golosinas entre sus conocidos y durante las noches sale a vender caldo de gallina en un puesto ambulante que instala al costado de la carretera central de Santa Ana. Lo que más le gusta es atender a sus clientes y hacerse de más amigos, por ahora las ganancias que obtiene los ahorra, ya que quiere ampliar la construcción de su casa, mientras que las utilidades que genera su esposo de su trabajo de moto taxi, le ayuda a cubrir en los gastos domésticos. Es por ello que desea mas adelante instalar una tienda de venta de repuestos para motos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y asegura que este aporte le enseñará a ser responsable y a trabajar de manera conjunta y unida en su grupo comunal, ella guarda mucha emoción porque le aseguraron que en las reuniones recibirá charlas educativas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará insumos necesarios para continuar preparando comida, lo indispensable como: arroz, fideo, huevo, verduras, papa, harina, entre otros ingredientes.
texts.en:
Patricia is 21 years old and lives with her husband, 22 year old Jaime, and her one year old daughter, Ángeles. They share her mother’s home. She knows how to make good use of her time, and for the past three years she has worked in different businesses. She runs a small food store from her home, but on days when she plays volleyball, she sells suckers, candies, and snacks to her acquaintances. In the evenings she sells chicken from a mobile stall, which she sets up along the central road in Santa Ana. She really enjoys serving her customers and making new friends. For the time being, she is saving all of her income because she wants to make upgrades to expand her home. The income that her husband earns as a mototaxi driver helps cover the household expenses. He also wants to open a motorcycle parts store. This will be her first loan through MFP and she believes that this venture will help her learn to work as part of a team with her communal group. She is very excited because she learned that there will be educational talks given during the group’s meetings. She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, eggs, vegetables, potatoes, flour, and other things that she needs to prepare her food.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Irma Lucinda

texts.es:
Irma de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, ella es costurera hace confecciones y cose ropa para su lista de clientes. Pero antes de que ella tuviera su negocio, Irma trabajo en una empresa  de confecciones pero la despidieron por reducción de personal, con sus ahorros compro una maquina de coser y empezó con su negocio.

En la actualidad ella tiene su negocio de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Pero para tener mas materiales de costura ella quiere comprar telas y hilos para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener maquinas industriales para confeccionar al por mayor la ropa.
texts.en:
Irma is 47 years old. She lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil. She is a seamstress. She makes and sews clothes for her list of customers. Before she had a business, she worked for a company that makes clothes, but they let her go due to personnel reduction. She used her savings to buy a sewing machine, and she started her business. She currently has her business of sewing and making clothes in her house. She works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. everyday. In order to have more sewing materials she wants to buy fabric and thread for her business. In the future she wants to have industrial machines in order to make clothes to sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food Service

loans.name: Alcida

texts.es:
Alcida, tiene 30 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la ciudad de Urubamba.  Alcida vio la necesidad de sus vecinos, ellos se dirigían a lugares lejanos a comprar comestibles pero Sabina abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende comestibles a sus vecinos. Para Sabina esta fue una oportunidad de trabajo y así de esta forma sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un mejor futuro. Su esposo Andrés es empleado en un condominio y con su sueldo aporta al gasto familiar. Alcida participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alcida, 30 years old, has a partner and two children and lives in the Rumichaca community in Urubamba City. Alcida noticed that her neighbors would have to go long distances to buy their groceries. Sabina opened a small grocery store in her home where she sells groceries to her neighbors. For Sabina, this was an opportunity for work, and this way she can provide the best for her children and give them a better future. Her husband, Andres, is an employee in a condominium. He contributes to the household expenses with his income. Alcida participates in the communal bank, and it is going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual about paying her bills. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more products such as rice, noodles, sugar, etc. Alcida is grateful for the opportunity that the loan provides her, and in addition, she commits to making the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries such as rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em K. is 41 years old and she is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectare of land to cultivate rice and she is also farmer who works very hard to support her two children. In order to support the farm, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborers. Aside from farmer, she is also Khmer noodle seller in the local market who is able to earn a small income to hold up her family living. Mrs. Em K. is widow with two children one is a farmer and another one is a student.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborers.

loans.name: Ahit

texts.en: Ahit S. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, western Mongolia, in a traditional nomadic housing tent called a "ger." His elder son Bazarbek, who is 22, works for a local private company while the younger son is a student. Ahit operates a food retailing business with the help of his wife. He began his business in 2002 in a small room of his house, but expanded his operation and set up a small shop called "Tsetsegt" two years later with working capital of 500,000 MNT. His wife is responsible for their food retailing business. Ahit has purchased a small car with his business earnings as well as his son's salary and has started running a taxi service in his town. He hopes to continue his success in the future and says, "My wife and I are working hard to save money for our son's education." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick O. is 42 years old and is married to Jane Adhiambo. They have six children who are all school going children and are under 18 years. They live in a rural area called Ngiya.

Patrick owns a retail shop. He is applying for a loan from Kadet Ltd to buy “My Sunshine Box,” which will help him to light his home. Patrick’s home is in the interior of Ngiya Town and the supply of electricity to that area is limited. He was introduced to Kadet Ltd by a friend who is a client with us. The Sunshine Box will help the children study well at night.

He hopes and waits for the day when electricity will be installed in his rural home.

loans.use: To buy a "Sunshine Box"

loans.name: Dil

texts.en: Dil M. is 25 years old and has been selling a fresh fish in the local busy market for more than nine years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and from other fishermen. She is married to Hab Sakin, 23, who works as a furniture producer. The couple has given birth to a young child who is enrolled in the primary school. Presently, Dil M.‘s business has faltered due to insufficient financial capital. In view of that, Dil M. has applied for her first loan, to increase her capital.

loans.use: To increase her capital.

loans.name: Felicima

texts.en:
A hardworking mother of four children, at age 65 Felicima S. B. still manages her canteen and fruits and vegetables retailing business. Three of her children are already employed, while the youngest is still studying. She is a member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI) – a partner Microfinance Institution of KIVA in the Philippines since 2002. One of the most active members of ASHI- Rizal Central Branch, she serves as an inspiration to many women in the community in joining the program.

Today Felicima is applying for a loan of P40,000.00 in pesos as additional capital for her business in order to increase her customer base and her income. This will enable her to start saving, help her youngest daughter complete college, and continue to help her husband in their financial needs. Her business plan is to construct a much wider space for her canteen and establish a grocery for her children to continue as the couple grows older. She wants to hire people and provide employment, especially to those out-of school-youth so that they can earn for their schooling.

Felicima is so happy and keeps praying that ASHI and KIVA will continue their partnership in providing financial assistance to poor but deserving families.

loans.use: To buy additional fruits and vegetables both for the canteen and for retailing

loans.name: Francis Musyimi

texts.en:
Francis Musyimi is a 63 year-old a businessman who sells livestock. He is married to Peninah and they are blessed with five children. Three of the children are working and two are in secondary school. Francis has been selling livestock for the past 25 years. His current monthly income is Kshs. 30,000.

Francis is servicing his second loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  He plans to start a butchery to sell meat to his customers. With the anticipated profits from his business he intends to renovate his rental houses to modern ones with modern facilities. His hopes and dreams are to construct rental houses and buy pieces of land in his home town, Mwingi, and in other towns.

loans.use: To start a butchery and sell meat.

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mejía está localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, su gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

La señora Margarita esta en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y esta muy contenta porque gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la  Fundación Espoir ha podido mejorar su negocio. Tiene 65 años y esta soltera, no tuvo hijos y vive con una compañera de trabajo. Es una mujer muy activa y alegre que le encanta su trabajo.

Se dedica al comercio, vende  productos naturales de Omnilive y Forlive,  también vende semijoyas de Visón, entre los productos que mas vende están: aloe, fibra multivitaminas, adelgazantes, entre otros. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 15h00. Ella también cría gallinas criollas, vende  los huevos y los pollos a muy buen precio ya que son mejores que los de granja.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de sus productos naturales sobretodo los adelgazantes.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y seguir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mejía is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo. The people there mostly work in agriculture and sell coconuts. The Mejía communal bank meets every 15 days.

Margarita has been in the communal bank since it began and she is very happy because, thanks to the loans that she has received from the Espoir Foundation, she has been able to improve her business. She is 65 years old and is single. She does not have children and lives with a friend from work. She is very active and loves her job.

She sells natural medicines of the Omnilive and Forlive brand. She also sells costume jewelry from Visón. Some of the best-selling products are: aloe, fiber, multivitamins, and weight-loss products, among others. She works Monday through Friday, from 8:00 until 3:00. She also raises chickens and sells eggs and chicken meat for a good price, since they are better than ones from large farms. 

She will use this loan to buy more natural medicines, especially the weight-loss products.

Her dream is to have her own house and continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy weight-loss products and natural medicines.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María Cecilia es una madre D. familia D. 29 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el sector Callanca del distrito D. Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turístisticas y religiosas. La zona se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica junto a su esposo al cultivo D. flores, ruda y hortalizas en un pequeño terreno D. cultivo con el que cuentan. Ellos comercializan los productos entre los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con una bodega en la cual brinda a sus vecinos diversos productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes que suelen necesitarse a diario. Con los ingresos que ellos perciben D. estas actividades sacan adelante a su familia.

María desea adquirir mas productos para ampliar el inventario D. su bodega, asimismo desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro D. su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
María Cecilia is a 29 year-old mother who lives with her husband and young son in the Callanca sector of the district of Monsefú.  This is an area which is known for its tourist and religious festivities.  The area is twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Together with her husband she grows flowers, rue and vegetables on a small plot of land which they have.  They sell their products to traders who visit the area.  In addition, she has a small store in which she offers her neighbors basic products and groceries which are needed every day.  With the income that they make from these activities, they manage to keep their family going.

María would like to acquire more products to expand the inventory of her store.  She would also like to acquire fertilizers to help maintain her crops.  This is why she is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  It will help her to achieve her goal.

María is quite a hard-working woman and she works hard every day to get ahead and proviD. her son with a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her to be a friendly woman who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: To buy products to expand the store which she has in her home

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana, de 26 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Keyli de 11 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de abarrotes de Yobana es una de las más concurridas del poblado de Santa Rosa (Dentro de la selva Ayacuchana), el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrir su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer gran parte del día en su tienda, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para cultivar sus tierras. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para tener más productos que vender. Este el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mas productos para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yobana, age 26, is a very unassuming and happy woman.  She lives in a rented house with her beloved daughter, 11 year old Keyle.  She is the motivation for all of her efforts.

Yobana’s grocery store is one of the most popular in the village of Santa Rosa (in the Ayachuchan jungle).  Her great charisma and the kind way she treats her customers has made her a neighborhood favorite.  Her neighbors do not hesitate to shop, starting very early, at her store.  They know that she is the first to open her business.

What she likes the most about her work is talking with her neighbors.  She has had her store for three years.  The hardest part is having to stay in her store for most of the day without having a lot of time to work her land.

Later on she hopes to expand the premises of her store in order to have more products to sell.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to access another loan with greater ease and without causing problems in her communal bank.  She is well-liked by the other members.

She will use the 500 soles that she requested to buy more products to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca de 46 años, vende cilindros de gas y bebidas. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  
 
Comenzó hace varios años atrás vendiendo bebidas para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que su esposo la abandono poco a poco surtió sus bebidas e implemento la venta de cilindros de gas por $ 2.50. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano en un local que ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. No tiene horario fijo porque lo realiza en su casa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cilindros de gas y bebidas a sus proveedores para tener más para vender. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con otras ventas y readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca, 46 years of age, sells tanks of natural gas and drinks. She lives in an outlying urban area called Paraíso de la Flor located in an area characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

She began her business some years ago selling drinks in order to be able to support her children since her husband left her. Little by little she stocked up on drinks and began selling cylinders of natural gas for $2.50. Currently she starts work very early in the morning in a shop she located in the front part of her house. She doesn't have a fixed schedule because she carries out her business activities at home. 

With the loan she wants to buy cylinders of natural gas and drinks from her suppliers in order to have more to sell. In the future she wants to expand her business to sell other products and remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase tanks of natural gas and drinks

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 49 años, vive en su casa propia construida de material noble, al lado de su esposo William de 56 años y de su hija que vive con  su familia en el mismo lugar. Desde hace 15 años esta emprendedora dama instaló en una pieza de su vivienda un pequeño taller de producción de estructuras metálicas, en sociedad con los miembros de su familia. De esta manera prestan todo tipo de servicio metalúrgico, como por ejemplo la  fabricación de puertas, ventanas, armarios, entre otros, pero todo hecho en material de metal. Y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias son regulares, pues no tiene competencia cercana; además realizan trabajos a domicilio, junto con su esposo y yerno. Como es un negocio familiar las ganancias se las dividen; y ella ya tiene varios planes para el futuro como el de ampliar las instalaciones de su taller, también  quiere comprar nueva maquinaria. Es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en su negocio en busca del progreso. Nancy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales en metal que necesita, pues tiene un gran pedido y quiere terminarlo, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nancy, 49, lives in her own house, that’s built out of substantial materials, with her husband, William, 56, and their daughter and her daughter’s family who live together with them.

For the last 15 years this enterprising woman has had a small metal workshop installed in one of the rooms in her house.  In partnership with some members of her family she makes metallic structures.  In this way they provide all sorts of metallurgic services.  For example: they manufacture doors, windows and armoires, among others.  

She is very satisfied because profits are regular because she doesn’t have any competition nearby.   Besides, she also does jobs to order at customers’ homes with her husband and son-in-law.  Because it’s a family business, profits are shared.  She already has several plans for the future like enlarging the workshop’s installations; she also wants to buy new machinery.

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who made this contribution possible that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress.

Nancy plans to use the requested loan to buy metal supplies she needs because she has a large pending order she wants to complete.  She hopes to improve her profits this way.

loans.use: To buy metal supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Clerida Yaneth

texts.es:
la señora Clerida Yaneth A. tiene 43 años de edad esta casada con el señor Damian Marquina.
Clerida se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, su esposo se dedica a la reparacion de bicicletas.
tienen dos hijos.
sus clientes son personas que trabajan en las empresas cañeras y meloneras de la region.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para surtir su negocio.

doña clerida es una mujer muy calmada y respetuosa, en sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar con sus dos
hijos, vive muy cerca de su mama y la visita casi todo los dias.
texts.en:
Clerida Yaneth A. is 43 years old and is married to Damian Marquina.  They have two children.

Clerinda sells popular use products, while her husband repairs bicycles.  Her customers are workers from the sugar cane and melon processing plants within the region.

She will use the money from this loan to buy items with which to stock her business.  Clerida is a calm and well respected woman who likes to play with her two children in her spare time.  She lives very close to her mother and visits her every day.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Rosa Alpina

texts.es: Rosa Alpina se dedica a una pulpería, tiene 3 años en este negocio pues con mucho empeño y dedicación ha logrado obtener este medio de vida. Inicio con pocos productos ya que ciertos clientes le realizan diferentes pedidos, pero con el paso del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia necesaria para seguir creciendo con su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, refrescos entre otros.  Ella sueña con mantener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en: Rosa Alpina has a small store. She has had this business for 3 years and with a lot of hard work and dedication has been able to have this lifestyle. She started with a few products since certain customers make different orders. As time passed, she obtained the necessary experience to keep growing with her business. The reason for the loan is to buy basic grains, detergent, candies, bread, and more. Her dream is to have a well supplied business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kathem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. Kathem opened his own food market in 2006 since he has good experience in this business. He is well known in his community and has a good reputation.

Kathem is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator and a motorcycle for delivery. He is aiming to extend his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a motorcycle

loans.name: Mpara Abagamba Kamu Traders Group A-Mubende

texts.en: K. Anna is a 36-year-old business lady who has for the past decade been operating a pharmacy in Mpara-Mubende. Anna, a happily married mother of 2, also does some farming. Monthly the drugstore business generates shillings 300,000 as profits. Anna belongs to Mpara  Abagamba Kamu traders group-Mubende and she says with this loan, she is going to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more drugs to resell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana D. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Susana is married and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Susana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy jovial y trabajadora. Es separada y vive junto a sus 2 hijos de los 3 que tiene en total.

Desde muchos años atrás, se dedica a la preparación y venta de menús, en un local alquilado, a 3 cuadras de su casa. En este se le encuentra, desde las 6 de la mañana a 7 de la noche, atendiendo a sus comensales los chóferes de los buses; quienes la prefieren por su buena sazón y su buen trato; a pesar de que son varios en el mismo punto. Por ello, para dinamizar su negocio, contrató una persona, quien le ayude atender y lavar los platos y, de ese modo capte mayores utilidades, y pague tranquilamente el alquiler de su negocio. Está contenta con su negocio, a pesar que lo trabajoso que es, le gusta porque lo realiza de manera independiente y con estas ganancias quiere educar a sus hijos, hasta que sean profesionales. Asimismo, en el futuro quiere proseguir con la construcción de su casa, que esta a medio construir. 

Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y está agradecida a los integrantes de su banco comunal, por invitarle a conformar a ser parte de  su grupo. Por lo que,  se compromete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. 

De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará mercaderías perecibles, y gaseosas, a solicitud de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melita is 45 years old.  She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who is separated from her husband and lives with two of her three children.

For many years, Melita has been preparing and selling meals in rented premises which are located three blocks from her home.  She works in her business from 6.00am to 7.00pm, serving the bus drivers who are her customers.  They prefer Melita's restaurant, in spite of the fact that there are several others in this location, because her food tastes good and she provides good customer service.

In order to energize her business, Melita hired a person to help her serve her customers and wash dishes so that she could make more profits and pay the rent on her business more easily.  She is happy with her business in spite of the hard work that it entails.  She enjoys it because she works for herself and she can use her profts to educate her children until they become professionals.  In the future, Melita would like to continue building her home which is currently only half built.

This is Melita's first loan from MFP and she is grateful to the members of her community bank for inviting her to be a part of their group.  For this reason, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

Melita will use the loan that she has requested to buy perishables and soda that her customers have requested.

loans.use: to buy perishables and soda

loans.name: Gabriella M. Stella

texts.fr: Jeune dame  active de 28ans, Mme Gabriella est mère d’un(01) enfant  et est mariée à un entrepreneur.  Elle a ouvert  sa boutique en 2008 et vend des produits de premières  nécessités et divers.  Elle s’approvisionne  au Grand Marché  de Lomé et revend  dans sa boutique. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt  pour acheter de l’eau vitale, du lait, du sucre et autre produits  pour vendre afin d’avoir plus de bénéfices, s’épanouir  et  pour avoir  la certitude que ces enfants  grandiront dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriella, age 28, is an active woman. She's the mother of one child and married to an entrepreneur. In 2008, she opened her shop where she sells staples and various other items. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé.

She's seeking her first loan in order to buy Eau Vitale (a brand of mineral water), milk, sugar, and other products to resell. She will thusly increase her profits, blossom, and make sure that her children will grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy mineral water, milk, sugar and other products

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es:
Leydi tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa heredada de sus padres.

Desde hace 7 años fabrica ladrillos junto con su esposo, han arrendado un terreno cercano a su casa para  depositar el material que compra para la fabricación. Fabrican diariamente y por semana llegan a producir  hasta 3 millares que por mes puede llegar hasta 30 millares de ladrillos fabricados que llevan a vender en la feria de materiales de construcción de su ciudad y también sus clientes llegan hasta su misma fabrica para comprar. Este negocio es rentable ya que le permite tener las ganancias que necesita para su familia, es una fuente independiente de sus ingresos donde su esposo  se encarga de  la fabricación y ella del comercio, es por eso que mas adelante están viendo la posibilidad de adquirir mas terrenos para arrendar y expandir su producción. 

es su crédito numero 8 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque le permite crecer como persona y aprender el valor del ahorro,  se compromete una vez mas a ser responsable en sus pagos.

En esta ocasión usara el crédito en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la fabricación de sus ladrillos como aserrín, arena y maderas.
texts.en:
Leydi, age 26, lives with her husband and her two children in a house inherited from her parents. For seven years, Leydi has been running a brick manufacturing business together with her husband. They have rented a lot next to their house in order to store all the necessary raw materials and produce bricks daily at a rate of about three thousand per week -- and sometimes produce as many as 30 thousand per month.

They sell the bricks in the city fair for construction materials, and clients also make purchases by coming directly to their fabric. Leydi is responsible for the sales, and her husband for the manufacturing. The business is profitable and allows them to have the income necessary to sustain their family. It is an independent source of income, and now they are also looking at the possibility of acquiring additional lots in order to expand production.

This is Leydi's eighth loan with MFP; she is very happy to be a part of her communal bank because it allows her to grow as a person and learn the value of saving. She is committed to timely repayment as she has been in the past. Leydi will use the current loan to purchase the raw materials necessary for the production of bricks such as sawdust and sand.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making bricks

loans.name: Cindy Elizabeth

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Cindy Elizabeth le esta haciendo falta un cuarto. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y arena, ya que en este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleada de una fabrica, como encargada de producción. Ya que su esposo el señor Ángel se encargara de los gastos de la familia con el ingreso de su trabajo. 
Desean que sus dos hijos tengan su propio espacio en la casa ya que solo cuentan con una sola recamara.
texts.en:
Cindy Elizabeth’s house lacks a room.  She is asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, concrete blocks, iron rods and sand because they don’t have the money right now to do the improvement.

She plans to repay the loan using her salary from her employment as Production Supervisor in a factory since her husband, Ángel, will take care of household expenses with his income from work.

They want their two children to have their own space in the house because it currently has just one bedroom.

loans.use: to build a room downstairs at her house.

loans.name: Nelly Eugenia

texts.es:
Nelly de 49 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, esta separada y tiene un hijo de 17 años que esta en colegio particular. Tiene un consultorio obstetricia.

Comenzó hace 10 años y desde allí ejerce su profesión de Doctora de obstetriz. Tiene su consultorio en casa y atiende de 7H30 am a 13H00 pm y de 15H00 pm a 18H30 pm . Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere adecuar su consultorio y comprar productos naturales para sus ventas y dar mejor servicios a sus clientes. En un futuro desea poner una clínica y que su hijo termine sus estudios universitarios y seguir con D-miro.
texts.en:
Nelly, 49, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (it was so named due to a species of trees, Guazuma ulmifolia.  El Guasmo is a popular neighborhood of humble residents that used to be a hacienda) in Guayaquil.  She is separated and has a 17-year-old son who goes to private school.  She has an obstetrics examining room.

She started ten years ago and has been exercising her profession as a Doctor of Obstetrics.  She has her examining room in her home and sees patients from 7:30am until 1pm and again from 3pm to 6:30pm.  

With help from the loan she wants to furnish her examining room and buy natural remedies to sell and provide better customer service.  In the future she’d like to set up a clinic, that her son finishes his university studies and to continue with D-Miro.

loans.use: to furnish her examining room and to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Wouyessouly  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe WOUYESSOULY  2 sont tous mariés. Ils ont une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Ils vivent dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA. Le village est situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces producteurs sont à leur premier cycle de prêt  pour la production du maïs avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  
MOUSSA, se tenant au milieu en position assise, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  6 sacs d’urée, 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 3 litres d’herbicides et le reste comme frais de  labour.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice d’environ 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Wouyessouly 2 Group are all married.  They are, on average, 40 years old and have about five children each.  They live in traditional families in Komalaba.  The village is located approximately 45 km from this city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.  

These growers are on their first loan cycle for the production of maize with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  Moussa, sitting in the middle of the first row, intends to use his loan to purchase 6 bags of urea, 3 bags of complexe céréale (a type of fertilizer), 3 liters of herbicide, and use the remainder to pay labor wages.  He hopes to earn a profit of about 100,000 FCFA which will be used for household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Posian

texts.en: Posian is a 25-year-old married man with one child aged 8 months. Posian rents a house and lives with two people in Hoima town in Uganda. For three years now, Posian has been a teacher and from that, he says he has been able to develop and educate his siblings. He says he likes what he does as a teacher. Posian is in need of a loan facility to pay tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El comité surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el 10º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2008. Actualmente cuenta con 17 miembros, las cuales trabajan de forma responsable y coordinada
La Sra. Silvina tiene 3 hijos pequeños, es casada y se dedica hace varios años a la venta comestibles en forma ambulante, por su barrio y también por el centro de la ciudad. Ella por medio de este trabajo ha logrado mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante. Ella quiere brindarles aquella educación a la cual ella no pudo tener acceso.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de los alimentos, como ser las carnes, especias, huevos, jamón, queso y demás. Ella sabe que el credito le sera de mucha ayuda, pues le servirá para tener bien surtidos sus ingredientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank emerged from contact with one of the members of the Fundación.  The group is in its tenth cycle, and it has been working with the Fundación since 2008.  The group currently has 17 member, and they work in a responsible and coordinated way.

Silvina is married and has three small children.  She has been selling food in an itinerant manner for several years.  She sells in her neighborhood and also in the center of the city.  It is through this work that she has managed to support her children and to get them ahead.  She wants to give them the education that she was not able to have.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make food.  She will buy things like meat, spices, eggs, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.  She knows that the loan will be a big help.  It will help her to be well-stocked with ingredients.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, eggs, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 19 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market.
