The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Willyn

texts.en:
Willyn, whose picture appears above, is 32 years old. She is married and is taking good care of her three school-aged children. She works for a living in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Willyn noticed the booming demand for Avon products in this place. This, then, gave her the idea of becoming an Avon dealer, which she started five years ago. She earns a total of 3,000 PHP per month from this buying and selling business activity. Willyn enjoys this kind of job – moreover it enhances and develops her selling skills.
Willyn joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, earlier this year. Her loan application for 4,000 PHP has been approved. With this amount, Willyn can now order additional Avon products to sell in her neighborhood and in neighboring communities. She hopes to have more revenue so she can start ordering larger numbers of the most demanded items.

loans.use: to order additional Avon products.

loans.name: Bokk Xol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 mars 2001. Il est  composé de quatorze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Salimata, à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus teintés. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis une dizaine années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 22, 2001. It is made up of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

Madame Salimata, on the right, raising her hand, is the group leader. She is 31 and single, without children. She sells dyed cloth. She has a good deal of experience in this field as she has been in it for some 12 years. This loan will allow her to grow her working capital and better develop her business. 

The profit will permit her to improve living conditions for the family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and set aside more in savings.

loans.use: to buy dyed cloth.

loans.name: Twunguke Ii Group

texts.fr:
Chantal  est une commerçante  âgée de 26 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Gihamagara en province de Gitega.  Elle vend la farine de manioc et l’huile de palme depuis 6 ans.Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est mariée  à Zeduc qui fait lui aussi le commerce de haricot.Ils ont ensemble 3 enfants  dont  1 étudie a l’école primaire.
 Le crédit Kiva de 300000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter  beaucoup  d’huile de palme et de  farine de manioc à revendre pour réaliser  de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “TWUNGUKE II”
texts.en:
Chantal is a merchant, 26 years old, who lives in the town of Gihamagara in Gitega Province. She has been selling cassava flour and palm oil for six years. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is married to Zeduc, who also does commerce in beans. Together they have three children, of whom one is in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 300,000 Fbu is going to enable Chantal to increase her capital to buy a lot of palm oil and cassava flour to resell in order to make a large profit. 

Chantal is a member of the community group “TWUNGUKE II”.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy a lot of palm oil and cassava flour to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Mushtak

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has two children.
Mushtak has owned a store selling women’s accessories and clothing since 2004. He has good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. His store is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing by.
Mushtak has decided to apply for a loan of $2,100 in order to renovate and fix his store’s walls and floors and buy more inventory. He is aiming to earn more profit so that he is able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s walls and floors and to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 26 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. For the last three years, she has been managing a cereal shop to earn a living. Previously, she was doing farming. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to become the supplier of cereals in her region. With 20,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and green grams (legumes).

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the bar and restaurant business for 15 years. Her vision is to move her business from the village to the town center. She also wants to have a better life. Dina needs the loan to buy sodas and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy sodas and to pay school fees

loans.name: Enriqueta Del Carmen

texts.es: Enriqueta Del Carmen tiene su pulpería desde hace mas de 27 años, que tiene este medio de vida. La necesidad de sufragar los ingresos necesarios ella ha sido una persona responsable y ha demostrado el pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante y en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de amigos, vecinos y familiares saben lo que ofrece pues tiene precios accesibles. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general entre otros.
texts.en: Enriqueta del Carmen has been running a general store for 27 years, and it has been her source of income to cover expenses.  She has always been responsible and paid back her loans on time.  She also works as a street vendor.  The majority of friends, neighbors and family seek her out because of her good prices.  She plans to use the loan to buy shoes, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: To buy shoes, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years old and a modest lady from the Nkararo area of Kilgoris County, Kenya. She is married to John and they have four children between 20 and 11 years old. 

Jane sells cereals in Nkararo, especially maize cereal due to its high demand. She has been in this business for the last three years and is able to make good income. She is an old client of KADET LTD since she is taking her fourth loan, which she will use to buy more maize cereals to sell.

She plans to use the profits to diversify into farming. Her hope is to see her business grow and generate enough income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more maize cereal for sale.

loans.name: Maritza Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 18, 17 10 y 9 años de edad,  los menores  estudian en escuela. El marido es artesano. 

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y colaboradora con el hogar, realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio ya que él tiene un taller de cerrajería en la localidad, allí elabora puertas, ventanas, y otras estructuras con el hierro, el trabaja todos los días y  siempre está ocupado ya que no le falta trabajo, mientras que ella se desempeña como ama de casa y además también trabaja en una fábrica de botones  por lo cual recibe un sueldo. Su esposo tiene este taller más de 10 años y le va muy bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar hierro, pinturas, sueldas y otros  materiales necesarios para su trabajo. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio taller de botones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" meets every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), famous nationally and internationally for its rich colonial culture and artisan crafts.  In this location most of the population is involved in making tagua (ivory palm) buttons, crafts or in some other trade.

Mrs. Maritza, 38, lives here with her common-law husband and four children, ages 18, 17, 10 and 9.  The younget ones are in school.  Her husband is an artisan. 

She is a very hard worker and collaborates at home.  She is requesting a loan to help her husband with his locksmith business.  He makes doors, windows and other iron structures.  He works every day and is always busy because of the high demand.  She is a homemaker and also works in a button factory where she receives a salary.  Her husband has had the workshop for ten years and business is going well, for which they feel blessed.

This loan will be used to buy iron, paints, soldering irons and other materials necessary for work.  She has been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes the group because it is very united.

Her dream is to have her own button workshop.

loans.use: To buy iron, paints, soldering irons and other materials.

loans.name: Nelsi Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hace 16 años Nelsi realizó un curso intensivo en perfumería y desde eso se ha dedicado todo el tiempo a sacar adelante su almacén de perfumería. Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a su gran clientela, que es su mayor activo, según dice ella. 

Su mayor necesidad y que será suplida con el crédito de $800.000 para comprar más perfumes, hace de esta gran emprendedora una persona que quiere siempre prestar un servicio óptimo y en un futuro poder generar empleos y abrir otros puntos de venta.
texts.en:
16 years ago Nelsi took and instensive perfumery course and since then has dedicated all her time to making her perfume shop successful. Her greatest dream is to be able to expand her business and provide better service to her customer base, which she says is her greatest asset.

Her main need, which will be catered for by the loan of COL$800 000, is to buy more perfumes. The loan will make this very enterprising woman a person who always wants to provide optimum service and in future she will be able to create jobs and open other sales posts.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her perfume business.

loans.name: Sucena Narcisa

texts.es:
En el Barrio 15 De Septiembre de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, con un clima cálido, por gastronomía y por sus innumerables atractivos turísticos, cada 15 días  se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. 
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sucena, tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo sola, pero de esta relación tuvo 10 hijos, 9 ya son mayores e independientes y con ella solo vive el menor que tiene 10 años y estudia en escuela.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida desde hace seis años en su casa puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde sus clientes pueden conseguir todo lo que necesitan ya que la tiene bien surtida con la finalidad de cada dia ir ganando mas clientela, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, le encanta su negocio ya que además de ganarse la vida se distrae y también está al tanto de las necesidades de su hijo y el cuidado de su hogar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más
texts.en:
The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are highly frequented throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists.  The city is also known for its hot climate, fine food, and numerous tourist attractions.  The members of the Palabra de Mujer communal bank meet every 15 days in the city’s 15th of September neighborhood.

Sucena is 53 year old.  Her husband passed away several years ago, leaving her a widow.  From that relationship she has 10 children, 9 of whom are adults and live independently.  Only her youngest son lives with her—he is 10 years old and is in school.  

For six years Sucena has operated a small grocery store in her home to earn a living.  Her customers can get everything they need there, since she keeps it well stocked in order to gain more customers each day.  She works from 6:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening.  She thoroughly enjoys her business, since it is a way to earn a living as well as to pass the time, and it provides for all of her son’s needs and for the upkeep of their home.

Sucena will use this loan to stock her store with more merchandise, including rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic staple products.  She has been a member of her communal bank since it was founded, and she likes it because she has made many friends in the group.

Sucena’s goal is to get ahead in her business and for her store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other staple products.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 28 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, esta casada con David quien tiene 32 y tienen una hija de 5 quien es el motor y motivo de esfuerzo, trabajo y sacrificio ya que desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, ellos viven en una casa propia en donde comparten sus días como una familia unida y trabajadora. El trabajo de Carmen consiste en la venta de repuestos en general, su tienda parte de ser comercio, también lo utilizan como lugar de reparaciones y mantenimiento de mototaxis, es una de las más conocidas de la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene muchos clientes, ya que el trabajo que realiza es muy bueno y de mucha calidad, lo cual le ha hecho muy buena fama y que sus clientes la recomienden a otras personas, cuando comenzó con este trabajo era un poco dificultoso ya que tenía muchas dudas y temores, pero con el tiempo fue superándolos y así pudo crecer. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es reparar y dejar todo como nuevo, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que conseguir los repuestos que necesita para hacer un buen arreglo, espera con el tiempo hacer crecer su negocio ya que desea implementar su venta de repuestos ya que desea tener repuestos de todas las marcas. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco9 comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria, espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagara sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará repuestos y herramientas para así implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 28, is a kind, good-hearted, hard-working woman.  She is married to David, 32, and they have a 5-year-old daughter who is the motivation for their effort, work and sacrifice since they want her to have a better lifestyle.  They live in their own home as a united, hard-working family.  Carmen's work consists of spare parts sales in general.  Her store is used partly for sales but also as a motortaxi repair and maintenance shop.  It is one of the most well-known shops in the city of Pucallpa and has many customers.  The work they do is very good and of top quality which has given it a good reputation and customer recommendation.  When she set up the business it was a bit difficult because of her doubts and fears, but with time she overcame them and was able to grow.

What she enjoys most about her work is handling the repairs and making things run like new again.  She has been in business for eight years and believes the hardest part is getting the parts needed to do a good job.  In the future she would like to be able to sell all brands of spare parts.  This is her eighth loan through MFP.  She has always been a good member of her communal bank and is much appreciated for being very responsible and supportive.  She plans to use the loan to continue expanding her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as done with the previous loans.

She plans to use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy spare parts and tools needed in the business so she can keep growing.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz tiene 31 años de edad, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general en el cual esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante, ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales que la visitan. Mariluz es una emprendedora que se arriesgo en tener su propio negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos. Ella está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en mercadería en general para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mariluz, 31, works selling general merchandise as a street vendor. She is now visited by regular and one-time customers. Marliuz is an entrepreneurial woman who started her business because she needed a source of income. 

She is requesting this loan to buy different merchandise to provide to her clients.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Zansi Solange

texts.fr: Zansi Solange âgée de 41 ans, n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Zansi Solange est mariée à un marchand du nom de Antoine. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Zansi Solange vit ensemble avec son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Zansi Solange vend depuis douze ans, du riz et de l’huile végétale dans une région du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Zansi Solange achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Zansi Solange sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 25 year old entrepreneurial young lady who started a business in selling clothes two years ago. She is single and living with her parents and younger brother in a rented apartment located in Beirut. 
While her mother is unemployed, her father works as a construction contractor. Her brother still goes to school and is planning on pursuing a university degree if the family's financial situation allows him. 
Dina is still working from home for the moment, selling clothes for children to her growing network of clients. She is asking for a 1,029,765 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. As a first step, she will be using the loan to buy a winter clothes collection to sell to her clients during the holidays season. At a later stage, her goal is to achieve her business' sustainability as she is hoping to expand from her home-based business to a shop by next year.

loans.use: to buy a winter clothes collection for her business

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.en:
My name is Maria Domitila, I have a small operation making flour tortillas in my house. I have dedicated myself to this business for years and it gives me the income to contribute to the costs of food and education for my son. I am a single mother and with this bueinsss I can give my son what he needs so that he can study, he is now in his third cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre el Maria Domitila, cuento con una mini fabrica de tortilla de harina, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de alimentacion y educacación de mi hijo ya que soy madre soltera y con este negocio puedo darle lo necesario para que mi hijo pueda estudiar, actualmente esta en tercero de ciclo.

loans.use: To purchase flour, lard, baking soda, plastic bags and other supplies.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
My name is Bertha Luis M., and I am a 35-year-old native of Matola, Maputo province. I grew up under the care of my parents; however, the family’s financial situation offered me few schooling opportunities. In 2001 I began working in a stand at kilometer 16. Since 2004 I have come to assume the full administrative duties of my family’s business, and I have also come to own my own commercial establishment. At the start of 2006, with the help of some female colleagues at the market, I met Hluvuku-Adsema and solicited information about the conditions of access to credit for the expansion of my business. Right now my business requires greater capital to respond to the ever-growing services of preparing meals. With this loan I intend to reinforce product stock, thus reducing the number of trips to the city of Maputo and diversifying my client’s menus.

Bertha’s business’ impact on the community is great because beyond providing employment for herself and her niece she prepares meal for more than 100 people who work in close proximity to her establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Luis M. de 35 anos de idade, natural de Matola, província do Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, a situação financeira da família não lhe ofereceu oportunidades para estudar. Em 2001 começou a trabalhar numa barraca em km16. Desde o ano 2004 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família e conta hoje com um estabelecimento comercial. A partir do ano 2006 por conselho de algumas senhoras colegas do mercado teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema tendo aproximado e solicitado informações sobre as condições de acesso ao crédito para ampliação do seu negocio. Actualmente o seu negocio precisa de maior capital para responder a procura cada vez crescente de serviços de confecção de refeições. Com o empréstimo de 10.300,00 mt pretende reforçar o stock em produtos, reduzindo deste modo o número de viagens para cidade de Maputo e diversificar mais o menu das refeições dos seus clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego a ela própria e sua sobrinha, confecciona refeições para mais 100 pessoas que trabalham nas proximidades do seu estabelecimento.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: Farogat R. started her business with selling children's shoes, and then she added clothes. Farogat says that at the beginning she did not think that her business would increase so quickly.  First she purchased only one trading area, and now she needs another one. At this new one, she plans to sell new seasonal women's shoes. Farogat has 3 children. Her husband and eldest son are in Russia.  Her daughter helps her, when she has to go to buy goods. Other days her daughter sews national dresses.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is married with 2 children, 7 and 11 years old. He is an electrician who, after losing his job, decided to start his own business to earn the income he needed to support his family. He offers his services as an electrician. When he started out he had very few tools, which limited his ability to do some of the jobs he was offered, but little by little he has made himself known and thanks to the good service he offers he has succeeded in rapidly growing his clientele.

Francisco is eager to continue growing his business and offering a good service. As a result he is applying for a loan of $200 to use in the purchase of the tools that will allow him to offer additional repairs and to work in a more efficient and rapid manner. He commits to repaying the loan in only 3 months. Be a part of the development of this business. Your help is extremely valuable to Francisco and he sincerely appreciates your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco es casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 11 años de edad, él es técnico electricista y al quedar desempleado, para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera obtener lo necesario para su familia, decidió emprender su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de electricista, comenzó con muy poca herramienta lo que lo limitaba a realizar solo algunos trabajos, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y gracias a la buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado ampliar rápidamente su clientela.

Francisco desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio para lo que esta solicitando un crédito de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta que le permita ofrecer otras opciones de reparación y hacerlos de una manera más rápida y eficiente, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Se parte del desarrollo de este negocio, tu ayuda es de gran utilidad para Francisco y agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy tools which will allow him to take on additional repairs, and complete them more efficiently and rapidly

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Bintu is the mother of two children and has been running her clothing business for the last six years. Bintu is engaged in selling children's clothes and said her business increased tremendously after the previous loan. She sells out of a temporary shelter in the Makeni market.

In the future Bintu would like to repair the shelter she uses to conduct her business in, and right now she is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to increase her stock to have plenty of goods to sell during the Idi, (the Muslim festival that ends the month of Ramadan) next month.

loans.use: Expansion of business inventory to meet impending client demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his aluminium stock.

loans.name: Telesia Fa

texts.en:
Telesia is a lady of twenty five years of age, married with a son. She applied for her loan in order to buy all the ingredients (especially meats) for running her barbecue business. She sells beside the main road of her village three days per week, and she earns $260ST($104USD) per day.

She said that her business helps with her family needs, especially for her kids--all because of the loan she got from this program, because without it she could not run her business. She’s very happy to continue in the future and get more loans from the SPBD program.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her barbecue

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is a tailor by profession. She is 46 years old, married with 3 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO member for 7 years. She is asking for the loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials and clothing to sell. She trained for 4 years and has been in business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials and clothing to sell

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es:
Kathy is 33 years old, and has 2 kids 13 and 9 years old, Frida and Cristian. They mean a lot to her and above all their progress motivates her. Kathy is a fun-loving woman and when she sells her cold drinks to her clients she provides a very friendly and charismatic service, which is the most important to her. Her husband Luis works selling petroleum to boats in the ports. He helps her a lot in all of her decisions and above all in this business. She also sells clothing for country homes of the Ucayali river. Her goal is to increase her quality of life and make the family business better. She hopes the help from your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Kathy de 33 años de edad, tiene 02 hijos de 13 y 09 años de edad de nombres Frida y Cristian, quienes significan mucho para ella y sobre todo se han convertido en el importante motivo de su progreso. Kathy es una mujer súper jovial, pues cuando vende sus bebidas heladas a sus clientes lo hace con mucha amabilidad y carisma ya que la calidad de servicio es lo más importante para ella. Su esposo Luis trabaja vendiendo petróleo a las embarcaciones del puerto y la apoya mucho en todas sus decisiones y sobre todo en este su negocio, ella de manera adicional vende prendas de vestir por los caseríos del río Ucayali.Y su esforzado desempeño tiene el propósito de incrementar su calidad de vida y negocio familiar.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Implementation of her business

loans.name: Uyigue

texts.en:
Uyigue A. is married with 4 children. She is 42 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

Uyigue sells provisions and drinks to earn a living. She has been in business since 2004. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a young and enterprising woman of twenty one years of age. She has sold a variety of biscuits for the past eight years in Mankessim.

Adjoa’s business is doing very well.  Therefore wants to use her loan to purchase more boxes of assorted biscuits and candies to meet customer demand.

She is a member of the group called Stewards. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of assorted biscuits and candies

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina, in her late sixties, is an entrepreneur with a great deal of experience. She’s been selling shoes, boots, and pants for more than twenty years. Six months ago, Alina received her second loan from FSMA, and she used it to increase her inventory. “My efforts and sacrifices were not in vain. My business is very profitable, so I feel like a million dollars," she says smiling.

Alina says she’ll never stop thanking the Kiva community for giving her the opportunity to make that slow but sure change in her life.

With this third loan, Alina will buy more clothing and add new items to her stock so that she can satisfy her customers’ needs and attract more people to her business. Alina wants to have enough money to enjoy her last days in comfort and security.

loans.use: To increase and diversify clothing inventory.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
The business of raising livestock has turned into an activity that provides the most important income for Violeta’s family. She is from the province of Huancané and three years ago moved to the city of Juliaca. Additionally, this diligent young women does agricultural work, inherited from her parents, who, like Violeta, succeed in facing some of their expenses with the fruits Mother Nature gives them. This diligent young woman buys her animals (sheep and cattle) in the districts of Taraco and Huancané. Later she cares for them and feeds them, to increase their weight and size, so that she can sell them in the same towns at higher prices. The economic benefits she has achieved have given her tranquility and her quality of life has improved notably. Violeta is sure that increasing her capital will help her obtain more satisfactory results.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El comercio de ganado se ha convertido en la actividad que le otorga el ingreso económico más importante a la familia de Violeta, quien es natural de la provincia de Huancané y hace más de 3 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a esta labor ésta diligente joven se dedica a la agricultura labores que heredó de sus queridos y humildes padres quienes al igual que Violeta logran afrontar parte de sus gastos con los frutos que les ofrece la madre naturaleza.Esta diligente joven compra sus animalitos (ovinos y vacunos) en los distritos de Taraco y Huancané, luego de cuidarlos y alimentarlos para que obtengan un peso y talla adecuada los procede a vender en los mismos pueblitos a precios más elevados; los beneficios económicos que logra conseguir ha obtenido tranquilidad y su calidad de vida se ha elevado notablemente, Violeta está segura que aumentando su capital logrará obtener resultados más satisfactorios.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater number of animals

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa began her business so that she could have income of our her own and help with family, health, and personal bills. Four years ago, she began selling shoes from a friend's catalog. Later, she bought her own and began selling to her friends and family. Gradually, she was able to develop a list of customers that has generated good income.

Teresa needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, so that she can purchase some orders that she has yet to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa inicio el negocio para tener un ingreso propio para solventar gastos familiares, de salud y personales. Comenzó hace 4 años ofreciendo zapatos de un catalogo de una amiga, después compro el suyo y empezó a ofrecerlo entre amigos y familiares, poco a poco logro tener una cartera de clientes que le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes de entregar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa P., 24, is a single young man from Phnom Penh living with his mother who he helps support. He operates a trailer transport service that is attached to his motorbike and typically makes US$3 per day transporting garment factory workers and others who are traveling short distances. He can usually be found near the local food market, where his business is pretty good, however, it has suffered lately, because his motorbike is in need of repair. His motorbike is really his livelihood and he has asked for a loan of US$150 to repair it.

loans.use: Soa would like to repair his motorbike for his trailer transport service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a collection of clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Bony

texts.en:
Mrs. Bony S., 52, and her husband, Mr. It Un, 53, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1975 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two of their sons are married and live outside the family home. One son is a monk and the youngest son studies at the local school. Their daughter is assisting her mother in the grocery business. 

Mrs. Bony has been a rice farmer since she was young and started her grocery business two years ago. She buys them from the market across from her village for resale at her home, while Mr. It is a rice farmer.

Mrs. Bony is requesting a loan to purchase grocery items for resale and buy rice seed and fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Irshad  M. Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is the wife of M. I. and lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son sells wood. Her younger son is in the 3rd standard grade. Her daughter is in kindergarten. 

Irshad baji's husband is a delivery man by profession. He loads fruits and vegetables on his donkey cart and delivers them to different areas of the city. Irshad baji is applying for a loan to buy another donkey cart because their old cart has broken and become unusable.

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Rahmat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Shakooran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for loading

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
A. Akossiwa est une jeune fille célibataire âgée de 26 ans. Elle a pour activité la vente des ustensiles en plastiques et des verres à boire. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana où les articles sont vendus à un prix réduit.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons d’ustensiles de cuisine et des glacières.
texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa A., age 26, is young and unmarried. Her work involves selling plastic utensils and drinking glasses. She gets her supplies in Ghana, where goods are sold at a reduced price. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 5 boxes of kitchen utensils and some insulated coolers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in underwear for a small business.

loans.name: Dede

texts.fr: Dede M. est propriétaire d’une boutique de boissons à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Afin de répondre aux besoins sans cesse croissante de la clientèle, Dede désire, avec ce crédit, réapprovisionner sa boutique avec de nouveaux produits. Cette occasion lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits qui lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Dede M. owns a refreshment store in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Forty years old, she is married and the mother of three children. Due to ever-increasing demand for her drinks, Dede will use this loan to restock her store with new product. This will allow her to increase her sales and thus her profits, thereby improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshments for resale.

loans.name: Désiré

texts.fr: Désiré K. est un jeune homme de 47 ans, mari é et père de 5 enfants. Il est propriétaire d’une imprimerie depuis 10 ans et fournit à sa clientèle un service très prompt. Pour gagner plus la confiance de ses clients, Désiré souhaite avec ce crédit acheter les matières premières indispensables à l’exécution de son activité et une machine. Dans la photo, il est situé à droite habillé en chemise raillée en bleu.
texts.en:
Désiré K. is a young man, 47 years of age, married, and the father of five. He has been the owner of a printing shop for ten years and provides his customers with very prompt service. To earn more of their trust, he would like to use this loan to buy a machine and some basic indispensable supplies for carrying out his work. In the photo, he is on the right in a shirt with blue stripes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic supplies and a machine

loans.name: Chadulu K Group

texts.en:
Martha has been a clothes seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 7 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 250. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to improve her home.

Martha is 40 years old, married, and has six children: aged between 24 and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Rose, Zainabu, Maria, and Anna. Each woman has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad H. is 33 years old. He is married with three children. Elshad has been selling men’s shoes for eight years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop and establish himself in the central market of Sabirabad.

He is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. Elshad's business has profited from his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Elshad needs a loan of $1,200 USD, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients.

You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Elshad thanks everyone for help and support!

loans.use: Purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Mr Seydou B. est marié à deux femmes, père de 2 enfants (1garçon et 1fille). Il est né vers 1972 à Tousseguela une des communes de la préfecture de Kolondièba, 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Il vit avec ses épouses et leurs enfants à Kadiolo quartier Noumousso.
Il est commerçant  depuis 4 ans et vend essentiellement des céréales et quelques fois de petits articles. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activité, il le fait avec beaucoup de réussite.
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le premier prêt  a été bien remboursé. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt ,   500 kg de maïs, 500 kg de sorgho et d’autres  articles. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants  Kadiolo. Il vend au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Souvent il vend ses céréales sur commande.
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  prétend construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou B. is married to two women, and the father of two children (one boy and one girl). He was born circa 1972 in Tousseguela, one of the towns in the Kolondièba prefecture, third administrative region of Mali. He lives with his spouses and their children in Kadiolo, a neighborhood in Sikasso. He's been a merchant for 4 years, and mostly sells cereals and, occasionally, small items. Experienced thanks to his years in this business, he runs it with much success. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. The first loan was repaid without problems.

With this loan, he intends to buy 500 kg of corn, 500 kg or sorghum, and other items. He gets his supplies in the villages surrounding Kadiola, and sells for cash and on credit, both retail and wholesale, to a clientele comprising women and men. Often, he sells cereals on order. He expects to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used in part to bolster his working capital. The other part will be put aside, because he wants to build a home to live in Sikasso city.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 500 kg of corn, 500 kg or sorghum, and other items

loans.name: Kele Oyella Agnes Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Agnes is a married woman, aged 36 years, and blessed with 5 kids (all boys) and 2 orphans who are schooling. She has been making local brew for over 10 years. O. Agnes will use this loan to purchase yeast, millet flour, and sorghum flour for making local brew. She is doing well because she is able to pay school fees for her children and has improved her farm productivity. Her dream is educating her kids.

loans.use: To purchase yeast, millet flour, and sorghum flour for making local brew

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Lucky is forty-five years old and married with four children. He is a farmer and he also sells yams. He is requesting a  loan to purchase more yams to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
“You don’t get anywhere standing still. That has always been my motto for life,” says Jason.

Jason has been in the entertainment and music industry for over 15 years, but it was the current popularity of TV singing and dance competitions that inspired him to turn his passion for hip hop music and dance into his own business and an opportunity for local artists. Jason launched Bay Area Battle Tactics, a local competition for singers, dancers, and DJs that can help them gain recognition beyond the San Francisco Bay Area. Jason taught himself graphic design and created his own website to advertise the company, and he recruited friends in the entertainment industry to volunteer and get the project off the ground. 

With a $6,000 loan, Jason can create and distribute flyers and posters, hold auditions, purchase DJ and sound equipment, and hire part-time employees. He hopes that his business will also help reduce inner-city gang violence and unify diverse communities by providing a creative outlet for local youth through music, song, and dance.

Visit http://www.bayareabattletactics.com

Watch of video of Jason: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hZnAmIJraZo&feature=channel_page

loans.use: Promotional activities, marketing campaign, website development, and equipment

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдуджалил 1976 года рождения , женат имеет 2 детей.  Имеет среднее образование.  Когда женился отец подарил машину, и ему пришла идея использовать машину как такси. Но и этого мало для того что бы прокормить большую семью.  Абдуджалил  также занялся торговлей посуды. Также машину использовали для перевозки своего товара. Когда Абдуджалил уезжает за товаром отец  продолжает использовать машину как такси. А жена в его отсутствии торгует в магазине. 
Кредит  получил для покупки нового товара с Китая.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, Abdujalil 1976 is married and has two children. He achieved secondary education. When he got married, his father gave him a car and the idea came to him to use the car as a taxi. But this is not enough to support a large family. Abdujalil is also engaged in the trade of cookware. The car is also used as transportation for his goods. When Abdujalil goes out to sell his goods, his father continues to use the car as a taxi. In his absence, his wife sells in the store. The loan received will be used to purchase new goods from China.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cookware

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda A. is from the village of Tu-od, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is fifty-two years old and married to Cesar A.. They have three grown children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport service (habal-habal) to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be Yolanda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Magdalena Asuncion

texts.es: Magdalena de 57 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Nuevos Horizontes ubicada en el Sistema Penitenciario de Juigalpa donde imparte del pan del saber a los reclusos de ahi desde hace 10 años, tiene 34 años de servicio en Educacion, esta solicitando su credito Nº 17 para mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado, y con las lluvias se le moja parte de los cuartos de su casa.  Cabe señalar que doña Magdalena fue beneficiada con el fondo Kiva en el ultimo credito cancelado, pero lo habia solicitado para su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y cosmeticos.   Su mayor sueño es mejorar poco a poco su vivienda para vivir con condiciones aunque pequeña cuando se jubile.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 57 years old, single, and has 3 adult children. She is a teacher at the New Horizons School located in the Juigalpa prison system. Sra. Magadalena has been teaching inmates for 10 years and has a total of 34 years of experience in education.

She is requesting her 17th loan to replace the roof of her house. It is in such poor condition that the rooms of her house become soaked whenever it rains. Please note that Sra. Magdalena received a previous Kiva loan for her clothing and cosmetics business. Her greatest dream is to gradually make improvements to her home so that her living conditions are adequate when she retires.

Here is the link to Magdalena’s previous Kiva loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=45364&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof

loans.name: Flor Maritza

texts.es:
Flor tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja eventualmente r como obrero D. construcción civil, y sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Sime, ubicado en el distrito D. Pítipo, a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace ocho años ella tiene un negocio D. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.), abarrotes y verduras que funciona en su casa, esta bodega – tienda es muy frecuentada por sus vecinos y pobladores D. los caseríos adyacentes. Ella viaja todos los miércoles a la ciudad D. Chiclayo para comprar los productos que luego venderá a sus clientes.

Ella piensa en ampliar su negocio viajando mas a menudo a la ciudad D. Chiclayo para comprar más productos y surtir su tienda, por este motivo está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles. Esta es la segunda vez que Flor trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable.

Flor desea brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad D. seguir estudiando y superarse, ellos, como todos los niños D. la zona que aún estudian, tienen que viajar todos los dias al pueblo mas cercano por un camino accidentado para asistir a clases, por lo que invertir en su educación es una labor que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband works on contract as a construction worker. They live in the village of Sime, which is located in the District of Pítipo, located 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For eight years, she has been in the business of selling basic necessities (rice, sugar, oil, etc.), groceries, and vegetables from her home. Her grocery store is frequently visited by her neighbors and residents of the adjacent villages. Flor travels to the city of Chiclayo every Wednesday to buy the products she sells to her customers.

She believes in expanding her business, so she must travel more often to Chiclayo to buy more products to fill her store. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of 1000 soles from our Institution. This is the second time she has received a loan from us and has proven herself to be a responsible client.

Flor wants to give her children the opportunity to continue studying and improving themselves. Like all the other children in the area, they must travel every day to the nearest town along the emergency road in order to attend classes. Flor knows that investing in her children’s education is a job that requires much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 56 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 5 hijos (3 a su cargo), estudio secundaria completa, vive en  la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino, que luego de mejorarlos los venderá en las ferias semanales la Sra. Juana tambien se dedica a la venta de productos de la Region.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Beloclaide Enoque

texts.pt:
Beloclaide Enoque Macie B. tem 30 anos de idade estudou ate 10ª classe é solteiro pai de 1 filho de apenas 1 ano e meio. Responsabiliza se pela sua tia enviando lhe 500.00MT em cada três meses e consegue mensalmente poupar 1.000.00MT.

Quando sai de Gaza com seus pais para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, inicia os estudos e faz a 10ª classse, mas teve que interromper quando engravida a sua namorada. Assim seu pai da lhe um fundo para iniciar o negocio de criação de frangos para conseguir sustentar a sua família. Anos depois arranja um emprego numa empresa de segurança privada. É funcionário permanente ha. mais de cinco anos trabalha em turnos auferindo 2.600 mensalmente. 

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Beloclaide na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 8.000.00MT que será usado para aumentar o volume de criação (compra de pintos de 1 dia e ração para produção de frangos). Tem metido em média de 2caixasx100pintos em cada fase (15 em15 dias), pois ele tem vendido alternadamente para não perder a clientela. Gastando em cada fase um valor de 14.000.00MT obtendo de lucro um valor de 4.000.00MT quando vende a grosso para revendedores, e de 6.000.00MT quando vende por unidade a consumidores locais.

 Já teve com uma outra instituição de credito (Banco Novo) no valor de 4.000.00MT pagou com muito sucesso, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro empréstimo para construção de dependências para aluguer uma vez que este serviço é muito solicitado pelos alunos e trabalhadores que vem de outros distritos.
texts.en:
Beloclaide Enoque Macie B. is 30 years old and he's the single father of a 1 year old boy. He also takes care of his aunt, sending her 500.00MT every month, and he's still able to save 1.000,00MT. He left Gaza with his parents and moved to the village of Namaacha, where he had to drop school on 10th grade when he got his girlfriend pregnant. His father gave him money to start his own chicken raising business so he could support his family. A few years later he got a job as a security guard, where he's been working for the past 5 years and makes 2.600,00MT per month. This is Beloclaide's first loan with Kiva in the amount of 8.000,00MT (U$ 300) which he is using to buy more chicks and ration to feed them, so he can grow his business. He is confident that he will pay it back before the due date, and he is planning on taking another loan later on in order to build rooms to rent to students and workers that come to his town from other districts.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 day old chicks and ration to feed them

loans.name: Jamish

texts.en:
Jamish is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of her three children attend a local secondary school. Her husband operates a taxi service in their town, and Jamish has a rented stall at a local market from which she sells clothing.

Her husband started his business in 2003 and after his business became successful, Jamish managed to start her clothing business in 2006. Their stable businesses enabled them to upgrade their car this year. Her husband's taxi service business earns around $1.40 to $3.50 a day. Jamish is planning to expand her stall into a little shop and to trade in their car for a Japanese make. For that reason she is working hard every single day. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de  huit femmes (4 veuves et 4 mariées) vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 58 ans, 5 enfants  et habitant  le quartier Djaka (Kirango) de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali : Ségou). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage et exercent comme activité génératrice de revenus l’achat vente et la transformation de poissons. Actuellement elles se sont organisées en  coopérative de transformatrices de poisson initiée par l’A.N.P.E. (Agence Nationale Pour L’Emploi). Elles ont reçus  des  formations portant sur les différentes méthodes de transformation et de conservation des poissons dans les mesures d’hygiène suivant les normes du  BIT (Bureau International du Travail). Elles bénéficièrent alors de deux fours modernes et des séchoirs. 
Après 4 prêts solidaires auprès de Soro Yiriwaso, tous bien remboursés, elles sont à leur 5ème prêt de groupe. 
Ce prêt leur permettra d’acheter, 80 paniers de poissons et 200 barres de glace. Elles s’approvisionnent  en poissons frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger, elles les trient, une bonne partie de ce poisson est séchée ou fumée. Le poisson frais se vend sur place, à Ségou ville (marché château), à Bamako,  Koutiala et Sikasso. Le poisson séché est surtout vendu à Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango et à Ségou. Une  partie est conservée jusqu’à la décrue où elles gagnent plus d’argent. Le poisson fumé est essentiellement vendu à Ségou. Les ventes se font généralement au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 81.300 FCFA qui servira à augmenter le volume de leurs activités, à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux (habillements, savon, pétrole) et à participer aux évènements sociaux (baptême, mariage et décès). 
Elles ont pour ambition une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Benkadi is an association of eight women (4 widowed and 4 married) who live in large traditional families.  The women average 58 years of age and 5 children each. And they live in the Djaka district (Kirango) of Markala (4th administrative region of Mali: Ségou).  They know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community.  Their income-generating work involves the buying and selling of fish and the processing of it.  Currently, the women are organized into a cooperative of fish processors initiated by A.N.P.E. (a national jobs agency).  They've received training on the different methods for processing and preserving fish, insofar as hygienic standards per the BIT (international bureau of work).  The women were then the recipients of two modern ovens and some dryers.  After four solidarity loans with Soro Yiriwaso, all repaid, the women are now on their fifth group loan  This loan will enable them to purchase 80 baskets of fish and 200 bars of ice.  Supplies of fresh fish are gotten locally on the banks of the Niger River.  The fish are sorted, and much of it is dried or smoked.  The fresh fish is sold locally in Segou City (Château Market), Bamako, Koutiala, and Sikasso.  The dried fish is most of all sold in Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango, and Segou.  A portion is kept until the waters recede, when the women earn more money.  The smoked fish is sold essentially in Segou.  Sales are made generally in cash at the retail level and on credit.  The customers are composed of women and men.  The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 81,300 francs CFA that will be used to increase their business volume, to satisfy sundry family needs (clothing, soap, fuel), and to assist with social events (baptisms, marriages, and funerals).  Their ambition is to have a house in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou T. est un sociétaire de la caisse de Ouakam.Il a choisi l’activité de commerce par amour .Il capitalise une expérience de un mois dans la gestion de sa boutique. Il est marie et père de trois enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3 et 7ans. Sa femme est vendeuse de café touba.Généralement de 7h du matin jusqu'à 00h il vaque a ses occupations de commerçant.Il est parvenu a épargner un fond qui lui a permis de démarrer les activités de sa boutique. Il assure mensuellement un revenu qui varie entre 300 000 et 400 000frs, mais il prévoit de les doubler après son financement. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement et diversifier ses produits et services par l’achat de sacs d’oignons et de pommes de terre. Son souhait est de maximiser ses bénéfices-
texts.en:
Mamadou T. is a member of the branch office of Ouakam. He chose work in commerce for the love of it. He capitalizes on a month of experience in managing his store. He is married and the father of three children, aged 3 to 7 years. His wife is a seller of café touba. Generally, from 7:00 AM until midnight, he is busy with his work in commerce. He managed to save funds enabling him to start operating his store. In monthly revenues, he makes from 300,000 to 400,000 francs. But he anticipates doubling this after his financing. He’s requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase his working capital and to diversify his products and services by purchasing sacks of onions and potatoes. He wishes to maximize his profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.en: The Women's Committee (Mujeres Solidarias) was formed on November 15, 2006. The initiative of Aida Luz R., who sells jewelry, brought 16 women together after contacting the local counselor on female entrepreneurship. This group is in their 10th loan cycle, working successfully and supporting each other in their enterprises.  The average loan in the group is Gs 1,005,263 per member, used for various sales activities such as food, haberdashery, goods for the pantry, clothes, fruit, cakes, and jewelry, and the operation of a kiosk selling rice, sugar, noodles, milk, bakery, etc.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Brisas De Nacaome Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario denominado las brisas de nacaome, esta integrado por tres personas un varon y dos damas, quienes se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, ellos venden sus productos en el mercado municipal de Nacaome Valle
 
el señor Eulalio C. es padre de 5 hijos, esta casado con Maria Teodora B., quien le ayuda a vender las frutas y verduras en su puesto cuando el viaja a tegucigalpa a comprar, con la ayuda de este negocio han salido adelante y han criado a sus hijos , aunque aun tienen 2 pequeños, esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su negocio.
 
la señora Marcelina B. es viuda, es madre de dos hijos ya mayores, uno de ellos esta en estados unidos y el otro vive en otra ciudad, se dedica al servicio de moler maiz en su molino. En las tardes sale a vender ropa usada en los barrios cercanos a su domicilio, esta solicitando el credito para poder reparar uno de sus molinos. 
 
la señora Lidia B. es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos pequeños y se dedica a la venta de sandalias, zapatos y otras prendas de vestir en su puesto ubicado en las afueras del mercado municipal de Nacaome, esta actividad le ha servido para salir adelante con sus hijos, su deseo es terminar de contruir su casa. Esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su inventario, ya que en la epoca de navidad las ventas suben.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called “Las Brisas de Nacaome” (The Breezes of Nacaome) consists of three people, one man and two women. They have known each other a long time and sell their products at the city market in Nacome Valley.

Sr. Eulalio C. is the father of five children and married to Sra. Maria Teodora B.. His wife sells fruits and vegetables from their vending stand while he travels to Tegucigalpa to buy the inventory. With the help of this business, they have been able to move forward and raise their children of whom two are still young. He is requesting this loan so that he can restock his business a bit more.

Sra. Marcelina B. is a widow and the mother of two grown children. One of them is in the United States while the other lives in another city. She has a grain mill and offers services to grind corn. In the afternoons, she sells used clothing in the poor neighborhoods near her home. She is requesting a loan so that she can repair one of her milling machines.

Sra. Lidia B. is a single mother with three small children. She sells sandals, shoes, and clothing from her vending post on the outskirts of the Nacaome Municipal Market. This business has allowed her children to get ahead. Lidia hopes to finish the construction of her house. She is requesting a loan to purchase a little more inventory because her sales go up during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Djekabaara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekabaara est composé de quatre femmes (3 veuves et 1 mariée) ayant en moyenne 44 ans, 7 enfants  et vivant dans des familles polygames dans le quartier Pelengana Extension de la ville de Ségou  4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités commerciales. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers et la fabrication du pain local appelé  ‘Takoula.’’ 
Après avoir correctement remboursés tous les six prêts précédents, elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt  solidaire.
 Ce nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter,  4 paires de rideaux, 3 paires de draps en coton,10 pièces de pagnes fancy, 4 sacs de mil, des condiments alimentaires (notamment : 1 panier de tomate fraîche, ½ panier de gros piment frais,1/2 panier de poivron,1 sac de poudre de feuilles de baobab,1 paquet de cubes maggi poulet),  4 sacs de mil, 5kg de farine de blé, 5kg de sucre, 4 paquets de levure, 6kg de gingembre, 2kg de sel de cuisine et 250g de « fèfè » 
Elles s’approvisionnent en draps, rideaux, en pagnes fancy,  au marché château de Ségou, en condiments alimentaires à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou, en mil à Semembougou  et les ingrédients nécessaires à la préparation du ‘’Takoula’’  dans les boutiques de la place. 
Le ‘’ Takoula’’ s’obtient en faisant un mélange de farine de mil (10kg) et la farine de blé (2kg), on y ajoute du sucre, de la levure, du sel, du gingembre et du « fèfè », malaxer ce mélange avec de l’eau jusqu’à obtenir une pâte, laisser quelques temps puis en faire des boules de cinq et les faire cuir à la vapeur dans une marmite percée et qui sont vendues essentiellement les vendredis. 
Les articles sont vendus au grand marché de Ségou, au marché château,  à domicile et en ambulant dans le quartier. La vente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso et à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The group Djekabaara is composed of four women (3 widows and 1 married), who are on average 44 years old, with an average of 7 children each and who live in polygamous families in the neighborhood of Pelengana Extension in the town of Ségou, in the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through the neighborhood and through their businesses. This group of women sells a variety of articles and bakes a local type of bread known as "Takoula". Having correctly repaid their previous 6 loans, they are requesting their 7th loan. They will use this loan to purchase 4 sets of curtains, 3 sets of cotton sheets, 10 sets of fancy "pagnes" (brightly colored cotton cloth), 4 sacks of millet, various condiments (notably: 1 crate of fresh tomatoes, 1/2 a crate of large fresh hot peppers, 1/2 a crate of peppers, 1 sack of powdered baobab tree leaves, 1 packet of maggi chicken stock cubes), 4 sacks of millet, 5 kilograms of wheat flour, 5 kilos of sugar, 4 packets of yeast, 6 kilos of ginger, 2 kilos of cooking salt and 250 grams of "fèfè" (a spice which can be used as a substitute for black pepper). They will supply themselves with curtains, fabric and fancy "pagnes" from the market house of Ségou, for condiments they supply themselves from the weekly food market in Ségou, millet from Semembougou and the necessary ingredients for the preparation of ‘’Takoula’’ from the local stores. The ‘’ Takoula’’ is made using a mixture of millet flour (10kg) and wheat flour (2kg), then they add some sugar, yeast, salt, ginger and "fèfè". They mix these ingredients with water until it is a dough; they leave it for a whole and then separate it into five balls and steam it in a pot. They mostly sell the product on Fridays. They sell their items in the large market of Ségou, within the market house, from their homes and walking throughout the neighborhood. They sell their goods at retail for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women. They hope to realize a monthly income of 15,500 FCFA each, which they will use to repay Soro Yiriwaso for their loans and take care of family expenses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Frnacisco Benito

texts.es: Francisco Benito tiene 51 años de edad, este Señor se dedica a la actividad económica de elaboración de tornos, hace más de 28 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que cuando inicio fue muy difícil el no contaba con los ingresos necesarios además de esto tenia ciertas herramientas pero no eran suficientes para elaborar las piezas que le solicitaban, pero esto no esto no detuvo a Francisco pues el busco ayuda por medio de los financiamientos y han sido estos los que le han dado la ayuda necesaria. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales para realizar piezas. Su deseo es seguir con la actividad económica ya que de aquí depende su estabilidad.
texts.en:
Francisco Benito is 51-years-old. For the past 28 years he has been in business making parts with his lathe. It was very hard when he started out because he didn't have enough income, and while he did have some of the tools he needed, he didn't have enough to make the parts people were asking for. This didn't discourage Francisco, though, and he sought help through loans, which have given him just the help he needs. He is currently requesting a loan for working capital, so he can buy materials to make parts. His wish is to continue with his work because his stability depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Osmar Daniel

texts.es: El señor Osmar Daniel, habitante de colonia san Miguel, su familia esta conformada por el y 2 hijos menores;  desde muy pequeño su principal actividad ha sido la ganaderia, el necesita de este financiamiento para retener 4 terneros, de manera que  pueda generar mejores ganancias a la hora de la comercializacion de dichos animales, que le sirva para solventar algunas necesidades en la familia, sus hijos coloboran en las actividades de su pequeña finca, el mayor anhelo de Osmar es aumentar su pequeño hato ganadero con el fin que a futuro sus condiciones economicas le permita vivir una vida mas comoda.
texts.en:
Señor Osmar Daniel lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. His family consists of himself and 2 minor children. Recently his primary work has been with livestock. He needs this financing in order to raise 4 calves, so that he can generate more profits when the animals are sold. This will allow him to take care of family necessities. His children work with him on his small farm. Osmar's greatest wish is to enlarge his little herd of cattle so he will have an economic situation that would allow them a more comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising calves

loans.name: Maïmounata

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmounata Diallo  est une femme mariée de 29 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants  à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée à l’activité  de teinture auprès  d’une  des  grandes teinturière  de la place depuis plus de deux  ans. Elle réjouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (Mariage, baptême, fêtes, etc.). 
Ses ressources financières propres ne peuvent pas lui permettre de satisfaire sa clientèle.  C’est ainsi, qu’elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter, 8 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 boites de teintures de couleurs différentes et 10 sachets de soude caustique.    
 Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les gros commerçants en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teintures) pour les mettre en couleur et ensuite les revendre soit au comptant ou à crédit, elle a pour clients, les revendeuses des bazins teintés, les couturiers et les femmes de son quartier.
Madame Maïmounata D.est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis depuis plus de sept  ans. Après  4 prêts solidaires  avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son 7ème prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 250 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, payer les intérêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maïmounata Diallo, age 29, is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After running several unsuccessful businesses, she got started two years ago in the tinting business, with one of the famous local dyer. She enjoys a strong reputation in this business, and gets many orders, especially for celebrations (wedding, baptism, etc.). Her own financial resources do no enable her to meet customer demand. This is why she's seeking this loan, in order to buy 8 pieces of white Bazin fabric, 10 boxes of dyes of different colors, and 10 sachets of sodium hydroxide. She gets her supplies locally, from wholesalers (white Bazins, sodium hydroxide, and dyes), tint the fabrics, and resell them, for cash or on credit. Her customers are resellers of tinted Bazins, tailors, and women of her neighborhood. Mrs. Maïmounata D.has been associated with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, for more than seven years. After four group loans with a group of women of her neighborhood, she's now seeking her seventh individual loan. All previous loans were repaid without problems. With this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 250'000 (ca US$ 500), to be used to pay her personal expenses, help her husband with the family expenses, repay the loan, and bolster her tinting business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 pieces of white Bazin fabric, 10 boxes of dyes of different colors, and 10 sachets of sodium hydroxide

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This entrepreneur sells household products. He is 53 years old and married, and he has six children. He opened this shop in his house to be the source of income for his family. He has a good reputation in the district and a kind and delicate style of the bargaining with his customers. As a result, he is the best at selling household supplies to the neighbors and the passersby. He is the breadwinner of a huge family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and a refrigerator

loans.name: Marie Agnése

texts.en:
Marie Agnése N. is 78 years old, married, and lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for thirteen years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Madame N. raises cattle which she sells at the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. With this loan, she plans to buy calves to raise.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr: H. Léocadie est née le 09 Décembre 1952 à Parakou dans le Nord du Bénin. Léocadie vit depuis 43 ans au quartier Wologuèdè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léocadie est mariée à ADOUKONOU Célestin et a des enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Léocadie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Léocadie vend des poissons frits, des condiments de sauce et de l'huile de palme et d'arachide à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Léocadie achète ses divers produits. Léocadie voudrait renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est pour cette raison que Léocadie sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Léocadie H. is born on December 9, 1952 in Parakou, in the north of Benin. She has been living for 43 years in the Wologuède district of Cotonou, the economic capital o Benin. Léocadie is married to Célestin Adoukonou and has children, all of whom go to school. Lóecadie lives together with her husband and children. The couple share responsibility for the family expenses. In order to provide for her family needs, Léocadie sells fried fish, food sauces, palm oil and peanut oil, from her home. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Léocadie would like to boost her business and better respond to customer demand in order to increase her revenues. This is the reason she is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing palm oil, peanut oil and food sauces (for resale)

loans.name: Abd Allah

texts.en:
Abd Allah is a 35-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Abd Allah has been selling frames and paintings for fifteen years.
