He likes art and offers a big variety of paintings from all different genres. He paints, but doesn’t sell his paintings because he likes it and it is his hobby. 

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase paintings and frames. Abd Allah has been a micro-credit client for nine years and has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to improve his sales and expand his stock.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of clients because he wasn’t known by the public, but he knew how to enlarge his network.

loans.use: To purchase paintings and frames

loans.name: Subanova Saltanat Group

texts.ru:
У Салтанат есть собственное кафе, где она предоставляет услуги общественного питания. Этим делом она занимается вот уже на протяжении последних 12 лет. В бизнесе помогает ей супргу. У нее 3 детей. В основном они готовят национальные блюда. Кредит запрашивается для улучшения инфраструктуры кафе, чтобы привлечь большее количество посетителей. 

Сурмакан, 53, замужем. Ее супруг занимается частным извозом. У нее 7 детей. Клиент занимается животноводством. На кредит она планирует купить теленка.

Иният 41 год. Она разведенная мать 4 детей. Дочь работает в РФ, а остальные сыновья учаться в средней школе. Клиент работает в кафе "Акжол", продает орех. Кредит запрашивается для пополнения запасов ореха. 

Гулкан, 28, замужем. ЕЕ супруг находится в России на заработках, каждый месяц присылает деньги для поддержания семьи. Кроме этого клиент сама зарабатывает деньги, работая поварихой. В месяц получает 70 долларов. На кредит она планирует купить МРС для домашнего разведения.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Saltanat owns a café, where she provides public food service. She has been involved in this business over the course of the last 12 years. Her husband helps her with the business. Saltanat has 3 children. She primarily cooks national dishes at the café. She is requesting the loan in order to improve the café infrastructure and to attract a large number of customers. Surmakan is 53 years old, married. Her husband is involved in private transportation. She has 7 children. The client is involved in animal husbandry. She plans to use this loan to buy a calf. Iniyat is 41 years old. She is a divorced mother of 4 children. Her daughter works in the Russian Federation, and the sons attend a secondary school. The client works at the “Akjol” café and sells nuts. She is requesting the loan in order to replenish the stock of nuts. Gulkan is 28 years old, married. Her husband works in Russia and sends money home every month in order to support the family. Besides this, the client earns money herself, working as a cook. She makes 70 dollars per month. She plans to use the loan to buy small livestock to breed at home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve cafe infrastructure

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es: Eudosia, de 29 años, vive con su conviviente y tiene dos hijos pequeños.Juntos viven en una pequeña localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa que es propia y esta echa a base de madera.Eudosia siempre ha priorizado la calidad  de sus productos agrícolas. Siembra cacao , y se preocupa porque sea de calidad , y siempre esta  introduciendo nuevas técnicas de cultivo .De muy joven sus padres le ofrecieron un pequeño terreno donde pudiera  labrar la tierra y sembrar, pero gracias a la ayuda de su pareja sacaron real provecho de la tierra, a su vez era realista que con un pequeño terreno de cultivo no iba lograr cubrir las necesidades  familiares. En la actualidad  tiene un terreno de cultivo más grande y también ha mejorado las ventas de sus porductos con respecto a otras épocas . Eudosia reconoce que  ha dado el primer paso para lograr el éxito y aspira en expandir su cacao  en zonas estratégicas, para obtener mayores ganancias. Por lo general vende sus productos en los grandes centros de acopio de su  localidad, y la  mayor parte del tiempo comparte labores con su esposo, pero en tiempo  de siembra o cosecha contrata la ayuda de peones que le facilitan el trabajo.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y asegura cumplirá  responsablemente con los pagos de sus cuotas , además agradece a su banco comunal por la solidaridad que existe entre todos los integrantes.Eudosia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de seguir aumentando su productividad .
texts.en:
Eudosia is 29 years old, lives with her husband, and has 2 small children. Together they live in a small village located in the beautiful rainforest town of Ayacucho where they have their own house on a wood foundation. Eudosia has always placed a high priority on the quality of her agricultural products. She grows cocoa beans and stays busy with this responsibility and frequently tries out new methods of agriculture. From a young age, her parents offered her a small piece of land where she could experiment and grow products. Now thanks to the help of her husband, she now gets a lot out of her land, whereas before she could not realistically grow enough to cover the needs of her family. Currently, she has a bigger piece of land and has improved her sales from the past. Eudosia recognizes that she has been given the first step toward achieving success and she aspires to expand her cocoa bean sales to strategic places that will earn her more profits. In general, she sells her products by the bunch in the central market of her town. For the most part, she works with her husband, but during the sowing and harvesting season, she hires laborers to help with the work. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she promises that she will responsibly make all of her payments. Moreover, she appreciates the partnership with the community bank that is there for all community members. Eudosia plans to invest her money in the purchase of more agricultural land with the intent to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Heyd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more agricultural land

loans.name: Luchando Con Esperanza  1,2 Group

texts.en:
Yesenia is the coordinator of her group Luchando Con Esperanza (Fighting with Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast, where the economy is based around tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Yesenia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to invest in her business which, in true entrepreneurial spirit, is a combination cafeteria and boutique. She plans to buy rice for the cafeteria and pants, blouses and shirts to sell in the boutique. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing school supplies and uniforms and she will also save towards expanding her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, pants, blouses and shirts

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 53 años de edad, casada y comparte su vida con su pareja que tiene ya un hijo de primer compromiso, ambos tienen un hijo y juntos viven en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace ya varios años, en la venta de pan, el cual compra al por mayor para posteriormente venderlo por unidad en la zona en la que vive. Desde entonces, se levanta muy temprano, a las 4 de la mañana para adquirir pan suficiente y luego venderlos de manera minoritaria. Este trabajo le es ventajo, puesto que no se hay una panadería cerca y muchos no pueden ir tan lejos para conseguir este alimento. Ella se siente contenta y tranquila ya que gracias a su trabajo se mantiene ocupada y puede brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. En un futuro le gustaría poner un negocio más fijo, puesto que sabe que la zona en la que vive es de difícil acceso. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito, comprará mayor cantidad de panes para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lucila is 53 years old, married, and lives with her partner who has a child from his first marriage. They both have a son and live in their own home. For many years now she has been selling bread. She buys it wholesale to later sell it individually in the area where she lives.To date, she wakes up at four in the morning to get enough bread to resell. This job is profitable since there are no other bakeries nearby and many customers are not able to go very far to buy this product. She feels happy and relieved for having her job because it keeps her busy and she can offer her family a good quality of life. In the future she would like to put up a business that is more stable, since she knows that the area in which she lives is not easily accessible. This is her eighth loan with MFP and has always characterized herself as being punctual with her payments. With the loan, she will buy a larger quantity to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more bread to resell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina es comerciante, se dedica a recoger botellas de plástico, y su comercialización en las empresas que reciclan esas botellas.
 Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Caliri de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de bolsas y botellas de plástico)
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Avelina is a merchant. She gathers plastic bottles, and she sells them to businesses that recycle these bottles. Her home is located in the Caliri area of the city of La Paz. The loan is for working capital (buy plastic bags and bottles). She is a long time client of Impro; she has been a client since June, 2008. Her record classifies her as Client 1. That means she has good payment history, which allows her to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic bags and bottles for her business of selling plastic bottles to recycling businesses

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en: In Svay Prey village in Takeo province has four members who are made up a group loan. Mrs. Sophat M. is a group leader who is 52-year-old, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also a chicken breeder. Her problem is that her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Sophat M. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she buys more chickens. She is widow with three children, two of whom are farmers, while the other is a seamstress in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Azima's Group

texts.en:
Azima A. is the leader of this group. She is 76 and a widow. She has raised a son, who is 53 and works as a private driver. In order to make money, Azima has been breeding livestock since 1990. She buys sheep at a low price and then resells them after fattening. Azima makes 1,000 KGS per month. With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase two sheep for breeding. In the future, she plans to increase the number of her livestock.

Kulpunai G., 22, is married and has a newborn daughter. Since 2000, Kulpunai and her husband have been engaged in wholesale trading of fruits and vegetables. They started with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS and now make 9,000 KGS per month. Kuplunai applied for this loan because she wants to increase her business turnover and purchase various fruits and vegetables in order to resell them at a higher price.

Kadirjan S., 53, is married and has a son and a daughter. His son works in construction and his daughter helps at home with the housework. Kadirjan and his wife have been engaged in cattle breeding for 20 years, selling cattle after fattening them. Kadirjan makes 2,000 KGS per month. With the money received from this loan, he wants to purchase a bull for breeding.

Santalat A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 54, married and has three sons and a daughter. The older son went to work in Russia, the second son works in construction, the third is engaged in cattle breeding and the daughter is a student. Santalat and her husband have been breeding cattle for 25 years, reselling the cattle after fattening. They make 4,000 KGS per month. Santalat wants to increase their number of cattle, so she applied for this loan to purchase bull-calves for breeding. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more frozen meat and fish to sell

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: Ilqar Q. is 42 years old, married, and has two children. His main work consists of breeding cattle. This very profitable activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. His monthly income is 250-300 AZN. A very ambitious man, Ilqar would like to buy more cattle and build a barn to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, Ilqar is asking for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a married man with no children. He has been operating a photocopier shop from home. For the past year his other source of income has been a green grocer stall at the market, and he also sells door to door and from home to his neighboring community. Musa cites transportation and seasonality as the major challenges in the business. With the KES 20,000 he wants to build a cyber café and pay for the business permit. He hopes to run the cyber café in the future. Musa decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to change his business. Musa lives at a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and food.

loans.use: To build a cyber cafe.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de carne de res y pollo. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio y está ubicado en su vivienda en donde asisten muchos clientes que compran este producto que es necesario. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo, ella es Madre responsable y por lo que se  siente muy feliz de realizar este medio de vida. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carne para suplir la demanda de sus clientes. Por lo que sueña con lograr construir su propia vivienda para su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 43 years old. Her economic activity is selling beef and chicken. She has had this business for more than four years and it is located in her house. Many customers go there to buy these necessary products. She is raising 2 minor children and is a responsible mother and is very happy in this lifestyle.  She is asking for the loan to invest in buying meat to meet the demand from her customers. She dreams of building her own house for her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es: La señora Hilda Laura tiene 50 años D. edad y vive en Huaycán en la zona D, es la presidenta del grupo “Sagrada Familia” desD. hace 8 meses, aunque el grupo tiene 3 años trabajando con Edaprospo, este mismo está conformado por 14 vecinas y amigas que eligieron el nombre por el comedor D. la zona. Hilda Laura trabaja confeccionando ropa desD. hace 8 años ya que tiene estudios D. corte y confección desD. sus 16 años, ah logrado comprar más maquinas para que le ayuden en su labor y con sus préstamos se abastece D. las telas que son su materia prima, así mismo espera ampliar su negocio y seguir ayudando a su esposo a mantener sus dos hijos y darles una mejor calidad D. vida, aunque para esto necesite mas habilitaciones por parte D. Edaprospo.
texts.en: Hilda is 50 years old and lives in Huaycán in the D zone.  She has been president of the Holy Family group for 8 months and although the group has worked with Edaprospo for 8 years, the group consists of 14 neighbors and friends, who chose the name because of a local restaurant.  Hilda has been making clothing for 8 years, as she has studied dressmaking since she was 16 years old.  She has been able to buy additional machines to help with the work, and the loans enable her to secure the fabric that is her raw material.  She hopes to expand her business and continue to help her husband care for their two children and proviD. them a better life, although for this she needs additional financing from Edaprospo.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 34 years old, married, and has a couple of children. The borrower graduated from preparatory school. He will use this loan to develop his garage where he repairs cars and to purchase spare parts. The borrower has a huge garage. He has a high reputation in the market and he is skilled man and has good experience in repairing cars. He has great ambition to develop his business.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts and developing his garage

loans.name: Las Daliass Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Daliass, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de puebla. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. 

Agustina G.G es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 29 años, estudió hasta 6to de primaria  es comerciante en venta de trastes, tiene en total 5 hijos.  Ella vende trastes que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para compra de trastes .Sus clientes el público en general.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir.   Quiere este crédito para invertir en más trastes como ollas y platos que le solicitan mucho. También espera con este préstamo obtener más clientes y así poder tener a futuro un local bien surtido.
texts.en:
The 9-member Dahlias Group lives in the state of Puebla. Agustina G. G is the president of the group. She is 29 years old, has a 6th grade education, and earns her living selling cooking utensils. She has five children. 

Agustina started her business five years ago. She is seeking a loan to buy more cooking utensils to sell to her customers.

Right now she feels very enthusiastic and eager to get ahead in life. She will use the loan to buy items like saucepans and plates which are much in demand. She hopes that a well-stocked store will attract more customers.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.fr: A. M. Francisca est née le 17 février 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Francisca est mariée à GANHOUNEDO Eugène, un plombier, avec qui elle a trois enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble depuis sept ans à Kpakpakanmè, un quartier de de la ville de Cotonou. Le couple partage ensemble les charges familiales. Pour seconder son mari, Francisca  exerce comme activité la vente de friperies (habits pour hommes, femmes et enfants) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Francisca s'approvisionne à Missèbo, le grand marché de friperie de la sous région se trouvant au Bénin. Francisca n’a jamais fréquenté l’école et exerce son activité depuis sept ans. Francisca a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé qui a été bien remboursé. C’est pour renouveler son stock que Francisca souhaiterait bénéficier d’un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Francisca a le souci de renforcer son activité plus tard.
texts.en:
Francisca A. was born on February 17, 1976 in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. She is married to Eugene Ganhounedo, a plumber. Together they have three children, who all go to school. The family has been living in Kpakpakanmè, a district of Cotonou, for seven years. They both share the financial responsibilities of their family. 

To assist her husband, Francisca sells second-hand clothes (for men, women and children) in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Francisca gets her merchandise from Missèbo, a large second-hand clothes market of this sub-region of Benin. Francisca never attended school and has been working for seven years. She already got a first loan from Alidé, which was paid back in full. Francisca would like to get this loan from Alidé in order to renew her stock. She wishes to strengthen her activity in the future.

loans.use: Buying second-hand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
La señora Felisa A. es una persona D. escasos recursos,  ha estudiado hasta 7º D. primaria, ella y su esposo el Sr. Francisco se ganan la vida costurando almohadas.   Tienen 3 hijos menores D. edad los cuales necesitan vestimenta, alimentación y materiales para acudir a la escuela.

La señora Felisa y su esposo el Sr. Francisco se apersonaron a nuestras oficinas con la necesidad D. un crédito para comprar más material para la confección D. las almohadas, ya que se aproxima la navidad y hay cierto crecimiento D. las ventas, ella necesita $us. 1200.- para poder comprar su material y así poder vender la cantidad suficiente D. almohadas y darles a sus hijos una feliz navidad.
texts.en:
Mrs Felisa A. is a person of few economic means who studied up to the 7th year of primary school.  She and her husband Francisco earn a living sewing pillowcases.  They have three dependent children who need clothes, food and materials for school.

Felisa and her husband Francisco came to our offices in person as they needed a loan to buy more material for making pillowcases.  Christmas is approaching and their sales increase during this period.  Felisa needs $1,200 US dollars so that she can buy material and thereby be able to sell enough pillowcases and give her children a happy Christmas.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Prum's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is formed by four members living in Svay Pom Trang village in Kandal province. The group selected Mr. PrumV., 43 years old, as the group leader.  The members of this village loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mr. PrumV. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to cultivate bananas and papayas for a living. In order to grow this farm, Mr. PrumV. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. His wife, Mrs. Hor Kimsoeun, 56 years old, sells the fruits to support the family.  This couple has a child who is also a farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to cultivate bananas and papayas

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Don Ricardo, es un señor de familia, vive con sus hijos, su esposa, él tiene 54 años de edad, es docente del centro escolar, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután.
A don Ricardo se le presenta la oportunidad de comprar un terreno pero no cuenta con los fondos suficientes por eso está solicitando un préstamo para completar su costo y realizar esta inversión aprovechando  la venta que se le presenta, con esta adquisición esta aumentado sus bienes inmuebles.
Su aspiración es algún día poseer abundantes inmuebles para heredar a sus hijos o también poder comercializarlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a man of the house and lives with his wife and children in Jiquilisco, in the Usulután department.  He is 54 years old and works as a school teacher.

Ricardo has the opportunity to buy some land, but he does not have enough capital, so he is requesting a loan in order to make up the difference and be able to make this investment.  He wants to take advantage of this sale.  This acquisition will increase his real estate.

He hopes to one day own lots of land so that he can leave it to his children or resell it at a profit.

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Jhany Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jhany Margarita; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende perfumes, lápiz labiales, cremas entre otros, la socia vende en forma independiente ofreciendo a diferentes personas, la socia también trabaja en un institución privada, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza en stock.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Entrepreneurs of San Cristobal". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Jhany Margarita. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling beauty products. She sells perfumes, lipsticks, lotions and other products. She sells independently to a various clients. She is also employed by a private company. She wants to expand and improve her business. She requests a loan to purchase beauty products currently in stock. 

She is happy to have a loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en: Sofya M. is 44 years old and lives in the Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area, with her husband and son. Sofya’s family has been engaged in farming for 20 years. They raise cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens on their farm. Sofya and her family are very dedicated to their work and, thanks to their hard work, they are able to keep and develop their farm. Sofya is requesting a 500,000 AMD loan to buy calves for her farm.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: La señora Ana Rosa solicita crédito para comprar los útiles escolares de sus hijos ya que tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar y el gasto de zapatos , uniforme, mochilas , cuadernos, libros no se cubre con el salario y es urgente ya que ellos inician en este mes de febrero.
texts.en: Señora Ana Rosa is seeking a loan to buy school supplies for her children. She has three children of school age and the expense of shoes, uniforms, backpacks, notebooks, and books is not covered by her salary. She feels this is urgent since they begin school in the month of February.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio A. is from the Barangay of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old, married, and blessed with 2 adult children. To make a living, he is presently engaged in a baking business. He’s been engaged in this kind of business activity for 5 years. He’s earning an average amount of not less than 4,000 PHP a month from this kind of activity. 

In January 2011, Rogelio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Medal Pangnegosyo 2 Program, is now requesting 5,000 PHP as his first loan, which will be used for additional capital for his photocopying business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his bakery business

loans.name: Yhury

texts.es:
Yhury nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 37 años de edad. Actualmente, Yhury vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas y tiene dos hijos, él tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de cerveza èl tiene un pequeño deposito y vende las 24 horas del día. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Yhury requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza. 

Yhury es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Yhury was born in the city of Cusco and is 37 years old. Currently, Yhury lives in the imperial city of the Incas and has 2 sons. He has a small business selling beer and he has a small store where is sells his goods 24 hours a day. He has already been doing this for 3 years and it is going well. At the moment, Yhury needs a loan to buy more beer.
Yhury is a responsible person who belongs to the community bank "Comuzone III" of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mauro de 52 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Son 6 años los que Claudia lleva vistiendo a la gente que concurre al mercado central de la ciudad de Lima, vendiendo de forma ambulatoria ha logrado ganar una gran cantidad de clientes, ya que tiene una amplia variedad de prendas de vestir, tanto para damas como para caballeros. A ella le gustaría poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y mostrarles más ropa, puesto que disfruta de vender y conversar con sus clientes, eso si lo que le resulta difícil es transportar la ropa hasta su lugar de trabajo, ya que es demasiado cansado para ella sola. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles, planea comprar más mercadería y así incrementar la cantidad de ropa que vende.
texts.en:
Claudia, 48 years old, is a very simple and happy woman who lives in her own house with her husband Mauro, who is 52, and her 3 dear children, to whom she wishes to offer a better future. For 6 years Claudia has been clothing the people who gather at the central market of the city of Lima. Selling on the streets there, she has managed to accumulate a large number of customers. Claudia provides a wide variety of clothing items, for both women and men. 

Claudia would like to establish a large shop where she could better attend to her customers. A main reason is that it's very difficult for her to transport clothing to the place where she works. It is too tiring for her to do alone.

This is Claudia's 4th loan through MFP, and once again, just as in the previous cases, she promises to repay on time and without difficulties. She is very respected in her communal bank because she is the most active and committed member. With this 3,000 new sols she plans to buy more merchandise and thus, expand the quantity of clothing she sells.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE CLOTHES TO STOCK HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender productos lácteos como queso, yogurt, leche y mantequilla, sus hijos la ayudan en la atención y la preparación de los productos lácteos de su negocio que esta ubicado cerca de una estación de transportes donde frecuentan permanentemente muchas personas y es optimo para sus ventas  que hasta el momento se ha mantenido estable, ella misma produce el queso y el yogurt  ya que en la zona donde vive es ganadera y hay leche en abundancia, el ingrediente básico de sus productos que es de muy buena calidad y la puede adquirir a un precio cómodo que garantiza sus ganancias  por lo que desea seguir creciendo en esta actividad.

Es su crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contenta de acceder a este crédito que le permitirá crecer en su negocio y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos.

El dinero lo utilizara para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Felicia is 47 years old and lives with her husband and six children in her own home.

She’s been selling milk products, such as cheese, yogurt, milk, and butter for the past three years.  Her children help prepare and care for the milk products.  Her businesses is located near a transportation station where many people gather, making it an ideal location and making her business stable.  She makes the cheese and yogurt herself.  The zone where she lives is a livestock agricultural area and there is plenty of good quality milk, the basic ingredient in her products.  She can get it for comfortable prices, which guarantee her a profit and she wants to continue growing her business.

This will her second loan through MFP and she is very happy.  It will allow her to grow her business and she promises to repay on time.

She will use the money to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, D. 47 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio D. 57 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. En el asentamiento humano Pachacutec en la ciudad D. Lima, se encuentra la tienda D. Juana, en donD. venD. platos, vasos, plásticos, etc. descartables a muy buen precio, lo que ha hecho que tenga muchos más clientes que el resto D. tiendas. Para ella su trabajo es muy importante, pues es muy conciente D. que gracias a este pueD. darle a su familia lo necesario para vivir, lleva 6 año en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es vender y convencer a sus clientes D. llevarse algo, espera más adelante mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar mucho, sin embargo tiene que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda sin poder salir a la calle. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal en donD. es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos descartables, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Juana, age 47, is a modest hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Antonio, age 57, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life. In the Pachacutec settlement in the city of Lima, Juana has a store where she sells plates, glasses, plastics, and other disposable items at a very good price. As a result of the business she created, she has gained more customers than the other stores. Juana is very aware of what she has to accomplish in order to proviD. her family what they need to live. She has been in business for six years and what she enjoys most is selling and persuading her customers to purchase something. In the future, she hopes to improve her store and expand it. Juana knows that she has to work hard, so she stays in her store all day without leaving.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is willing to submit her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the members of her Communal Bank. Juana is greatly admired by the rest of the members. With the loan of 800 PEN that she requested, she will buy more disposable products so that her store continues to operate well.

loans.use: to purchase more disposable products.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 30  años D. edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia L. cual está ubicada en L. zona rural del distrito D. Lambayeque,  cuenta con servicios D. agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado D. 200  familias.

Edilberto se desempeña como vendedor D. pescado, esta actividad L. realiza recorriendo los diferentes caseríos cercanos a su comunidad, éste recorrido lo realiza en su mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), está actividad L. realiza desD. hace 3 años.

Edilberto esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en L. reparación D. L. moto y aumento D. capital D. trabajo   este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Edilberto es una persona tranquiL. y bastante entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edilberto tiene 30  años D. edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia L. cual está ubicada en L. zona rural del distrito D. Lambayeque,  cuenta con servicios D. agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado D. 200  familias.

Edilberto se desempeña como vendedor D. pescado, esta actividad L. realiza recorriendo los diferentes caseríos cercanos a su comunidad, éste recorrido lo realiza en su mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), está actividad L. realiza desD. hace 3 años.

Edilberto esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en L. reparación D. L. moto y aumento D. capital D. trabajo   este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Edilberto es una persona tranquiL. y bastante entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante.

loans.use: Reparación de sumoto y auampliacion de sus negocio.

loans.name: Azadi

texts.en: Azadi is 42 years old., married, and has two children. Azadi began earning income selling seasonal  fruits when he was nine years old to support his family. After a while, he began working at other jobs, but realized that his work wasn't bringing in enough income to cover the expenses of his family. Therefore, Azadi decided to return to the seasonal  fruits sales business. Now he has permanent customers and he needs additional capital to purchase fruits for sale, given the high demand during the current season. Azadi is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN, which he will use to buy additional fruits for sale and thus earn increased profits. Azadi plans to use the additional income to  purchase seasonal vegetables to diversify his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has operated his garage in Naivasha town for the last ten years. He specializes in car panel beating and body repair. He is 29 years old, married to Mary, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to purchase fiber to be used in auto body repair.

In future, Stephen hopes open more branches of his garage in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more fiber for panel beating (auto repair).

loans.name: Hector Dario

texts.es:
Hector Dario trabaja en construcción desde hace muchos años, sin emnargo para incrementar sus ingresos decidió tener un puesto para vender dulces, mecato y cigarrillos en la calle, con estos ingresos adicionales puede mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y la de él.

El quiere tener mas suirtido en su negocios para poder tener mas clientes y además poder ofrecerles otros productos que sean del agrado de los transeuntes.

Su sueño es poder tener una tienda para asi dejar la construcción y poder dedicarse a su negocio y dejarle éste a su familia.
texts.en:
Hector Dario has worked in construction for many years, however in order to increase his income he decided to have a stall to sell sweets, packed lunches and cigarettes on the street. With this additional income he is able to increase his and his family's quality of life.

He wants to have a greater stock in his businesses in order to be able to have more customers and to be able to offer other products that will appeal to passersby.

His dream is to be able to have a store in order to leave the construction business and dedicate himself to his business and leave it to his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 1 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home. Isabelita has been operating the business for one year already. In that short time of operation, she usually earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

Isabelita is one of GDMPC's members joining this year. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase several grocery items to sell, such as soft drinks, salable liquor items and more. Isabelita hopes to lay aside part of her earnings for store improvement and business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase several grocery items to sell, such as soft drinks, liquor items and more

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama est une femme  âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un gendarme avec 02 enfants en charge.
Adama travaille comme revendeuse de céréales, riz, arachide depuis 2004. Elle vend seule à domicile après achat à ANIE et BLITTA.
Adama a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin de renforcer son activité en achetant des céréales, du riz et de l’arachide.
texts.en:
Adama is a 36-year old woman. She is married to a policeman and has two dependent children.
Adama works as a vendor of cereals, rice and peanuts [ground nuts] since 2004. She sells by herself, out of her home, after stocking up in [the villages of] Anie and Blitta.

Adama is requesting her first-cycle loan from WAGES in order to strenghten her business by stocking up on cereals, rice and peanuts.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, beans, sorghum, peanuts etc)

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto y su esposa la señora  desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de productos de segunda mano, los productos que ella vende son ropa usada de temporada, zapatos, juguetes, artículos para el hogar, muebles, bolsas de dama; Norberto es hombre emprendedor que con la ayuda de su esposa han logrado cada objetivo y cada obstáculo que les presenta la vida. A esta pareja de comerciante la crisis económica que vive el país no los detiene para seguir con su trabajo ya que es la forma que sostienen los gastos del hogar. Durante los 7 años que ha permanecido en el negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos y sabe que entre más producto tenga en existencia sus ventas incrementaran y solicita el apoyo para compra de ropa de temporada.
texts.en:
Sr. Norberto and his wife have been selling secondhand clothing for seven years. The products they offer include used seasonal clothing, shoes, toys, household goods, furniture, and women’s handbags. Norberto is an enterprising gentleman who, with the help of his wife, has been able to achieve each of his goals and overcome every obstacle that life presents. The economic crisis in their country has not prevented this pair of merchants from continuing their work because this business enables them to sustain the household expenses. For the past seven years, this business has been their only source of income.

Norberto knows that having more products will result in increased sales, so he is requesting assistance so that he can buy seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to restock his business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children.  For a living, he has a transport business.  He has been in the taxi business for five years and has employed five people to assist him.  He was able to start dairy farming after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya.  Now, his farming business earns him extra income.  He has also managed to build his own house.  David is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because of his achievements.

David hopes to provide a good education for his children.  He has requested 50, 000 Kenya shillings to service his vehicle.

loans.use: To service his vehicle

loans.name: Romillo

texts.en:
Romillo, 49 strives hard to provide sustenance for his family. He had been blessed with three children. Though his family is less fortunate, they still live comfortably and help each other to overcome all challenges in their lives. 

Romillo raises crops. He has been planting rice and selling it to traders in the village. As of now, he has insufficient funds to buy seeds, pesticides, and herbicides used in farming. Thus, he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy these inputs for crop production improvement.

With his patience, sacrifices, hard work, and strong faith in God, he will be able to lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. For the last eleven years, he has been selling cows to make a living. He has retained his business because of the good reputation with his customers.  Daniel has employed one person to help him to manage the business.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

Daniel is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a young heifer for resale. He expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

loans.use: buy a heifer

loans.name: Fresitas Group

texts.es:
Nicomedes es una joven integrante del grupo Fresitas, es una persona muy independiente y responsable, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijas, una de 14 años  y otra de 11 años, ambas estudian, dependen de ella y son su mayor motivación para salir adelante; habita en el municipio Monterrey, N.L., y se dedíca a la venta de prodructos naturales y suplementos alimenticios en su casa desde hace 6 meses ofreciendo a sus vecinos y familiares. Con el prestamo que resivió va a surtir mas mercancía para vender y así poder poner un puesto en el mercado. Ella eligió esta actividad porque además de que piensa que estos productos ayudan a la gente que los consume, cree que fue una buena idea para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos económicos y de la educación de sus hijas.
Para Nicomedes una de sus mayores metas por cumplir es surtir un lote de suplementos alimenticios que le estan ofreciendo, crecer el negocio y comprar una estructura para ponerse a vender en los mercados.

Fresitas es un grupo solidario muy responsable y que lucha por lo que quiere, conformado por 7 mujeres muy buenas que con mucho esfuerzo lograron hacerse de cada uno de sus negocios; se encuentra en su 1° ciclo y sus reuniones estan ubicadas en Monterrey, N.L.
Todas las integrantes del grupo han estado juntas en otro tipo de actividades, por lo tanto se conocen muy bien, además de tener mucha confianza en sí mismas.
texts.en:
Nicomedes is a young member of the “Fresitas” group.  She’s an independent, very responsible person.  She’s 36 years old, married and has two daughters, a 14-year-old and an 11-year-old, who go to school and depend on her.  They are her greatest motivation to get ahead.  She lives in Monterrey, Nuevo León and sells natural products and food supplements at home to neighbors and family members.  She’s been in business for six months.

She used the loan she received to stock up on merchandise to sell to be able to set up a stand in the market.  She chose this activity because besides believing that these products help people who consume them she also thinks that it was a good idea in order to help her husband meet household expenses and for her daughters’ education.

For Nicomedes, one of her greatest goals to meet is to buy a lot of food supplements she’s being offered, to increase business and to buy a stand to start selling in the markets.

Fresitas is a very responsible communal bank that fights for what it wants.  It has 7 very good women members who through much effort have managed to get businesses of their own.  It’s in its first cycle and they are located in Monterrey, N.L.  All of the group members have been together in other types of activities so they know each other very well and trust each other very much.

loans.use: to stock up on food supplement and natural products.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 45 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Fe, que se encuentra en Los Chiles en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad se encuentra en una zona montañosa y está cerca de la frontera norte del país. Las actividades comerciales principales son la ganadería y la agricultura, especialmente el cultivo de granos básicos, caña de azúcar y naranjas.

Felipe se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y este es el medio por el cual genera ingresos para su familia. Está muy contento porque su negocio ha crecido de manera significativa, los vecinos de la comunidad lo han apoyado mucho y ahora es capaz de salir adelante.

Felipe espera obtener un microcrédito de 600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar abonos y fungicidas, esto para preparar el terreno para sembrar tubérculos.  El sabe que la adquisición de más insumos tiene gran sacrificio y exige más trabajo. Sin embargo, su deseo de convertirse en un exitoso microempresario y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia lo motiva a seguir adelante con gran cuidado y dedicación.

Felipe es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Felipe is 45 years old and lives with his family in the community of Santa Fe, in Los Chiles, in Alajuela province.  This community is located in a mountainous area and is close to the country's northern border.  The main business activities of this area are livestock raising and farming, especially basic grains, sugarcane and oranges.

Felipe has been farming for several years and this is the way in which he makes income for his family.  He is very happy because his business has grown significantly.  The neighbors in his community have supported him a lot and now he is capable of getting ahead.

Felipe hopes to receive a micro-loan for 600,000 colones to buy fertilizers and fungicides in order to prepare his soil for sowing tubers.  He knows that the acquisition of more supplies is a great sacrifice and demands more work.  However, his wish to become a successful micro-businessman and improve his family's living conditions motivates him to make progress with a lot of care and commitment.

Felipe is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe Community Credit Company, one of EDESA's 150 member organizations in Costa Rica.  He will continue growing both on a personal and financial level and will actively participate in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. Both her children are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for the past 5 years. Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cintia Magali

texts.es: Cintia Magaly una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada, para dama, caballeros, niños y bebes.  Su negocio es ambulante ya que en ocasiones se coloca en varios puntos de la ciudad donde hay más gente que le pueda comprar lo que ella ofrece aun bajo precio, aunque ya tiene sus clientes de años le gusta innovar. Su esposo es un hombre muy trabajador que presta sus servicios en una maquiladora de la ciudad. Cintia  desea comprar más mercancía para su negocio como lo es pants, camisas de manga larga, suéteres, chamarras para esta temporada de frio.
texts.en:
Cintia Magaly, a very hard-working and enterprising woman, has a business selling used clothing for women, men, children, and babies.  She is a street vendor, since on occasions she places herself at different points in the city where there are more people who can buy from her what she offers at a low price.  Even though she already has longstanding customers, she likes to make innovations.  Her husband is a very hard-working man who works in a "maquiladora" [assembly plant] in the city.

Cintia wants to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, long-sleeve shirts, sweaters, and jackets for this cold season.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Sayro Joel

texts.es:
Sayro Joel tiene 20 años de edad vive en unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con los padres y la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Sayro se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 6 años.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas y poder  trabajar en la agricultura. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar insumos. El sueño es poder un terreno. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. 
En el Tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.

Con el crédito anterior ha podido invertir en la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arroz. la producción ha aumentado, la relación y el estilo de vida de la familia ha mejorado, los ingresos han sido notorios porque puede aportar para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Sayro is 20 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has no children.  He lives with his parents and his wife in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Jerusalen” (Jerusalem) is located in the neighborhood of El Caimito, which is part of Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, beans, and pigeon peas.

Sayro is a farmer who has been growing corn for six years.  He buys his supplies and sells his products in Ventanas.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds so that he can continue farming.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy supplies.  His dream is have a piece of land.  At the moment, he is not facing any problems.  In his free time, he enjoys practicing sports.

With his previous loan, he was able to invest in growing corn, beans, and rice.   His production has increased, which has resulted in an improvement in his family’s lifestyle.  The additional income is welcome because they provide benefits for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Julissa Annabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julissa, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de dos  años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ella lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque es por estos créditos que tiene su negocio ya que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes los cuales le realizan muchos pedidos. Trabaja dos días de la semana y aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores para  realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería compra en Manta o en Guayaquil cada que necesita, ella lleva dos años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas y ropa interior.

Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen Del Mar meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta known for its beautiful beaches visited by foreign and domertic tourists alike. Here most of the inhabitants work in fishing and sea-related activities.

Here we met Señora Julissa who is 22 years old and married. From this relationship she has a 2 year old daughter. He husband is a fisherman. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 2 years and she likes it because by virtue of these loans she has a business as she started her business with the first loan she received from the communal bank.

She sells clothes of all kinds. She sells door-to-door and also from her house where customers who have placed a lot of orders come to collect. She works 2 days a week and she takes advantage of when the fishermen return to make her sales. She gives credit to her cutomers and receives payment every 15 days. She buys her goods in Manta or Guayaquil when she needs to. She has had her business for 2 years and she is doing well.

With this loan she will buy pants, shirts, vests, blouses and underwear.

Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, vests, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Angela Flor

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y  fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y a trabajar en el campo.

Ella además de ser ama de casa, en las noches se dedica a la venta de chifles acompañado de pescado y carne hornada acompañado de una deliciosa ensalada de legumbres lo cual hace un plato delicioso y muy solicitado por sus clientes, todas las semana sale con el esposo hasta la plaza central de la parroquia para poner un  puesto donde vende sus deliciosos alimentos, lleva más de 30 años con este negocio y nos dice que siempre les va bien ya que son los únicos que venden este delicioso plato.

Este nuevo crédito es para compara plátano, pescado,  carne de chancho y legumbres para preparar los alimentos. Tiene seis años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es gozar de buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Picoaza is recorded as being one of the aboriginal towns from the Manteña culture. This urban parish is situated just ten minutes from the town of Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabi. It has a long history. This is where the members of the María Asunción Community Bank meet every two weeks.

72-year old Angela lives here. She is married and has two adult children who no longer live at home. Her husband works in construction in the countryside. As well as being a housewife, Angela sells snacks, fish, and meat accompanied by a delicious vegetable salad which makes a tasty dish, much requested by her customers. Every week Angela and her husband leave the house and go to the central plaza to set up a stall where she sells her delicious food. It’s a job she’s been doing for thirty years and all is going well since they are the only people selling this particular dish.

This new loan will be used to buy ingredients such as bananas, fish, pork, and vegetables. Angela has been with the Community Bank for six years and enjoys being a member as it has always helped her with loans. Her greatest wish is that she and all her family enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy bananas, fish, pork, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for car insurance and repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying basic grains, vegetables, fruit and soft drinks to keep offering the best services.

loans.name: Tsedevdorj

texts.en:
Tsedevdorj is a 26-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is employed in small shop and takes after the young child. The son studies at the secondary school.

Tsedevdorj has been running taxi service business since 2006. He is an experienced driver and he earns around 50,000 - 60,000 MNT a day. This has been the only financial source for the family. He has a further plan to expand the business. Tsedevdorj is a talented driver who is also responsible for the family members and says that, "I would like to continue my business activity by replacing the van with a good one. I am planning to buy 'Sonata' van by the loan and the saved money." The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy a new van.

loans.use: to buy a new van

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Moern is 50 years old and married with six children. To support her family, she has been farming rice and growing for twenty-nine years. From the current business, she can earn about 40,000KHR per day and can save about 20,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is the group loan for Moern’s with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and she is the third cycled client. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to seek for a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Şadiye

texts.en:
Şadiye is married and a mother of two.  She is knitting to make a contribution to the family budget.  She is using her second loan.  With the help of the loans she bought bulks of thread and increased her products as well as her profit.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şadiye hanım evli ve  iki çocuk annesi elişi örgü örerek aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  2. kredisini kullanan Şadiye Hanım toptan yün alarak hem ürünlerini hem de sermayesini artırdı.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Rosa Maria. My main activity is to make Rosquillas cookies. I have a small local Rosquillas factory in my house which is in the center of my community. Thanks to this work I can generate enough income to contribute to my household expenses and therefore help to achieve a better standard of living for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Rosa Maria, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de Rosquillas, cuento con una pequeña frabrica artesanal de Rosquilla, ubicado en mi casa de habitacón en el centro de mi comunidad,gracias a esta actividad puedo generar ingresos y contribuir con los gastos familiares, logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, eggs, corn, milk, butter, firewood and other household items

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.en: Before receiving a loan, Ayubjon made cooking batteries from an aluminium sheet. They were sold directly to clients and in part sold in markets. As raw materials were scarce (160 kg. Aluminium), he  produced in small numbers (45 cooking batteries per  month). As aluminium steel cost a lot (3 somoni per 1 kg.), Ayubjon did not have enough capital for wholesale purchase of raw materials. Receiving the first loan, he bought up raw materials from different building materials sales. Ayubjon has increased the volume of manufacture, and his clients have already started to order. Step by step he now has the opportunity of wholesale purchase of raw materials. Ayubjon has put all his profits into active capital and gradually has increased the volume of production. To output cooking batteries he has added two more kinds of production.  Now there are about 2.5 tons of raw material and his factory shop works without days off. The basic change to his business is that Ayubjon can buy raw material in large amounts and plans to increase the range of goods to  create additional profits. The current request for a $1000 loan is to increase the commodity circulation.

loans.use: Manufacture cooking batteries

loans.name: Turadj

texts.en:
Turadj is a mother of 3 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
She has 5 years of experience in this business.
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy 10 sheep in order to improve her business to meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Mario Jesus

texts.es:
The work on my house never ends. I need to build a concrete roof to be able to use a new room because my family needs more space and the house is really small. I am asking for a loan of $1000 to build a concrete roof.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me hace falta poner el techo de concreto para poder habitar el cuarto ya que a mi familia le hace falta más espacio debido a que la casa es muy pequeña ”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción del techo de concreto

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: Emilia Eduardo

texts.pt:
Emilia is a single mother of 4 children. She joined the program in 2000. Her first loan was of 250$ to buy home appliances. She continue to request loans until she was able to open a small grocery store. With this loan she plans on increasing the inventory of her store. With the income from the business, Emilia wants to improve her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia e solteira, msd tem 4 filhos. Ela entrou para o programa de Credito em 2000. O primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou foi de $250 para a compra de alguns aparelhos electrodomesticos. Foi fazendo outros emprestimos e conseguiu abrir uma pequena loja onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Com o valor do emprestimo ela quer investir neste seu negocio que esta a crescer . Com os lucros ela quer melhorar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Laurentine

texts.en: Laurentine Irié L. is a dynamic 32 year old woman. She has 3 children and lives in Attecoube, a populated suburb in North-West Abidjan. Laurentine sells grilled pork and beef in the Attecoube market. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. She covers a significant amount of her family's household expenses and the cost of her childens' education. She is a courageous and ambitious young woman. Laurentine joined the AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 and has benefitted from different loans that have helped her to expand her business. She is a good performer and can repay the loan.

loans.use: Laurentine Irié Lou will use the loan to purchase cartons of pork

loans.name: Mwadawa

texts.en:
Since 2005, Mwadawa H. has run a business selling clothes. Her gross monthly income is approximately $180, and her monthly profit is approximately $80. She hopes to increase both figures by buying new stock in bulk, for which she requires a loan of $525. Mwadawa is 30 years old and married to husband Issa, with whom she has three children: Maabadi, 13, Rehema, 7 and Fatuma, 3.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback". SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing stock.

loans.name: Tamilla

texts.en: Tamilla A. (her employee is pictured) runs a stand out of the baazar in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She sells many different types of beans, grains and seeds. Tamilla has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit, thus proving to be one of our trusted and valued customers. She is curently looking for funding so that she can increase and diversify her inventory even further.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
M. Yunus is 37 years old. He is married and has three children.

Yunus has provided transportation services for the last 15 years. Each day on his lorry he transports the goods of his clients. Yunus dreams his children will be educated people so he is working hard. As a result, the business generates significant income allowing him to support his family.

Currently Yunus needs to purchase spare parts for his lorry. For this purpose he requests 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. Although this is his first loan Yunus is sure he shall pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts for the lorry.

loans.name: Adisatu

texts.en:
Adisatu A. is 31 years old, married to a carpenter, and has one child. For the past 10 years, she has been trader involved in selling cloth for clothes making purposes. She is requesting $525 to buy cloth in bulk quantities at a reduced price in order to reduce her costs and increase her earnings. Not only will she be able to strengthen her business, she will also be able to better support and provide for her family.

Adisatu is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Niboa Group” that consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy cloth material

loans.name: María Simeona

texts.es:
Maria Simeona M. is originally from the town of Condega in Nicaragua. She started selling delicious food dishes out of her home about 15 years ago. She's a great cook with a growing clientele.

In order to make her delicious food dishes, Señora Simeona buys the best quality ingredients. Due to financial difficulties at this time, she's requesting a loan from Ceprodel to be able to purchase the basic ingredients to prepare food dishes and to continue with her business and great customer service. It's important to note that she has been able to paid on time 4 previous loans which she paid in full per agreement established between both parties.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Maria Simeona M. es originaria del municipio de Condega en Nicaragua. Desde hace 15 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de comida en su sector de habitación siendo ella una excelentísima cocinera de la cual muchos de sus clientes prefieren por su estilo de elaborar los alimentos.

Para lograr elaborar cada uno de los deliciosos platillos, la señora Simeona requiere de la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación. Es por esta razón que a pesar de su difícil situación económica, busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan obtener su materia prima y continuar con su negocio brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Es necesario destacar que actualmente ella posee un total de 4 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por ambas partes.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to prepare food dishes

loans.name: Liliana Milagros

texts.es:
Liliana is a member of the Our Lady of Hope Community Bank, which is located at Jr. Apurimac 181 in the Calleria District, in the state of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and has two children. Liliana is separated from her husband.

Liliana’s income is not sufficient to cover her daily expenses. That’s why she decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles (approximately $110) in buying and selling clothing and other merchandise. She continues to operate her merchandise business by constantly traveling to deliver her products. Liliana’s female clients generally order these goods and trust in Liliana’s good judgment.

With this loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $375), which will be paid back in four months, Jessica will purchase clothing, shoes, jewelry, sheets, picture frames, watches, etc. Jessica is glad for the support Manuela Ramos gives to her and other women in order to continue their work.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Liliana pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 181, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años es madre de 2 hijos, es separada, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Liliana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de mercaderías. En la actualidad continua con su negocio de mercadería, para ello ella viaja constantemente para traer sus productos, que generalmente son pedidos de sus clientas que confían en el buen gusto que tiene Liliana.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas, zapatos, joyas, sabanas, portarretratos, relojes, etc. Liliana esta contenta por el apoyo que le brindan a las mujeres Manuela Ramos para poder continuar con nuestros trabajos.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, is a young woman with many desires to succeed and because of that she has made the important decision to start her own business. Her aunt’s business will transfer to her and today with her aunt’s help and talent she has been able to establish her own economic income that would help her take over the business. Her dream is to establish her career that is about to begin and she has a goal to extend her sales market that is why she is requesting a loan to increase her capital. With your help, Liz will make her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Liz, es una joven con muchos deseos de superación por lo cual han tomado una decisión importante en su vida la de emprender su propio negocio por medio del traspaso del negocio que antes su tía administraba y hoy con su ingenio y talento ella ha podido establecer un ingreso económico propio que le permite poder ayudar a los suyos su sueño es solventar la carrera que está a punto de iniciar y tiene como meta extender su mercado de ventas para lo cual solicita un préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo. Con tu apoyo Liz consolidará estos anhelos en una realidad.

loans.use: Increasing her capital to acquire a better quantity of products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products for her store

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma baji is the wife of M., and she lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a three-room, brick house, which she and her family have lived in for the last 26 years. Asma baji sells milk and takes care of her animals. In fact, Asma baji has been in the dairy business for the last 26 years. In addition, she is the mother of seven children: six daughters and one son. Her three oldest daughters are enrolled in a local school in neighborhood. Her husband, meanwhile, is a driver (he drives a rented vehicle).

Notably, Asma baji successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Currently, she is seeking another loan in order to buy a buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her dairy business by purchasing a buffalo

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
