Mrs Huon M. is a villager in Chek village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr Muth Meth, are pig breeders. They now raise 20 pigs and their pigs grow bigger and bigger. Mrs Huon M. does not have enough money to buy more pig food to feed them. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food and she would use the rest of the loan to fix her piggery.

Mrs Huon M. is 35 years old and the mother of five children, one who is a farmer while the other three are enrolled in school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more pig food and to fix her piggery.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella S. is 39 years old. She is a divorced woman and mother of one kid. Currently the child is in junior high school. Stella enjoys selling, with much experience in customer care. She has been selling bananas for five years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of bananas from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy bananas in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers who travel from far and near to buy from her. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kid in school.

Stella is a member of a community group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. Her picture was taken after her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of banana.

loans.name: Sam-Ang

texts.en:
Miss Sam-ang C. (pictured with her niece), 49, is single and lives with her elderly mother, brother, nephews and nieces on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sam-ang, a silk weaver for over 10 years, having learned the skill from her mother, sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and purchase construction materials for her brother, who is a mason.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and construction materials for her brother.

loans.name: Fanny Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora Fanny A. vive en la zona las Lomas, D. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia, es propietaria D. un pequeño taller en el que se fabrican moldes D. hojalata, dicho taller esta instalado en el domicilio D. la señora. 
La señora Fany realiza moldes para tortas, en diferentes formas (corazones, personajes, etc.), además la señora realiza artesanías como ser: lámparas en miniatura para las ferias además D. moldes para la elaboración D. galletas, todo el trabajo lo realiza en hojalata (lata).
El préstamo solicitado servirá para la compra D. material como ser: hojalata, vidrio, y otros accesorios para la elaboración D. estos materiales. Le colabora su esposo con los gastos D. la casa, y ademas le ayuda en la elaboración D. estos accesorios.
texts.en:
Señora Fanny A. lives in the neighborhood of Lomas in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She owns a small workshop in which she makes molds of tin. This workshop is set up in her home. Señora Fanny makes molds for cakes in different shapes (hearts, characters, etc.). In addition, she makes crafts such as miniature lamps for fairs, as well as molds for biscuits. All of her work is down in tinplate. The loan will be used toward the purchase of equipment, such as a tin, glass, and other parts for the manufacture of these materials. She collaborates with her husband to pay living expenses and also assists in the development of these accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to create tin molds

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mr. Thea M. is 34 years old and lives in Ou Chrouk village in Kampong Cham province. He has two children, one of whom attends the local school; the younger one is too young to work or study. Mr. Thea M. is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support his family. He now faces a problem because his motorbike is old and he spends a lot of money on gasoline. In order to reduce family expenses, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a new motorbike for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this new loan. His wife, Mrs. Keo Ren, is a dessert seller in the local market. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
EL señor  Juan Antonio N. es padre de Familia tiene un hijo que desea darle lo mejor.
A la vivienda le esta haciendo falta un loso de concreto en el patio ya que cuando llueve se la inunda y es un problema para su esposa e hijo salir.
 Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar su mejora lo mas pronto posible y planea pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de camión de carga.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Antonio N. has one son, to whom he wishes to give the best. He needs to pave his front yard because it gets flooded when it rains, making it difficult for his wife and child to go outside. He is requesting this loan in order to lay concrete as soon as possible. He plans on repaying the loan with the money that he gets from his job as a truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pave front yard

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Siendo ya su trabajo un modelo a seguir para cualquier negociante, ella aun aspira a seguir creciendo. Con la idea de sus hijos quien ya trabajaba en el rubro para terceras personas, desde hace diez años Elena empezó su negocio de venta de cuadros decorativos.

El negocio se inició cuando compraba cuadros ya hechos y  los revendía. Poco a poco  y junto con sus hijos se dio cuenta que si ellos mismos producían sus cuadros, tanto la pintura como el enmarcado,  podrían generar un mayor ingreso.

Hoy en día Elena no solo cuenta con su taller de elaboración de cuadros, si no también es propietaria de cuatro puestos donde exhibe y vende cuadros en el mercado central de la capital. Dos de los puestos los administra ella y los otros dos sus hijos.

A pesar de todas sus obligaciones con su pequeña empresa, Elena también se desempeña como profesora inicial en temporada escolar. Por otro lado, más adelante, ella planea abrir un puesto para la venta de jamones, ya que gracias la concurrencia de turistas en el mercado donde vende es grande y este negocio tiene futuro.
texts.en:
Her business already being a model to follow for any business persion, she aspires to continue to grow further. Elena began her business of selling decorative pictures 10 years ago, the idea having come from her sons who already worked with older aged persons. The business began when she purchased pictures that were already built and resold them. Little by little, and with her sons, they told themselves that if they could produce their own pictures, both the painting as well as the frame, they could generate a greater profit. Today, Elena does not only count on her studio where she makes these pictures, she is also the proprieter of four locations at the central market in the capity city where she sells and exhibits paintings. Two of these locations she manages and the other two her sons manage. In addition to the obligations of her little business, Elena is a teacher during school season. In the future, she plans to open a place to sell hams, which, thanks to the many tourists in the market, is a business that holds a future.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: Moch's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader, Moch Mom, is 46 years old and a mother of six children. Two children are married and live separately, and the other four attend school. She is a widow and sells charcoal throughout the commune. Another income of hers is renting rooms. Mrs. Mom owns a numbers of rentable rooms which are full of clients as her house is located next to the market. She is a good mother and a responsible neighbor with a net income of $ 5 per day. 

Mrs. Mom recently rented another shop for her business. She is looking for a loan to buy charcoal for her new shop. The other three members in this loan group are: N., 38, who sells traditional cakes in the market, is looking for a loan to buy more cake baking supplies. S., 47, who owns a grocery store is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her business. And H., 40, who sells sweets in the market is requesting a loan to invest and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for her new shop

loans.name: Priscilia

texts.en: Priscilia is a hair stylist and her husband is a commercial motorcyclist. They have 5 children. Priscilia also sells hair extensions and is requesting a loan in the amount of N50000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She thanks everyone that makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Jeniffer N. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, 1 and 8 years old. Jeniffer has been running a clothes business since 2008, selling used clothes. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern.

Jeniffer works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Jeniffer currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more used clothes and re-sell them to her customers. In the future, she plans to open another business. Jeniffer thanks you for your support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and re-sell them to her customers

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio F. is a rice grower. He is 58 years old and has five children. His wife, Girlie F., is the one taking care of their children. Antonio wants to provide for all the needs of his children. To achieve his goal, he established his own sari-sari store (general store) in front of their house in 1985. Until now, he has been able to sustain his business and make it a little bigger.

Antonio is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for his store. The loan will really help him attract more customers. In that way, he thinks it would be easy for him to send all his children to college.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 10 Group

texts.fr: aminata,isseu,yarame,khady et ndeye arame sont toutes des femmes qui font du commerce au marché grand thies;elles vendent en général des denrées alimentaires,des légumes et des poissons au détail;elles ont décidé de se regrouper sous forme de groupe de solidarité et ont ouvert un compte au sein de la mutuelle;elles ont fait cette demande de pret pour augmenter leur fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Aminata, Isseu, Yarame, Khady, and Adeye Arame are all women who work in commerce at the Grand Thies marketplace. She generally sells food items, vegetables, and fish at the retail level. The women decided to form a solidarity group and open an account with the mutuelle. They made this loan request to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail business

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
S., 27, earns a living by selling grocery inventory from her house--selling items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has had experience in this business for a long time. S. is married and currently takes care of three children, all of whom are single and also attend school, whilst her husband is an office staff member for a transportation company. They live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.

S. works hard every day and is very responsible for her family. Recently, she has sold all the groceries from her store. Because grocery selling is S.'s main source of income to support her family, she would like a loan to purchase a range of grocery items to sell. The remaining amount will be used to repair a broken motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a range of groceries to sell and to repair a broken motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing goods for grocery marketing

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul S. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. He is 59 years old. Raul is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Raul runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products and viands (food items) in the local community. Raul is just starting this business.

This July, Raul joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raul is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase grocery items and ingredients. This will be the first loan taken out by Raul from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and ingredients

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Sambok

texts.en: Mrs. Sambok A. is a farmer in Trapaing Knol Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Thuok SA., sells firewood. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sambok A. is requesting a loan, which she use along with her savings, to buy a horse and cart to transport the firewood to sell. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is 26 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school; the other two are too young to work or study. Her husband and a child appear with her in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a horse and cart to transport the firewood to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and she is a simple resident of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. She is married to Gilbert who is one of the respected councilors in their village. They are blessed with three children: Yolly Bert, their eldest, who is presently studying in college, Jacquelyn, 17 years old, who temporarily stopped her college education and J-R, a high school student.  

Yolanda maintains a motorcycle transport business. She gains income through a daily transport boundary basis of PHP200.00.  For additional income, she also ventured into meat vending.  She will first get orders from customers and then deliver them to their houses using a motorcycle. She gains a good income in this business and she is thankful that through the business she is able to help her husband support the education of their children. Wanting to improve her pork vending leads her to seek the support of Kiva lenders.  She hopes to borrow a loan amounting to PHP7,000 that she will use for the maintenance of their motorcycle that she uses to deliver fresh pork and for her transport business.

loans.use: To maintain their motorcycle

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok K., 55 (pictured with her son), is a widow with three sons and five daughters. Six of them are married and live separately, one son weaves silk at home and another son is a monk. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sok has been a silk weaver for 20 years. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sok is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Anyawen

texts.en: Anyawen A. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase yeasts for brewing. Anyawen is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more yeasts for brewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies of spare parts

loans.name: Gloria Reyna

texts.es: Gloria Reyna es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive n la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 36 años D. edad, es madre D. dos menores, se dedica a  la confección D. prendas D. vestir y también venD. ropa D. segundo uso, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo en todo momento. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Loreto” desD. hace dos años, donD. siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en sus pagos. El primer crédito que obtuvo le permitió invertir en productos D. belleza para vender D. casa en casa, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que le permitirá invertir en telas, hilos, elásticos para confeccionar blusas y luego venderlas. La meta D. Gloria es llegar a tener un taller bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Gloria a a dynamic, cooperative, 36-year-old, woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of two minor children and she makes clothing and sells used clothing. She can count on her husband's support for her activities at all times. She has been a member of the "Loreto" communal bank for the last 2 years and she has always been noted for the timeliness of her repayments. The first loan she received allowed her to invest in beauty products which she sold from home. Currently, she needs a 2000 sol loan to buy fabric, thread and elastics which she will use to sew blouses for sale. Gloria's goal is to have a well-supplies workshop and to continue improving economically.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and elastic for blouse manufacture.

loans.name: Confidence

texts.en:
Confidence is 48 years old. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Confidence sells printed textile fabrics. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Confidence also sells charcoal. She buys the textiles in nearby towns. Confidence has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Fose Kapwa Group

texts.en:
The “Fose Kapwa” Group is made up of twenty male and female entrepreneurs. After hearing so many good things from other business owners in neighboring towns, the group is excited to receive their loans. Yfonia V. is one of four representatives of the group. She is a single mother of two children, 10 and 13 yrs old.

This hardworking mom sells used clothing, men and women’s footwear, and suitcases, which she normally buys in the big city, Cap Haitien, to sell in various surrounding semi-rural communities. She is looking forward to being better able to provide for her family. Yfonia dreams of one day having a boutique and being able to build a home with the increased profits from her business.

On behalf of Yfonia, Fose Kapwa, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, sandals and suitcases to sell

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Martha Esperanza E. G. tiene 37 años de edad es madre de tres hijos y vive en union libre con el sr. Mario Gomez Duron quien se dedica a la construccion.
doña Marta se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para dama y caballero, la ropa para niños es nueva. Su producto lo vende en la comunidad del Jicaro Galan Nacaome Valle
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas ropa ya que tiene muchos encargos para la epoca de navidad, su producto lo vende al credito.
su maximo deseo es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad y que sean buenos profesionales, es lo que desea para lo que mas quiere en su vida.
texts.en:
Martha Esperanza E. G. is 37 years old, the mother of three children, and lives with her common-law husband Mario Gomez Duron, who is a construction worker.

Marta sells used clothing for adults and new clothing for children. She sells her products in the Jicaro Galan Nacaome Valle neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing, since she has many orders for the Christmas season and sells her merchandise on credit. Her biggest dream in life is to see her children graduate from college and become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new clothes for children and used clothes for adults

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: M. Yvette est née vers 1980 à Aplahoué au Bénin. Mariée à SOSSOU Georges, un transporteur, Yvette est mère de trois enfants. Yvette a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Tous les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. La famille vit à Akossavié à Hevié (non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin) depuis trois ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs deux ans que Yvette vend du maïs et de haricot au marché de Cococodji, à quelques kilomètres de Cotonou, et aussi à son domicile. Yvette s’approvisionne à Adja au Mono (Bénin). C’est la première fois que Yvette sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Yvette M. was born around 1980 in Aplahoué in Benin. She is married to Georges SOSSOU, a truck driver, and is the mother of three. Yvette supports another child, in addition to her own children. All the children lack schooling.

The family has been living in Akossavié Hevié (not far from Cotonou, Benin's economic capital) for the past three years. The couple shares the support for the family. Yvette has not attended school.

For approximately two years, she has been selling corn and beans at the Cococodji market, a few kilometers from Cotonou, and also from her home. Yvette gets her supplies from Adja in the Mono province (Benin). This is the first time she has applied for a loan with ALIDé, with the aim of reinforcing her activity and becoming more responsive to her customer's requests.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy three bags of corn and one bag of beans.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en: Ms. Fatou N. participates in the weekly markets around Bambey, a town about 100 km from Dakar. UIMCEC opened a branch in the area in July, 2009 to better serve its rural clients. She sells mainly cereals, such as couscous, though over the past twenty years she has sold a variety of different products. She says that she relies on her small business to meet her family's needs, especially since her husband has passed away. She hopes to diversify into other products once again so as to increase her income. This is the first loan for Ms. N. and it will allow her to replenish her stock of cereals.

loans.use: To replenish her stock of cereals.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana, de 47 años, vive al lado de su esposo Juan (52) y con sus 4 jóvenes hijos: Lourdes (30), Juan (27), Miguel (25) y Adrián (6). Todos muy unidos habitan en la tranquilidad de su casa propia.

Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos comestibles en la tienda que acondicionó en un ambiente de su casa. Su labor empieza a las 8 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche. Lo que más le agrada de vender es que puede interactuar con sus vecinos, ya que todos acuden regularmente a su tienda debido a la variedad de sus productos que ofrece; desde golosinas hasta verduras, frutas y carne de pollo fresca; además las ganancias son muy buenas porque no tiene competencia cercana.
Como Emiliana es una mujer emprendedora tiene planeado para el futuro mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y convertirla en un minimercado, para obtener mejores ganancias y ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes. 

Ya tiene varios años trabajando con MFP y este es el 10mo préstamo que tiene con la entidad, es por esta razón que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. Emiliana tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su tienda y así seguir progresando en la vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 47, lives with her husband, Juan (52) and her four young children: Lourdes (30), Juan (27), Miguel (25) and Adrián (6). They all live together peacefully in their own home. She has sold basic food items for the last 30 years from a grocery store installed in her own home. She starts her work day at 8am and ends at 10pm. What she likes best about her work is interacting with her neighbors since they come to her store regularly to see what she has to offer: everything from sweets to vegetables, fruits, and fresh chicken. Her profits are good because she doesn't have any nearby competition. Because Emiliana is an enterprising woman, she is planning to improve her store's installations and turn it into a minimart in the future, in order to increase her profits and offer the best to her customers. She has collaborated with MFP for many years and this is her 10th loan. She, therefore, pledges, once again, to be very punctual with her payments. Emiliana plans to invest the money in merchandise with which to stock her store and thus continue to progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Women Of Hope Group

texts.en: Garmai N. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Women of Hope. In the photo, Garmai is the one holding the sign. She is 45 years old and is married with three children aged 14 to 24 years, with educational levels of 6th grade through college student. Garmai and her family live in the New Matadi Community, and she works in the New Matadi Peace Market about fifteen minutes drive from downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She was never able to go to school herself due to lack of financial support from parents. Garmai’s business is the sale of charcoal. She buys her charcoal from rural Liberia and sells it in the Matadi Peace Market. She has been running this business for three years and hopes to own a bigger business in the near future. She started selling with 3,000 Liberian dollars as working capital but now operates with nearly 20,000 Liberian dollars. Garmai sells dry charcoal and has a good relationship with her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase additional charcoal for resale. Garmai dreams of seeing her children get educated and of having a good home in the future. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario denominado Bello Amanecer, esta integrado por tres personas, dos  mujeres y un varon, ellos son personas que viven humildemente en la comunidad la Nueva Caucara, dicha colonia se formo despues del huracan mitch y donde la mayoria de habitantes son parientes, es por eso que este lugar es una comunidad bien tranquila para vivir.
 
la señora Arlis Yaneth N. A., tiene 34 años de edad y se dedica a la venta  de baleadas y refrescos naturales en su comunidad, la ubicación de su casa le ayuda ya que esta junto a la escuela de la comunidad, ahora esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas materia prima y asi aprovechar la epoca escolar.
 
la señora Maria Concepcion A.. tiene 60 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Celso Avila con quien tuvo 4 hijos,  ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propios hogares.
Maria se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia desde hace 10 años, esto le a servido para ayudar a su esposo en las obligaciones del hogar.
esta solicitando  el credito para invertirlo en su negocio y tenerlo mas surtido.
 
Julio Cesar N. A. tiene 30 años y es padre de 3 hijos, todos ellos pequeños y estan en 
edad escolar, esta casado con Eila Areceli Montoya quien labora en la empacadora de camaron
san lorenzo, don Julio se dedica a la venta de mariscos, en especial camaron y pescado
desde hace 1 año, estos productos los comercializa en Tegucigalpa una vez por semana.
esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas producto y con ello mejorar sus ganancias.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus familias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group Bello Amanecer consists of three people, two women and a man, who humbly live in the community of Nueva Caucara. The community was forced after Hurricane Mitch, and most of the inhabitants are parents, so it's a peaceful place to live. Arlis Yaneth N. A. is 34 years old and makes a living selling natural refreshments in her community. Her home's location helps her, since it is right in front of the local school. She is requesting the loan to purchase more raw materials so she can take advantage of the school season. Maria Concepcion A. is 60 years old and married to Celso Avila, and together they have four children who are full-grown and have their own homes. Maria has made a living selling groceries out of her convenience store for the past 10 years, and this allows her to help her husband with household obligations. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and increase her store's supply stock. Julio Cesar N. A. is 30 years old and has three children, all of whom are small and of school age. He is married to Eila Areceli Montoya, who works at the San Lorenzo shrimp packaging plant. Julio has made a living selling seafood, especially shrimp and fish, for the past year. He sells the products in Tegucigalpa one time per week. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase more products and increase his earnings. All the members need to loan to make headway with their family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit, water, sugar, seafood, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soap, sugar, soft drinks and rice in bulk

loans.name: Risik

texts.en:
Risik is 54 years old, and she is still very energetic. She is a widow who lost her husband some years ago. She sells groceries, foodstuffs, and drinks in her shop. She loves her business, because it gives her the opportunity to take care of herself, as well as her two children's financial needs. She has been in the business for the past 25 years, and she has been able to use her years of experience to retain her customers.

She hopes to expand her business more, and she hopes for this loan of 100,000 NGN in order to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mtendeje

texts.en: Mtendeje I. is a small entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business as a food vender at Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She prepares and sells both cooked and fried food to customers. She also sells some soft drinks. She purchases her business goods from the foodstuff shops at Kariakoo and other shops around. The business income enabled her to buy a plot of land at Kigamboni for residential house building. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Levon

texts.en: Levon K. was born in 1957 in Ijevan city. He is married and has three children: two daughters and a son. His son is school-aged, one daughter is a student, and his elder daughter graduated from the institute last year but is still jobless. For 12 years Levon worked as a warehouse manager at Ijevan's building administration. After that he moved from Armenia to Russia, but in 2000 he returned to his native land and organized his own food trading business. During these years, with income from his business, Levon was able to keep his family, pay for his daughters’ education and also to increase the size of his shop. Levon seeks a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy sausages, chicken meat, juice, etc. for his shop. He intends to spend future income on his shop's extension and repair.

loans.use: To buy sausages, chicken meat, juice, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Hace 30 años Gloria Marie González vive en el barrio las carabelas, D. gente muy cálida y fraternal, donD. la conocen y es un sector con una infraestructura ambiental muy conservada.   Esa es la descripción  del lugar donD. Gloria desarrolla una multiplicidad D. actividades que la han ayudado a salir adelante  en la educación D. sus 3 hijos ya mayores edad, ella tiene  una miscelánea, pero también ofrece servicios D. lavandería, trabaja las manualidades y elabora ropa D. bebe, bufandas sacos, en fin  a todo lo que se le ocurra que es un ingreso  Gloria se le miD. y siempre ha sido asì. Ella empezó a ser negociante  el barrio Galería donD. ganó su amplia trayectoria en el comercio, después se trasladó a su casa, donD. su clientela ha ido en ascenso porque D. un servicio pasan a adquirir otro, D. los que ella misma ofrece.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito hacerle  mejoras locativas  especialmente el techo  donD. está la miscelánea, hacer adecuación D. un canal y tapar  las goteras, previniendo la  humedad para que no se  deteriore su mercancía especialmente en épocas D. lluvia.
Su meta es ampliar su negocio y emplear gente, también  aumentar los inventarios y ofrecer servicios  que ofrezcan solución a sus clientes. Su desafío actual es mantener su familia unida, porque  el ser mama cabeza D. hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos fue el desafío más granD. que ha tenido en su vida.
texts.en:
For 30 years Gloria Marie González has lived in the Carabelas suburb, with warm and friendly people, where they know her and it is an area with a well maintained environmental infrastructure. This is the description of the place where Gloria developed a variety of businesses that have helped her to get ahead in the education of her 3 adult-age children. She has a small general store, but also offers laundry services, she works with handicrafts and makes baby clothes, scarves and bags. In the end everything that occurs to her that could be income Gloria considers it, and it has always been this way. She became a businesswoman in the Galería suburb where she gained her broad career in commerce, and after she moved to her home her customer base has increased because one service led to adding another that she offers. Currently she needs a loan to make improvements to her premises especially the ceiling where the store is, upgrading the guttering and fixing the leaks, preventing the humity so that her goods do not perish especially in the rainy season. Her goal is to expand her business and employ people, also to increase her stock and offer services that proviD. a solution for her customers. Her current challenge is to keep her family close, because being a mother, the head of the home and for her children to get ahead is the biggest challenge that she has had in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her premises especially the roof where the store is, upgrade the guttering and fix the leaks

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar Antonio tiene el negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación,  realiza sus compras de contado a camiones repartidores, sus ventas las efectúa de contado y al crédito.  Sus padres fueron los que desde chico le inculcaron y le enseñaron todo lo relacionado al comercio, pues siempre tuvieron negocio. Cuando empezó a ser independiente, busca la forma de cómo generar ingresos a su familia. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio y hacerlo más productivo.
texts.en:
Oscar Antonio has a business, which is a minimarket in his house. He buys his supplies for cash from delivery trucks. His sales are for cash or credit. His parents were the ones that influenced him and taught him everything about business. They always had a business. When he started to become independent, he looked for the way to generate income for his family. He is requesting a new loan to invest in his business to make it more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jemilatu

texts.en:
Jemilatu I. sells cassava powder, maize powder, fresh groundnuts and beans at the Abura market. Her stock of goods was in her shop at the market at the time of photo, so shown was what she had with her in the house yet to be conveyed to the marketplace. She has been in her line of business for four years now. 

Jemilatu is married and her husband is a plumber. She has received senior high education. Jemilatu helps her husband take care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groundnuts and beans to sell. She hopes to reinvest her new earnings into her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs (groundnuts and beans) to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen M. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual puedo realizar la mejora.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la barda trasera de su casa, porque hay terreno y hay muchos animales teme que puedan picar a su hijo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe por cuidar a unos niños y de limpieza en una casa, ya que su esposo el señor Arturo Rafael Zavala se encargara de los gastos familiares en el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de camión de carga.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen M. is grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan. She was able to make an improvement with the loan. She is requesting a new loan to build a fence in the back of her house. There are a lot of animals on the land there, and she is afraid they will be able to bite her son. She plans of paying the loan with the income she receives for taking care of some children and cleaning a house. Her husband, Arturo Rafael Zavala, will pay the family expenses from the salary he receives from his work as a cargo truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence in the back of her house

loans.name: Sari's Group

texts.en: Five people are made up a group loan and they live in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sari P. is a group leader who was born in 1972, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a farmer who owns two point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family moreover she is also a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Chork Suon, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Both of them do work a lot but they can earn a little income. So to improve their family living, Mrs. Sari P. is finding for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children whom all are attending in local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Marineth

texts.en:
Marineth M. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Marineth is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marineth owns & operates a tailoring business.The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Marineth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marineth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marineth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Marineth is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread. This will be the second loan taken out by Marineth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread

loans.name: Gogonyo Women And Orphan Association-Kampala Group

texts.en:
S. Sarah, 48, has relied on her suave, self-motivated and strong-hearted entrepreneurial spirit to make progress in her small kiosk business in Nsambya-Kampala. Sarah, who is married and has eight children, was pep-talked into this business by one of her closest friends. This was her first business and has, for all this time, been her main source of livelihood. It is a modest business but Sarah has been able to live on its proceeds.
Mainly, Sarah sells edibles such as roast bananas, chicken and local prepared dishes. With the help of this loan, she intends to boost her business in the way she knows best – by buying more foods such as maize flour, rice, cassava and beans. Her optimism is sky high that she will be able to make more money when she buys a greater variety of food to prepare for her old, new and prospective customers.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Fente Allah Bô Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Fente Allah bô sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, 8 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tènè relevant de la sous-préfecture de Tènè, préfecture de SAN, (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font essentiellement l’achat vente de tissus, de pagnes wax, de  bijoux et des  produits cosmétiques.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  sont à leur  5  prêt solidaire.
BINTOU D. utilisera son nouveau prêt pour acheter 2 balles de pagnes wax, 3 douzaines de bijoux et une importante quantité de produits cosmétiques. 
Elle s’approvisionne  essentiellement à Bamako et au Burkina Faso avec les grossistes pour revendre au marché hebdomadaire de Tènè, dans les foires hebdomadaires environnantes et  à domicile, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent avoir 26.000FCFA, BINTOU D. envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 29.000 FCFA qui servira à étoffer son fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses de nourriture, de scolarité et de santé.
texts.en:
The women of the Fente Allah bô group are all married. On average, they are 39 years old, have 8 children and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Tènè in the sub-prefecture of Tènè, prefecture of SAN (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women met each other through neighborhood connections and family ties. They mainly buy and sell fabric, wax “pagnes” (traditional brightly-colored fabric), jewelry and cosmetics. After having repaid in full the 4 previous loans, the women of the group are on their fifth solidarity loan. BINTOU D. will use her new loan to buy 2 bolts of wax “pagnes”, 3 dozen jewelry pieces and a large quantity of cosmetics. She gets her supplies mainly in Bamako and in Burkina Faso from wholesalers. She sells them at the weekly market in Tènè, in weekly market fairs nearby and door-to-door. Cash or credit for retail sales is accepted from a customer base composed of women and men. While the other members of the group expect to earn 26,000 CFA Francs, BINTOU D. envisions making an average monthly profit of 29,000 CFA Francs that she will use to expand her business and provide for food, school and health expenses.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Lesirko Ole

texts.en:
Lesirko Ole S. is 41 years old. He is married to Silole Sanamwala and is the father of five school-going children. He is a farmer and he farms his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

Lesirko learned about KADET from other members in a group in his area already registered with KADET. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend on preparing his land for planting wheat. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to the good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Lesirko’s dream is to become a large-scale farmer and to buy his own vehicle which will used to transport his farm produce to different markets. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare land for planting wheat

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
el señor Damian L. tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos que dependen de el, dos de ellos le ayudan en su taller.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de herramientas para su taller ya que dia con dia se le dañan o se 
extravian las herramientas.
Esta actividad de mecanica la realiza desde hace 18 años, no tiene casa propia ya que le ha sido dificil construirla. 
 
su mayor sueño es poder un dia tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Damian L. is 50 years old, he is married and he has 4 children that depend on him. Two of his children assist him in his shop.

The loan will be used to purchase tools for his shop. Day after day the tools wear out or they get lost. 

He has been a mechanic for the last 18 years. He doesn't have a house of his own. He has found it difficult to build it. 

His greatest dream is to have a house of his own one day.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai K., 22, is married and lives with her husband and child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. and her husband sell soymilk, earning an income of about $4.90 per day. K. has to spend $102 on food, $5 on electricity and water supplies, and $60 on other necessary expenses every month.  

K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a machine for producing soymilk in order to improve her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph because K. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a machine for producing soymilk

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila A. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a tailoring business. She lives in Barangay Mantalongon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and tailoring businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $300. 

Teofila is borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she can purchase materials for her tailoring business.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teofila aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and insure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR D. COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; tiene 53 años D. edad, y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. conejos, la socia venD. en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias que se dan en el distrito D. Anta, la socia quiere tener un lugar más granD. para vender los conejos. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar conejos

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Bernardina belongs to the “SR D. COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO” Communal Bank.  The bank is locted in the Cachimayo district, which belongs to the Anta province, Cusco department.

Bernardina, age 53, is married and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling rabbits.  She sells in an itinerant manner at the different fairs in the Anta district.  She wants to have a larger place to sell the rabbits.

She is requesting the loan to buy rabbits.

She is grateful for the requested loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy rabbits

loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es: Un grupo con mucho en común que es el entusiasmo por surgir en los negocios propios, así es el grupo comunal Juntos para el Éxito una alcancía comunal con características D. éxito. Conformado por 11 integrantes hace más D. ocho meses. Cada integrante se dedica a diversos comercios, tal es así el caso D. L. señora Diana Castañeda D. 24 años D. edad y madre D. un pequeño D. 3 añitos, elL. como todas los días se dedica a L. venta D. comida por las mañanas y por las tarD. ocupa todo su tiempo al cuidado D. su menor hijo. ElL. comenzó en este negocio por iniciativa D. su madre L. cual también se dedica al mismo negocio. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo a podido aportar económicamente a su hogar para a si poder seguir saliendo adelante. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en mejoras para su negocio y compra D. mercadería para el mismo. Como L. señora Diana Castañeda cada integrante D. esta alcancía comunal lucha por salir adelante y con gran esfuerzo y dedicación lo consiguen  cada día. Por el bienestar propio y D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The 'Juntos para el Éxito' (Together for Success) communal bank is maD. up of a group of people who have a lot in common, including their enthusiasm for getting ahead in their respective businesses.  The group was founded eight months ago with 11 members.  Each member has their own business.  One of the group's members is Diana Castañeda.  She is 24 years old and has a little one who is 3 years old.  Every day she sells food in the morning and looks after her child in the afternoon.  Her mother is in the same business and it was her mother who suggested she set up her own business.

Through her hard work, Diana has been able to financially support her household so that they can continue to get ahead in life.  She will use this loan to invest in improving her business and to buy merchandise for it.  Like Diana, each member of this communal bank works hard to get ahead and with great effort and determination they manage it every day, for their own well-being and that of their families.

loans.use: To invest in improving her business

loans.name: Barahunda Group

texts.es:
Esta Unidad de Desarrollo sus integrantes lo han llamado “Barahunda” porque es el nombre de su comunidad y por el significado de la palabra que es: “fiesta, bullicio, ruido o confusión” ya que este grupo se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y unido. Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Barahunda a 1 hora de la ciudad de Tierra Blanca en el estado de VeraC., está conformado por 13 personas y es su 3° préstamo con Fundación Realidad.

La representante del grupo se llama Maricela T. Ramírez tiene 40 años estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria y es madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son niñas y uno es niño. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su hogar llamado "Novedades Isabel" en el que vende ropa de dama y caballero, zapatos y bisutería (pulseras, anillos y collares elaborados con materiales de adorno). Ella necesita su préstamo para comprar más ropa y surtir su negocio, para poder obtener más ganancias y hacer que negocio crezca poco a poco. Ella espera en un futuro agrandar su local y darles estudios a sus hijos. La señora Maricela se encuentra muy agradecida con FRAC por haber llevado este programa hasta su comunidad el cual les permite tener una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Josefa C. B. también es integrante del grupo Barahunda tiene 33 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es madre soltera de dos hijos un niño de 13 años y una niña de 12 años los cuales estudian. Ella tiene en su casa un pequeño deposito de refrescos, también vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, tacos, tortas y pollos asados). “Doña Chepa” como la llaman sus compañeros invertirá el préstamo en la compra mercancía (tortillas, maíz, queso, mayonesa, lechuga, tomates, cebollas, pollos, chiles y frijol) para la preparación de sus antojitos. Ella espera con sus ganancias pagar a tiempo su préstamo y seguir invirtiendo para poder darles más estudios a sus hijos
Los otros 11 integrantes son:

Maria de Lourdes G. C.- venta de catálogo de de perfumes, talcos pinturas, para su venta
Mónica Delfín C.- venta de perfumería
José Antonio Ramírez R.-venta de ropa de dama y caballero, pollo
Elia M. L.-venta de muebles 
Alicia Sánchez C.-venta de productos naturistas 
Rosa Ramírez R.-venta por cata lago de cosméticos
Víctor Luis C. C.-venta de pescado 
Etanislao R. S.-venta de ganado 
Iraís E. Hernández-venta de zapatos para dama
Rebeca Hernández S.-venta de calzado para dama y caballero
Adolfina P. C.- venta de oro
texts.en:
The members of this development unit gave it the name "Barahunda" because it is the name of their community and because the meaning of the word is "party, bustle, noise or confusion" and this group is characterized by being very happy and united.  This group is located in the town of Barahunda, an hour away from the city of Tierra Blanca in the state of VeraC..  It is comprised of 13 people and this is their third loan from Fundación Realidad.

The leader of the group is Maricela T. Ramírez, 40 years old, who was in primary school until sixth grade and is a single mother of 3 children, 2 of which are girls and one is a boy.  She has a small business of her own called "New Isabel" where she sells men's and women's clothing, shoes, and jewelry (bracelets, rings, and necklaces adorned with decorative materials).  She needs her loan in order to purchase more clothing and fill her shop so that she is able to earn more money and grow her business little by little.  She hopes to increase the size of her shop in the future and enable her children to continue their studies.  Ms. Maricela is grateful to FRAC for bringing this program that allows for having a higher quality of life to the community.

Ms. Josefa C. B. is another member of the Barahunda group, 33 years old, who studied until the third year of high school.  She is a single mother of two, one 13-year-old boy and one 12-year-old girl who are both in school.  She has a small inventory of soft drinks in her house and also sells Mexican food (empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, tacos, cakes, and grilled chicken).  “Doña Chepa”, as her friends call her, will invest the loan in ingredients (tortillas, corn, cheese, mayonnaise, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, chicken, peppers and beans) for the preparation of her snacks. She expects to repay her loan on time and continue investing in order to enable further education for her children.

The other 11 members are:

Maria de Lourdes G. C.- catalog sales of perfumes and makeup
Mónica Delfín C.- perfume shop sales
José Antonio Ramírez R.- men's and women's clothing, chicken
Elia M. L.- furniture sales 
Alicia Sánchez C.- sales of natural products 
Rosa Ramírez R.- cosmetics through catalog
Víctor Luis C. C.- fish sales 
Etanislao R. S.- livestock sales 
Iraís E. Hernández- sales of women's shoes
Rebeca Hernández S.- sales of footwear for men and women
Adolfina P. C.- gold sales

loans.use: to purchase perfume, clothing, shoes, fishing nets, and food for sale

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal O. (shown in the photo) is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Bros Tuy, is 41 years old. They have been married since 1997 and have two children. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sophal is a lotus farmer and, when the harvest season comes, she takes them to Phnom Penh market to sell. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to transport her lotus to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport lotus to sell.

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Olga Leticia R.  esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual su negocio ha tenido mas ingreso. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder invertir en mas equipos y acondicionar el local y así poder contratar a una persona para que le ayude a las ventas de aparatos y accesorios de teléfonos celulares. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio ya que los gastos familiares se encargan.
texts.en: Mrs. Olga Leticia Ramirez is very thankful for the support provided by her last loan, which helped her increase her business' income.  She is applying for a new loan to invest in more equipment and set up her premises.  In this way, she will be able to hire someone to help her with the sale of cellular phones and phone accessories. She plans to pay the back the loan with the profits she makes in her business, as her household expenses are already taken care of.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for business

loans.name: Edda María Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jesús Del Gran Poder se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta.  Para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Aquí conocimos a Edda, tiene 54 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque ha recibido mucha ayuda tanto de parte de las socias del grupo como también de la institución y por eso está muy agradecida con todos.

Se dedica al comercio, tiene un bazar en su casa en el cual trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 18h00, aquí ella vende de todo como: ropa, zapatos, de distintos modelos y variedades, además de bisutería y también se pueden encontrar toda clase de regalos, nos cuenta que le encanta su trabajo y que lleva con el algunos años. Su mercadería se la envían desde el exterior y también compra en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, otras cosas. Sus sueños son seguir creciendo cada dia mas en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Jesús del Gran Poder community bank meets in the beautiful city of Calceta.  As far as the residents of Calceta are concerned, there is no city more beautiful in the world.

Here we meet 54 year-old Edda.  Edda is single and lives in her parents' home.  This is her third loan cycle with her community bank and she likes being a member because she has received a lot of help both from the other members of her group and from the institution.  She is very grateful to everybody for this help.

Edda is a saleswoman.  She has a store in her home where she works every day from 9.00am to 6.00pm.  She sells a bit of everything such as clothes, different styles of shoes, costume jewelry and all kinds of gifts.  She tells us that she loves her work and that she has been in her business for some years.  She receives her merchandise from abroad and she also buys some in Guayaquil.

Edda will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, costume jewelry and other products.  Her dream is to continue growing every day both in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, perfume, costume jewelry, gifts, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 40 years old and the father of two children. He sells electronic goods for a living.  He also does dairy farming to supplement his family’s income. James started his business in 1995 and has witnessed its growth through Faulu Kenya, hence improving his standard of living. He hopes that someday he will become a successful businessman. He will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy a television.

loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Claudia Ramona

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de telica ,es madre soltera, comerciante tiene 1 niña de 10 años, la cual estudia en el colegio de esta localidad,  esta señora siempre ha sido fiadora de su hermana que también es clienta de la empresa ceprodel telica, dicha actividad la ejerce desde hace 9 años, la cual comenzó con una ayuda que le brindo su suegra mama de su ex marido, proveyéndola de mercadería, para que iniciara su actividad comercial, ya que dicha señora, la suegra es comerciante mayorista de la cuidad de león, y quiere legar la cultura de trabajo que también se las ha dejado a sus hijos, con buen éxito, ella tiene experiencia en créditos, y los mismos la han ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: This client is originally from Telica.  She is a single mother and a saleswoman.  She has a daughter, 10 years old, who studies in the local school.  This woman has always been a guarantor for her sister who is also a client of Ceprodel Telica.  She has had her store for more than 9 years, beginning with the help that her mother-in-law, her ex-husband's mother, gave her.  She provided her with merchandise to begin her business, since her mother-in-law is a wholesaler in the city of Leon and wants to pass on the business that she has also left to her sons with great success.  She has experience with loans, and they have helped her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to increase inventory: oil, chicken, sugar, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Duc's Group

texts.en:
Duc T. N. is 48 years old with three children. Two of them are attending high school.  Being a cake maker, she  has opened a shop that sells her products in the local market. Every day, she can sell 1000 cakes with 150,000 VND profit. Besides, to take full advantage of leftovers, she raises 10 pigs  for meat.  Regarding to her attitude to our credit program, she is always a good re-payer. Currently, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy materials  for making cakes.

 Hien T. N. is 48  years old. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She needs to have 6,496,000 VND to buy feed for them.

 N. T. N. is 41 years old. She is breeding pigs for their offspring. She needs to have a loan of 6,496,000 VND to improve her pig sty. 

 Nam T. N. is 48  years old . She has a wood workshop  at her house. She is in need of 6,496,000 VND to buy materials.

 Tan T. N.  is 26 years old . She is running a shop that sells fresh fruit in the local market. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy more fruit to meet the demand of customers.

  Tuyet T. N. is 31 years old . She has a shop that sells clothes in  Yen Phu market. She needs to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Nga T. V. is 31 years old. She has a small grocery shop in Yen Phu market. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy more kinds of products to attract more and more customers to come.

 Trang T. N.  is 21 years old . She makes popcorn to sell  wholesale. She wants  to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to do maintenance on her popcorn making machine.

loans.use: to buy materials  for making cakes

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco y tiene 29 años de edad. Actualmente, Pamela vive en la misma ciudad donde nació ósea en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de ceviche de forma ambulatoria. Ya son cuatro años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Pamela en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para los utiles escolares de sus hijos. Su sueño de Pamela es abrir un restaurante donde pueda vende ceviche pero ella muy emocionada nos cuenta que está buscando el local para poder vender sus ricos platos de comida.    
 
Pamela es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Pamela was born in Cusco Province and Department and is 29 years old.  Today, Pamela still lives in the city of her birth, namely, the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú).  She is a responsible mother who moves her family forward.  Her main economic activity is selling ceviche (marinated seafood cocktail) in an itinerant way.  She has been in this line of work for four years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

On this occasion Pamela needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay for her children’s school supplies.  Pamela’s dream is to open a restaurant where she can sell her ceviche and she’s very excited about this; she relates that she’s looking for a locale in which to sell her delicious dishes.

Pamela is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy her children's school supplies.

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es:
Francisca del Socorro M. Salazar es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 56 años tiene un comedor donde oferta desayunos, almuerzos y cena en el plantel los coco. Ella trabaja junto a su compañero de vida con el propósito de ampliar su negocio y salir adelante.

Ella ha participado en las capaciones que Adim brinda lo cual les ha ayudado a salir a delante.
texts.en:
Francisca del Socorro M. Salazar is a hardworking, 56 year old enterprising woman who puts a lot of effort into her food business.  She has a dining room where she sells breakfasts, lunches, and dinners on the coconut plantation.  She works with her life partner and wants to expand her business and get ahead.

She has gotten training from ADIM which has helped her get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, de 46 años, es un hombre trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Francisca de 39 años y sus 06 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Modesto, son el principal sustento que tiene toda su familia, Modesto se dedica a labrar la tierra  donde tiene plantas de cacao, café, plátano y  raíces de barbasco; sus productos son muy solicitados en los centros de acopio, ya que su fama de cosechar frutos de muy buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a buenos precios. En época de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza contrata peones  para facilitarse con el trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar en el desarrollo de sus plantas. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de sus cultivos, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y es el primero en llegar a las reuniones. Con el crédito solicitado comprará triciclos que le serán de gran utilidad para trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad.
texts.en: 46-year-old Modesto is a hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his 39-year-old wife Francisca and his 6 dear children for which he wishes to provide a better quality of life.  The fields for sowing, which Modesto obtained with much effort, are the principal means of support for the whole family. Modesto dedicates himself to working the fields where he has cocoa, coffee, plantains and barbasco root plants. His products are in very high demand in the storage centers, since he has a good reputation for growing very high-quality fruit, which helps him sell his goods at a good price. In the harvesting and weeding seasons he hires day laborers to facilitate the work.  What he most likes about his work is to protect his crops from the plagues of insects that can affect the development of his plants.  He has been doing this for 15 years and what he considers the most difficult is transporting the sacs of his crops, since they are very heavy and it is very tiring. In the future he hopes to buy more land to increase his cultivation. This is his second loan with MFP. He knows that it will be very beneficial for the development of his work. In his communal bank, he is a very cheerful member and is the first to arrive at the meetings.  With the requested loan he will by tricycles (three-wheeled wagons) that will be very useful in helping him transport his goods form the ranch to the community.

loans.use: to buy tricycles (three-wheeled wagons for transporting crops).

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Forjadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Son 2 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.  Maritza se dedica a la venta de madera en tablas para encofrados y listones.  Esta madera la manda a preparar para poder venderla, su esposo también está dentro del  negocio, son socios.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 20 polines (madera) para mandar a preparar tablas para encofrados.
Sus hijos todavía son estudiantes y tiene que trabajar para poder pagar los gastos del colegio, todo el día atiende en su negocio y a veces no tiene tiempo para atender a sus hijos, por lo que paga a una señora para que se encargue de su casa y del cuidado de ellos.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the 'Mujeres Forjadoras' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 46 years old, married, and has three children.

Martha has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her business is selling planks of wood for formwork (molds into which concrete is poured) and battens.  The wood is sent to be prepared so that it can be sold.  Her husband also works in the business.  They are partners.

Martha will use her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 20 lengths of wood to send to be turned into planks for formwork.

Martha's children are still in school and she has to work so that she can cover their school expenses.  She works in her business every day and sometimes she doesn't have time to look after her children so she pays a lady to take care of her house and look after her children.

loans.use: to buy lengths of wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Young Generation Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Young Generation” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of 800,000.00 SLL for each in order to further expand their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Mamusu.  Mamusu is 35 years old, married, and has two children, who attend school.  She was born in Magburaka town, where she is currently residing with her family. Her husband is a monthly salaried worker. For 15 years, Mamusu has been selling medicines and palm oil. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying more gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a forty six year old married male with six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the butcher business for sixteen years.  He started with very little capital but has seen it grow steadily over time.  

His hardship is lack of enough capital because his business is one of high turnover and he always needs restocking.  He says he is working hard to see his business blossom to greater heights.  Gideon needs the loan facility to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothing for sale.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio es natural de Huancas, anexo de Jauja, tiene 57 años y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Tiene 34 años de experiencia en la agricultura, todos los días sale a cuidar sus cultivos de papa, trigo, cebada y quinua. Al mismo tiempo se dedica a la crianza de animales entre ellos vacas y toros. Sus mayores ingresos se ven en la siembra de granos por lo que cada vez más intensifica en este trabajo. Muchas veces para él y su familia este es un trabajo agotador pero que se compensa con las ganancias que le permiten cubrir sus gastos, además de que siempre tiene disponible alimentos para su propio consumo y eso es una ventaja grande para su familia. Por ello seguirá trabajando en esta actividad y mejorando la calidad de los suelos fertilizándola con abono orgánico. Son 6 veces en las cuales solicita un crédito con MFP, y ha demostrado a las demás integrantes de su banco comunal mucha responsabilidad. Le agrada trabajar de esta manera porque siempre tiene de manera oportuna el dinero que necesita para sus actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará de manera urgente sacos de abono orgánico para  preparar la tierra para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en: A native of Huancas, an annex of Jauja, Eugenio is 57 years old, and he lives in his own house with his wife and 2 children. He has a 34-year-old experience in agriculture, and every day he tends to his potato, wheat, barley and quinoa crops. He also engages in breeding animals, among which cows and bulls. As his main incomes come from the grains harvests, he intensifies this crops every season. More often than not this is an exhausting job for his family and himself, but their effort is compensated by the earnings, enabling them to pay for their expenses; on top of this, there is always food available for them to eat, a great advantage for his family. This is why he will keep on engaging in this activity and in improving the quality of his lands by fertilizing them with manure. This is the sixth time he has asked MFP for a loan, and to the other members of his communal bank he has proved himself to be very responsible. He likes working in this way because he can always  get the money he needs for his agricultural activities in an appropriate way. The loan he is requesting will be immediately used to buy bags of manure to prepare his lands for the next planting season.

loans.use: To buy bags of manure.

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Byambahuu is 55 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter who studies at the Technology University, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two oldest children live separately. Byambahuu's family live in a Mongolian ger or yurt.  
Byambahuu has been in the bag retail business since 1995 and she sells bags in Narantuul trade market. From 2000, she successfully persuaded her brothers and sisters to join the bag retail business. Byambahuu's business' total capital turnover is five million MNT. She is very experienced in her field and has stable business activity. Byambahuu is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more bags from China and increase her working capital. She says she would like to remodel her fence and yard.

loans.use: to purchase more bags from China.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.en:
