Ozoda is 20 years old. Ozoda runs her own business in order to help support her family. She sells jewelry. Ozoda has been in this business for more than two years. Today Ozoda needs additional capital to purchase new items such as earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains. She wants to increase the variety of products she sells. This is Ozoda's second loan, and she promises to repay the loan according to the terms, as she has done with her previous loans. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase of new jewelry items such as earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 71 years old, married and blessed with eight grown-up children.  He has been operating a retail shop mainly selling sodas for five years and has employed five people.  He also does farming to supplement his income.  Previously, he was involved in the transport business.

He testifies that through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to build rental houses which generate more income for his family.  He hopes that his children will all become financially independent in five years.

He has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of sodas.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sodas.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 57 years old and a widow with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Olivia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Olivia has been farming vegetable for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling flowers.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hilda Consuelo

texts.es:
Hilda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, debido a la necesidad de introducir los servicios básicos del hogar, utilizando los fondos en el pago de la instalación de energía eléctrica.
El préstamo anterior le sirvió para fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes más productos, así como fue una gran ayuda para mantener a la clientela y mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Hilda has decided to ask for a new loan in order to have electricity installed at her home. The funds from this loan will be used to pay for the installation of electricity.

Her previous loan helped her grow her business and she was able to offer her customers more products, and this was a big help keeping her clients and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity at her home

loans.name: Zviriritire Group

texts.en:
Shinga is a hardworking 45-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children aged 31, 30 and 26; none of them attend school. She doesn't have any dependents. She lives in Mkoba, a high density suburb of Gweru.

Shinga is in the chicken rearing business, which has been in operation since 1998. The main challenge she faces is that chicks tends to have a high mortality rate. She also experiences late payment from her customers and shortages of chicken feed. She is also a border, where she gets some other income.

The loan would improve her life by giving her more disposable income.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Rhonda

texts.en:
Rhonda is a 29-year-old businesswomen from Turan in northern Israel. She opened her hair & bridal salon in 2009. After gaining clients Rhonda moved her salon to a more central and attractive location this year. Rhonda, a charismatic and dedicated stylist, has gained a reputation of dedication to her clients and of being a top-notch professional.

Rhonda needed this loan for minor renovations in her new salon, supplies, additional equipment and evening dresses for rental.

Rhonda hopes one day to be the salon in her area creating exclusivity in bridal needs and everyday styling. She also wants to train others from her area in the profession.

loans.use: to make minor renovations in her new salon and buy supplies, additional equipment and evening dresses for rental.

loans.name: Sengeli A Group

texts.en:
Alfred takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alfred was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on a ½ acre of land. With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Alfred is the facilitator of Sengeli group. Alfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Sengeli group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida, age 54, is a decorative embroidery expert, making beautiful looking embroidered clothes that sell for good prices in the market. She is very active and skillful and loves to do embroidery. Her clients trust in the quality of her goods and services and provide her with regular orders every month. Her husband is a shopkeeper and operates his shop in the nearby market. Khalida has given birth to three children. All of them have left their education and are currently looking for work.

She has applied for a loan from KIva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her embroidery business. She will utilize the loan amount by purchasing thread, beads, and cloth in bulk quantities that will allow her to attract more clients by providing them with even better quality services.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for many years. She is confident that a loan investment will help her bring in more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy beads, thread, and cloth in bulk quantities for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Patricia Aida

texts.es:
Patricia de 49 años, vende joyería de artesanía, vive con su esposo e hijos de 31, 26, 17 y 10 años.

Hace 15 años atrás aprendió hacer manualidades con artesanías para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos ya que una de sus hijas tiene el virus VIH en su sangre y necesita algunos tratamientos personales en una institución llamada “REDIMAS” en donde Patricia ayuda en su tiempo libre a dar charlas de motivación a las personas infectadas con la experiencia que ha pasado su familia con su hija. Trabaja en las mañana vendiendo las manualidades haciendo con algunos materiales de artesanía las pulseras, aretes, cadenas y en la noche da las charlas. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar joyería para venderlas y tener mas ingresos. Su meta es poder seguir adelante con su negocio y poder ayudarle a su esposo en su trabajo y a su hija quien lo necesita mucho.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 49, sells hand-made jewellery. She lives with her husband and children, ages 31, 26, 17, and 10.

She learned to make crafts fifteen years ago so that she could spend more time with her children, because one of her daughters has HIV in her blood and needs to have special treatments in an institution called "REDIMAS". Patricia helps out there in her free time, giving motivational talks about her family's experiences to the patients. She works in the mornings selling her crafts. She makes bracelets, earrings, and chains. In the evenings she gives talks in REDIMAS.

With this loan, she wants to buy jewellery to sell in order to have more income. Her goal is to keep moving forward with her business and to be able to help her husband with his work, and to help her daughter, who is in great need.

loans.use: to buy jewellery.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Trinidad works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Trinidad is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her fishing business. Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through 15 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Griselda  Cristiana

texts.es:
La señora Griselda Cristina es  una señora humilde, alegre trabajadora  con deseos de tener u mejor futuro en su comunidad.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Juan Omar un señor trabajador se dedica a la albañilería desde hace  siete años.
Tiene un hijo  quien le ayuda en su negocio de la venta de pollos, ya que va entregar los pedidos  y a cobrar.
Doña Griselda nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio  es pelar los pollos y limpiarlos.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de  más pollos para la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo  que le ha dado para seguir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Griselda Cristiana is a modest, happy, and hardworking woman who wants to have a better future in her community.  She is happily married to Juan Omar, a hardworking man who has worked in construction for seven years.  She has a son who helps her in her business selling chickens, since he goes out to deliver the orders and collect payment.  Griselda tells us that what she likes most about her business is plucking and cleaning the chickens.

She requested the loan to buy more chickens to sell.

She thanks the foundation for the support it has given her to get ahead and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 60-years-old. She lives in the village Misaktsieli, East Georgia, with her husband Beldar. Beldar works in the village. Ketevan heads the agricultural part of the farm business. The family owns 30 hens. Also, they have a pig and a calf. Ketevan sells eggs and piglets at the  local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Ketevan requested credit for purchasing a milking cow. She will produce cheese and sell it at the local market. The income of the family will increase and Ketevan will use it for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel es socio del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, tiene 19 años, el es músico, toca los timbales, no tiene hijos, es socio de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, desde my joven siempre trabajo, gracias a la invitación de su hermano entró a Finca y desde la fecha no se ha retirado por el contrario se esfuerza para poder ser puntual y responsable, le sirve mucho las capacitaciones que recibe y  las aplica en su vida, le enseña a poder administrar mejor su dinero, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de su batería, y lo que más desea es poder tener un grupo musical y crecer como músico.
texts.en: Miguel is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Margaritas (Daisies Communal Bank), he is 19 years old, he has no children and he is a musician, a timpani player. He has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years, and he has been working since he was young. He has been invited to join Finca by his brother, and rather than withdrawing from the group, he makes every possible effort to be punctual and responsible. The training seminars he attends are very helpful for him, and he applies them to his life. He has learned how to better manage his money, and the loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy drums. What he wants the most is to have his own music band and to grow as a musician.

loans.use: To buy drums.

loans.name: Agenda Group

texts.en:
Mrs Grace is 34 years old and married with three children. She has operated a sachet water whole sale store selling sachet water for seven years. Grace lives at cocoa bitch area in the Teshi district, a urban town in Accra province. Her family is a low-income household in the town, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Grace faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sachet water to resell on whole sale basis.

In this year, Grace joined ID-Ghana Institution to improve her business. Grace has successfully repaid four loans from ID-Ghana Institution. She is the group leader of the Agenda Group, which consists of three members. With her business profit, Grace hopes to build a new branch of business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more sachet water to resell on whole sale basis.

loans.name: Gheorghe

texts.en:
The central region of Moldova is known to produce the highest quality of fruits throughout Moldova; grapes, tomatoes, plums, cherries, apples and of course the juiciest watermelons you can eat are all grown in this region of Moldova. Gheorghe O. lives in the town of Sipoteni, rather than joining the many farmers already involved in production, he decided to take a further step and begin processing the produce into a higher value good. The main focus and cash crop of his business is drying plums into prunes, but his equipment can be used for many different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Gheorghe also produces dried apples, eggplant, squash and tomatoes to name a few.  For this he uses a high efficiency drying machine, powered by a gas furnace and multiple fans. It takes only one and a half hours for a batch of fresh produce to dry completely. After dehydration, the goods can be stored, packaged and shipped much more efficiently and obviously brings higher prices. His products are sold around Moldova and are bought by wholesalers as well. 
The scale of the operation has really grown lately, now having reached a level of production of 300 kilograms of fruit or vegetables per shift. The process of cleaning, de-seeding, and drying requires about a dozen workers per shift for this volume (these workers are all women from a local village), so his company currently employs 25 people. Gheorghe now needs a short term loan to fund the purchase of the last harvest of plums to fill a large order. His business is an ambitious one; the kind that holds much promise for helping Moldova develop into the future.

loans.use: loan to fund the purchase of the last harvest of plums to fill a large order

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
History of the Client: Mr. Martín P. Quispe works in car maintenance, fixing springs and brake shoes. He lives in Sud Lipe Street in the city of El Alto. His workshop is located on Buenos Aires Avenue in the city of La Paz. He is 36 years old with 6 children, all minors still under his care.

Mr. P. has one employee. The loan will be used to buy tools and raw materials in order to satisfy the demand for his services from his clientele.

This is his third credit with Impro. His history with this institution classifies him as "Client 1", that is to say, with excellent fulfillment of the payment of his obligation.

His previous credit history allows him access to this new loan, since he has experience in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: El Sr. Martín P. Quispe se dedica al mantenimiento de vehículos (Arreglo de muelles y balatas). Vive en la Calle Sud Lipe de la ciudad de El Alto, su taller se encuentra ubicado en la Av. Buenos Aires de la Ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 36 años y 6 hijos, todos menores de edad y bajo su dependencia.

El Sr. Martín trabaja con un empleado; y el destino del crédito será para compra de herramientas y materia prima para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda de clientela.

Es su tercer crédito en Impro, su historial en nuestra institución califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente de pago de su obligación.

Sus antecedentes crediticios le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Mr. Isaac A. is 38 years old, and is married with three (3) children.  He hails from Uromi of Edo State, Nigeria.  He sells palm nuts to the people in his community.  He is requesting a loan if $550 for business growth.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts to sell

loans.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But S. V. is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 2 preschool-aged children in PreyVeng province, Cambodia. She runs a small grocery store at home generating around $2 each day, while her husband makes approximately $3 per day working as a motor-taxi driver. This couple would like to repair their house and they are requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to help them make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair their house which normally leaks during rainy season.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
When Sandra was divorced from her husband, she took on the full responsibility of supporting her three children. She started in the flower business as a young girl helping her mother in a florist's shop and little by little, with a lot of effort, she started her own shop 8 years ago so that she could provide for her children and support the costs of their studies.

Sandra is asking for a loan in the amount of $250 USD to buy primary materials and continue with the growth of her business, planning to pay back the loan in 5 months. She and her family thanks you for your support that allows them to look forward.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra es una mujer divorciada y cuando se divorcio tuvo la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos por si sola, ella tiene tres hijos a quien mantener, ella empezó con su negocio desde joven ayudando a su madre en una florería y poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo se hizo de su propia florería hace 8 años atrás para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos y poder apoyarlos en sus estudios.

Sandra esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 250 para poder comprar materia prima y poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchasing primary matierials

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Although 50 years old, Ms. Nguyen Thi Q. is still very strong. Everyday she rides her bike for 10 kilometers to go to the market to sell her chicken and fruit. Because of her efforts, she gets good harvest every season. Her husband also helps her a lot. The profit from this small stall at the market helps her pay her weekly repayment rather easily. She’d like to borrow 375USD to buy nurseling and chicken.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Năm nay đã ngoài 50 tuổi nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị Quán vẫn còn khoẻ mạnh. Hàng ngày chị đạp xe hơn 10 cây số đi chợ bán hàng. Hoa quả và gia cầm là thứ mà gia đình chị thường có sẵn. Mùa nào cây ấy trong vườn nhà chị lúc nào cũng đầy cây trái. Nhờ có nghề phụ kiếm tiền được hàng tuần nên việc hoàn trả đối với chị rất dễ dàng. Ngoài ra chị còn có được sự hỗ trợ tích cực của chồng. Chị đề nghị vay mức vốn 375 USD để tiếp tục đầu tư mua thêm cây, con giống.

loans.use: Buy nurseling, chicken

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.es:
Haydee is 32 years old and has two children; Irma is 35 years old and has three children, and Dina L. is 38 years old and has five children. They are all partners in the Paloma Communal Bank. At first, Dina sold beverages on the street, but later she rented a small stand to sell chicharrones, a traditional pork dish. She currently has a restaurant selling chicharrones in a large and more comfortable space. Haydee sells food in the bus terminal, and has previous sold orange juice, fruits, and vegetables to get to where she is today. Today, she is thinking about renting another stand to sell fruits. Irma has a kiosk located in front of the Regional Hospital of Ayacucho where she sells food and drink as well as selling clothing at her customers’ requests. These women need loans of 400 soles, 1500 soles, and 400 soles that will be invested in purchasing meat, soft drinks, wine, undergarments, shoes, shirts and in opening an additional fruit stand.

Dina, Haydee and Irma say that in the communal bank, they have learned to be on time, to save and to value good customer service. They have large dreams, including running a large restaurant selling ceviche, having her own store, giving their children the best of life, and being professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Haydee tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Irma tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, mientras que L. tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, y todas son socias del Banco Comunal Paloma. Dina en un inicio vendía moliente, era ambulante, pero posteriormente alquiló un local pequeño para vender “Chicharrones”, comida típica preparada con carne de cerdo. Actualmente ella tiene una “Chicharronería” (Restaurante que vende Chicharrones) en un local más grande y cómodo. Haydee vende comida en el terminal terrestre y para llegar a tener este negocio ella hizo diferentes actividades como venta de jugo de naranja, verduras y frutas. Ahora ella tiene pensado alquilar otro puesto para la venta de frutas. Irma tiene un kiosco ubicado al frente del Hospital Regional de Ayacucho donde vende comida y bebidas y, además ella vende ropa de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes. Ellas necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 1500 soles y 400 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de carne, gaseosas, vino, ropas interiores, zapatos, polos y también para implementar otro puesto de venta de frutas. Dina, Haydee e Irma dicen que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, a ahorrar y a cómo tratar al cliente. Sus sueños son muchos como tener una cebichería en un local grande, un local propio, darle lo mejor a los hijos y que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase food and clothing for resale, and open a new fruit stand.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two kids. She is from Zaporozhye. She owns a small business selling clothing in the local city market. She has been in this trade for 5 years. Presently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $1600.

Yelena is hoping to use this loan of $1200 to open a new vending store and expand her trade. We believe her natural personality traits and desire to seek out opportunities and succeed will enable her to use the current loan most efficiently.

loans.use: To open a new store

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Nigora H. is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Her main earnings come from selling the traditional food named kurut (distantly resembles cottage cheese). In her free time she helps her husband take care of the cattle. The Hudoikulov family owns 10 rams. Nigora uses their wool to make yarn, which she sells on the market. She wants to obtain 5 more rams while the price of these animals is still low. She plans to raise the animals and in a few months sell them for a profit.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Худойкулова Нигора возрост 33 года имеет 3 детей .Сама основной доход имеет с продажи национального курута , а в свободное время помогает мужу по уходу за скотом.Семья Худойкуловых имеет 10 баранов,из шерсти которых Нигора прядет прядь.И также продает на базаре. Сейчас пока скот дешевый она взяв займ хочет купить еще 5 баранов.Через пару месяцев откормив продать с прибылью.

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 43 year old Halima K.. She is married with two children, ages twelve and fifteen.

In 1991, Halima established an African batik cloth business. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA. She requires a new loan to purchase cloth and dyes, which she will use to make additional stock of batik cloth for sale. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and dyes to make African batik material

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es:
The sale of firewood and charcoal is the occupation of Mario José V., who is married with three small children who need his support to mature and get ahead in life. His wife is a homemaker.

To start his business, Mario had to sell a small plot of land that he owned. One of his greatest dreams is to increase his sales to one day have a prosperous business that permits him and his family to improve their standard of living and have a little more financial stability.

He hopes in the future to be able to educate his children so they will have better career opportunities. Mario needs the loan to build a wall in the back part of his house to be able to live more securely and prevent theft.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de leña y carbón es el oficio del Sr. Mario José V., el es casado, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que necesitan de su apoyo para formarse y salir adelante en la vida. Su esposa se dedica al quehacer diario de la casa. Don Mario para iniciarse en este negocio tuvo que vender un pequeño solar que poseía , uno de sus grandes sueños es incrementar sus niveles de venta y así lograr tener un día un negocio próspero que permita que él y su familia puedan mejorar su nivel de vida y tener un poco más de estabilidad económica. Espera en un futuro educar a sus hijos para que estos tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Don Mario necesita el préstamo para construir un muro en la parte trasera de su casa y de esa manera asegurarla, para evitarse robos.

loans.use: Build a wall at the rear of the house for added security.

loans.name: Lotty Mercedes

texts.es:
Lotty belongs to the Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women’s”) Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Tarapaca 399 in the Callería District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income is not enough to meet the family’s daily needs. It is for this reason that Lotty received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in constructing retail units to rent out.

With the loans she received and the profits she earned Lotty was able to construct more retail units to rent out. Because of the retail units’ central location, Lotty rented them out very quickly, and they are now thriving businesses that generate more income for her.

Lotty will use this loan of 2,000 Soles ($750) to refurbish her retail units. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Lotty feels more independent, and is now able to enjoy the financial stability that she always wanted. She is very happy to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lotty pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Tarapaca 399, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Lotty con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la construcción de locales para alquilar.

En la actualidad con los préstamos recibidos y las ganancias obtenidas, pudo construir mas locales para alquilar, por la zona céntrica en que se encuentran sus locales los alquilo rápidos y están funcionando negocios, que le generan mas ingresos económicos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, refaccionara sus locales.

Lotty se siente más independiente, ahora puede gozar de una estabilidad económica que siempre quiso tener, aporta en su hogar y eso la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: Refurbishing her retail units

loans.name: Afegata Tupuola's Group

texts.en:
This group from Siufaga was started in May 2008 with 17 members, growing to 21 members in one month. The members are among the best savers in the programme. They work seven days a week and they shared that they are earning more than they usually earn. This group are all starters and they are very happy that they are given money to run their own businesses. They are hard working women and they are striving to be the best they can so that they can get profits and improve their families' living standards.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing boats, fishing nets, hooks, knives, chemicals and other equipment.

loans.name: Pranita

texts.en:
Miss Pranita T. is a single woman who lives in Thikedewol. Thikedewal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.
Miss T. has four members, including herself, in her family. Her father's name is Mr. Pratap T., and he is a retired principal. Her older sister is a teacher and younger sister works in a beauty parlor.
Miss T. opened her tailoring shop one year ago. She took six months of training for tailoring work. She prefers to makes Nepali dresses in her shop. Due to the rising competition in this business she needs funds to invest in her business. But due to the economic condition of her family she is unable to invest in her shop. So she is requesting a Rs 10,000 (US$150) loan to buy raw material for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda I. is 35 years old. She and her husband have got one son. For a long time, Umeda’s husband couldn’t find a proper job for himself and currently he is working in Russia. To improve her family position, Umeda started her business 13 years ago. Because she does not have a specialized education, baking the national bread "lepeshka" is the only source of income for her family. She bakes the “lepeshka” at home. Her son helps her with the business.

Having the customers, Umeda is selling the majority of her products just from her home. However, she is also running a stall in the central market, selling the ”lepeshka”. Having only one son, Umeda is doing her best to assure him of the best future.

Now Umeda is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 USD for a term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase the flour required for her business wholesale. From the profit of her business, Umeda wants to send her son to the University as she is dreaming her son might be well educated. She wants to keep educating him because she hopes that he reaches the goals that he has laid out for himself. With your help this will be possible. Umeda is grateful for all supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka” wholesale

loans.name: Thu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Thu năm nay 39 tuổi  và đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương được gần 4 năm. Gia đình chị vốn có nghề làm bánh gia truyền nhưng thời gian trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ số lượng bánh gia đình sản xuất và bán trên thị trường không nhiều do gia đình thiếu vốn để mua nguyên liệu. Năm 2004 chị bàn với chồng tham gia vào quỹ tình thương vay vốn để mở rộng sản xuất. Có thêm vốn anh chị đã đầu tư mua thêm gạo và các nguyên liệu khác phục vụ cho công việc làm bánh vì thế số lượng bánh của gia đình chị cung cấp ra thị trường ngày càng nhiều. Cùng với việc làm bánh gia đình chị còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Đến nay qua 4 năm tham gia vay vốn để sản xuất, chăn nuôi kinh tế gia đình chị Thu đã ngày càng ổn định hơn.Nhờ đó gia đình chị cũng có điều kiện để đầu tư nhiều hơn cho 2 con đang tuổi đến trường.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốm được vay  15.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi  và mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho việc làm bánh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thu is a 39 year old woman. She joined the TYM fund 4 years ago. Her family is a traditional cake maker. Before 2004, the family could not invest enough money to foster the business. She joined the fund and started plans expanding the production. She and her husband had the money to buy supplies, so the quantity of cakes produced much increased. Besides making cakes, they also invested in livestock. For 4 years, the livestock business has been contributing to the family’s budget. They now are able to send their children to school. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest more in livestock and buy more cake supplies.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock and cake supplies

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S., 48 ans est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de  tissus de pagnes, de bijoux et de chaussures. Ses revenus lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de certains besoins de la famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Mariama S., age 48, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's been a member of the Yamatogne village bank for 3 and half years. She wants to bolster her business selling pagne fabrics (colorful African cloth), jewelry and shoes. Her revenues enable her to help her husband with some of the family needs.

She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagne fabric, jewelry and shoes

loans.name: Lanaya Group

texts.en:
This is Adama B., Fatmata B. and Amie K.. They named their group Lanaya. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Kabala. This is the fourth time they've received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one in the group received a loan of Le 600,000.00. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children's school fees in case things were difficult for their husbands. They could also add to the daily allowances that their husband's give them for food. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 700,000.00 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Adama B. (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-two years of age. She was born in Kabala and she is married with five children. Two of her children are in secondary school and the other two are in primary levels. The fifth is currently learning a trade. Her husband is the tribal head for the Fullas in Kabala. Amongst other activities, he arbitrates amongst the Fullas. Adama has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed clothes, often with fabricated designs) for the past seven years now.

With this new loan, Adama will expand on her business by buying about 4 "pieces" of white cotton (thirty yards make a piece). She will buy an additional number of inks, caustic soda and powder. She will also be able to pay workers who design the clothes. A piece of white cotton costs her Le 120,000 in Freetown, where she often sends someone to buy her the materials she needs. Prices for the inks vary depending on the color, ranging from Le 40,000 to Le 60,000. She sells the gara clothes (gara lapper) between Le 25,000 and Le 30,000. To Adama and colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means buying more dresses for themselves and solving household problems that may arise.

loans.use: Buying cotton, inks, powder and caustic soda for clothing design

loans.name: Francisca Jerónima

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora Francisca L. se dedica arduamente a la labor de venta de verduras las cuales son comercializadas con mucha alegría en su establecimiento. 

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los perecederos como lo son papas, cebollas, chiltomas, zanahorias entre otras. Una vez que adquiera el crédito procederá a la compra de estos productos. Es importante destacar que ella se ha destacado por haber realizado varios prestamos en Ceprodel habiéndolos cancelados todos efectivamente y perfilándose como una fiel cliente.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon Francisca Lopez dedicates herself to the hard labor of selling vegetables, which she does happily from her stall.

Now she is looking for the support of Ceprodel to get credit to buy perishable goods like potatoes, onions, sweet peppers and carrots, among other things. Once she has the credit she will proceed with buying these products. It is important to mentions that she has had various loans with Ceprodel which she has repaid on time, shaping herself as a faithful client.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable goods/Compra de los perecederos

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly K. is a resident in the Samnak Thboung Village of Kampong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Chhim, pictured on the right of the photograph, is a sculptor in their village. Mrs. Ly K. is 38 years old, and she is the mother of four children. Three of her children are currently enrolled in the local school, while her youngest child is too young--4 years old--to work or study.

In her village, she sells gravel to earn a living. Because her business is doing rather well, she wants to expand the business. Accordingly, she is seeking a loan in order to buy more gravel to re-sell.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional gravel for resale purposes

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng K., 57 years old, is a vegetable seller from Kompong Tom Province. She runs her business in the area of the Psa Kompong Tom Market and sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $2 a day and has been running the business for more than three years. K. is married to Mr. Nghem Khoun who is a motorcycle taxi driver and also works with her in selling vegetables. She now has five children, four of whom are single and the other one is married and lives away from home. Two of her single children (one son and one daughter) are employed: her son is a electric repairer and her daughter is a garment worker in Phnom Penh City. K. has requested a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana C. tiene la edad de 48 años,  habita en la concepción junto a su esposo; sus hijos están casado y viven independiente, el esposo de doña Juana trabaja en la agricultura al igual que ella, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo para poder tener mas ingresos y terminar de construir su vivienda. Con esta solicitud de crédito la quiere para invertir en insumos agrícola para el abono de sus cultivos y así poder tener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana C. is 48 years old and lives in La Concepción with her husband. Their children are married and live independently. Juana's husband, like her, works in agriculture. Her plans for her family are to improve farming conditions to increase their income and finish building their home. With this loan, she will invest in agricultural inputs for fertilizing her crops to reap a good harvest and sell her produce at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs to fertilize crops

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 54-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Elie has been working in the sewing business for nine years. Elie has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread and a new machine for his sewing.

Elie has been a microcredit client for four years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business and increase his income. His clients are people from his region. When he first started, he had difficulty building networking. Elie decided on doing his business because he likes sewing and wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase thread and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ashurbi

texts.ru: Халимова  Ашурби жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 49 лет , замужем и имеет восьмерых детей.Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Хочет купить дойную корову , для того, чтобы получать молоко. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать , а так же использовать для своей семьи. Это даст возможность получать дополнительную прибыль.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ashurbi H. is a resident of the city of Vahdat. She is 49 years old, married, and has 8 children. She is a housewife and also raises animals. She would like to buy a dairy cow as a source of milk which she could sell and also use for her family. It will provide her with additional income. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola O. is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en: Fidelina D. is 51 years old, a resident of Oroquieta City, and married with 1 child. She buys and sells cut flowers; she plans to add to her capital the loan she has requested from Paglaum.  Her business is growing. Her customers are her friends, relatives and neighbors. She strives to make her business grow for her future and her family's.

loans.use: Additional capital for her flower business

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Goat and cattle feed

loans.name: Anayat Abdul Masih Group

texts.en:
Anayat baji is a wife of A. M.. They have lived in Riwind, Pakistan for 15 years. Her husband sells medicine. He buys medicines wholesale and sells to different medical shops. Anayat baji is a very sensitive and caring lady. She performs her duties as a wife and as a woman efficiently. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s medicine-selling business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Salma baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to sell. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy timbers to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Mrs. Bernarda M. is 46 years old and is married to Miguel Matto, who is 41 and is a carpenter. The couple has two daughters, Vivian who is 17, and Fátima who is 8. 

Bernarda owns a bakery that has been in business for over twelve years. They currently have a well-established clientele thanks to the quality of their products and the attention they give to their clients. The money from the loan will go towards the purchase of flour in large quantities in order to get a better price.

In the future, Bernarda would like to buy an electric oven in order to expand her bakery so that she can meet the demands of her clients. Additionally she would like to live in a country with better security, where it is more peaceful and where she can work better.

loans.use: To purchase flour in large quantities

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn S. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 30 years old, is married to Naser S., and has four school-aged children. Analyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In July 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta T. is from the village of Mialen. She is 45, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta operates a furniture-making business. Her main source of income comes from selling furniture in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 5,200 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase supplies,  including nails and lumber. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for furniture making

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. aspires to have her own business and put her sewing skills into practice. She knows the business well, as she has been an employee of a tailoring shop for 28 years. Just starting up, Marilyn will be using her loan to purchase cloth and other things needed for her tailoring business. The people in her village are her potential customers.

Marilyn is a newly recognized member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI). She is motivated to get a loan from ASHI to start her own business. She was left with one child after she separated from her husband. Her child is 21 years old, and is dependent on her, as he is a high school undergraduate. She wants to support her only child independently from her live-in driver partner. She plans to get more loans through ASHI to really establish a stable business in the future and employ her own child.

loans.use: To start up a tailoring business

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mrs. Kosal C., age 39, and her husband, Mr. Bunmeng Chheang, age 43, have been married for 15 years. They just have one daughter who attends school. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Kosal has been working for a company that produces mild for 10 years. Mr. Bunmeng Chheang is a motor taxi driver. He drives in Phnom Penh City. The couple is in the process of building their new house, but they lack some money to finish it. So, Kosal is applying for her first loan of $500 to finish her house building.

loans.use: To finish her house building.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is the 45-year-old father of two school-going children. He lives in Runyenjes where he also runs a boutique. He deals in both ladies and gents wares. He has applied for Kshs 50,000 to improve his business.

loans.use: To use for business improvement

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn C. is 43 years old widowed woman and mother, a resident of Pursat Province. Vorn C. currently lives with her sister who appears in the picture. To generate a daily income, Vorn C. raises a few pigs in a stall next to her house. She also sells her matured pig out to slaughterer at least two times per year. Vorn C. has blessed with five children; most of whom are employed in a various jobs. Because raising pig is the main source of income for family, Vorn C. requests a loan to buy piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy piglet to raise

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose A. A. A. tiene la edad de 50 años, es padre casado y tiene 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 25, 24, 22, 19 y 14 anos, repectivamente, y todos viven en la casa. El quiere comprar una ganado para leche. Hace muchos años que se dedica al campo y quiere crecer. Ahora no tiene ganada, solomente cultiva cafe en su finca propia pero tiene pasto libre que le gustaría usar por vaccas. Es su primer prestamo con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido credito con otros bancos en el pasado. él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable.
texts.en:
Jose A. is 50 years old, married, and the father of 5 children who are his first priority. They are 25, 24, 22, 19 and 14 years old, respectively and they all live at home. He wants to buy dairy cattle. For many years he has been a farmer and wants to expand. He currently doesn't have any cattle, he only farms coffee on his own farmland but, he has unused land that he would like to to use for cows. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he has not had any previous credits with banks. He hopes to provide his wife and children a better and more stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Aoko Wkovele

texts.en: Aoko is the mother of a six-year-old daughter.  Her husband works as a fare collector on a public service vehicle. She sells tomatoes, onions, and cabbage in an open air market in Kakamega on a busy street.  She requests a loan of KES20,000 so she can buy more produce for resale.  Her biggest challenge is operating her business during the rainy season.  In the future, she would like to construct a larger stall and be able to sell a wider variety of vegetables. Aoko describes herself as a hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos, de 13 años, en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, sus cultivos principales son el trigo, la papa, la cebada, la arveja y el maíz; pero también cría ganado vacuno, principalmente toros para venderlos en las ferias ganaderas. 
Una vez que es la época de la cosecha vienen a buscarla comerciantes mayoristas que compran por camiones sus productos. Carmen prefiere esta modalidad porque no gasta en transporte, aunque admita que así las ganancias son menores, a vender directamente en el mercado.
Pero de esta forma, ella y su esposo siguen trabajando porque han logrado clientes seguros, el sostenimiento de su familia y el pago de la educación de sus hijos.

Esta es la novena vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona conciente de realizar un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal, por eso es muy apreciada por los demás integrantes de su grupo. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará sacos de abono para sembrar avena, cebada y trigo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 48, lives with her husband and their youngest son, 13, in her own house. For the past 20 years she has been a farmer and cattle rancher. Her main crops are wheat, potato, barley, peas and corn but she also raises cattle, especially bulls for sale at the livestock fairs. When harvest time arrrives, wholesale merchants come looking for her and they buy her products by the truckload. Carmen prefers this because she doesn't have to spend on transportation costs, although she admits that ther profits are lower this way, than selling directly in the market. However, this way has allowed her and her husband to continue working because they have secured regular customers that they can count on, they can support their family and afford to pay for the education of their children. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is a person who is well aware of the need to work cooperatively in her communal bank so she is well-liked by her fellow members. With these funds she will buy sacks of natural fertilizer to plant oats, barley and wheat.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
La señora Karen es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente. Se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes. 

La señora Karen, tiene grado de instrucción superior completa y tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio.
Su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener un carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana
texts.en:
Karen, 33, is a member of the "3 de Mayo" communal bank. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and is a grocery merchant. Karen finished higher education and has two children. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half. Her first, 500 new sol, loan was used to buy stock merchandise for her store. She now requests 2500 new soles to buy groceries like sugar, rice, pasta, etc. Her desire for the future is to own a car and that her children become professionals. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings she incurs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She runs her small business, selling retail household items, in the central market of her hometown of Melitopol. Nadezhda has been working in this sphere of business for over 11 years. Her market venture has benefited greatly from lending assistance. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas. Her profit is about 8,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Nadezhda is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise and generate additional income as a result. She is hoping to invest a portion of the increased income in improving her living conditions and towards the purchase of necessary domestic appliances.

loans.use: To increase amounts of assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth

texts.es: La joven Rosalina tiene 24 años de edad, es muy esforzada y trabajadora, vive junto con sus padres en un barrio Villa Reconciliación, desde más joven trabajaba para poder pagar sus gastos, y ayudar a sus padres, su trabajo anterior era de afanadora y con su liquidación pudo comprar ropa, zapatos, prendas y poder ganarse el sustento de cada día, no ha logrado seguir estudiando por que no ha tenido los ingresos necesarios pero sus planes es poder ingresar a la universidad como muchas jóvenes para alcanzar un sueño como un mejor nivel de vivir. Ha logrado captar cliente el cual vende al contado y da crédito a la quincena para poder aumentar las ventas accedió a hacer préstamo en Afodenic el cual logro aumentar sus ventas por eso con esta temporada de fin de año quiere comprar prendas de vestir para dama, caballero, niños, ropa interior, medias y otros productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes lo cual espera lograr aumentar sus utilidades. Contenta y da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible el financiamiento al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Young Rosalina is 24 years old. She is very strong and hardworking. She lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood with her parents. Since she was young she has worked to help pay her expenses and help her parents. Her previous work was as a cleaning person gave her the ability to buy clothes, shoes, other garments and the ability to cover her daily food. She has not been able to afford to study but she hopes to enter the university like many other young people and achieve the dream of improving her life. She has succeeded in gaining clients who pay with cash and she offers bi-weekly credit so she increase her sales. She decided to take a loan with Afrodenic so she can succeed in raising her sales since during the end of the year she wants to buy garmets for women, men and children as well as under garments, stockings and other products to offer to her clients who want to improve their own profits. She is content and gives thanks to Afrodenic for making the financing for her small business possible.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of mens, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Carmen De Jesús

texts.es: Carmen de Jesús F. M. de 40 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su familia la cual está conformada por su esposo, tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y su suegro de 83 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de verduras, naranjas y cosméticos, los cuales los comercializa en su propia casa de habitación. Por  muchos años Carmen se ha dedicado a este tipo de ventas, logrando hacer muchos clientes los cuales acuden a su negocio con mucha frecuencia, razón por la que ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, así mismo comprar frutas de estación, ya que esto es muy pedido en su negocio. Así mismo Carmen desea poder invertir más en la venta de cosméticos, puesto que este es uno de sus fuertes en el lugar, debido a que las personas lo compran mucho. Como toda madre de familia responsable, para Carmen es de mucha importancia mejorar las ganancias, y de esta manera brindarle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen de Jesús F. M., 40, lives in Puerto del Triunfo, which is in Usulután department. She lives with her husband, her three minor children, who are in school, and her 83-year-old father-in-law. She sells vegetables, fruits and cosmetics from her home. Carmen has been in this line of work for several years and she has many regular customers who visit her frequently. She is requesting funding to buy larger quantities of vegetables as well as seasonal fruit because these items are in high demand. Carmen would also like to invest more in her cosmetics sales because these items sell well in her location; people request them a lot. As all responsible mothers, Carmen wishes to improve her profits so that she can offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and cosmetics.

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Amalia vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona de alto sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como profesora en provincia.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar la educación de su hija que se encuentra en último curso en la Universidad y de esta manera ella pueda salir profesional.

Es cliente de Impro y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Amalia lives in her own home with her husband and children in the district of Alto Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. She works as a teacher in the province.

The loan she is requesting will be used to pay her daughter’s education. She is in her final year of university and this will allow her to go on to become a professional.

Amalia is a client of IMPRO and has a very good payment history, so she is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's room & board at college

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Concepcion C. I. cuenta con un negocio de Venta de ropa para cama, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danlí, Maria tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, poco a poco  se ha sabido ganar la clientela por
la variedad y tipos de cosas que vende. son de muy buena calidad y precios comodos. 
La Sra. Concepcion es madre soltera y gracias a su negocio a podido mantener estable su hogar y sus condiciones de vida.
esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene Maria para gananarse la vida diariamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Concepcion C. I. sells bed sheets from her home in the neighborhood of Pueblo Nuevo in the city of Danlí. She has been in this business for three years and has managed to gain customers by offering a variety of things to sell. Her products are of good quality and are offered at comfortable prices.

Sra. Concepcion is a single mother and, thanks to her business, has been able to maintain a stable household and adequate living conditions. This is the only source of income from which she earns her daily living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets, towels, and bedspreads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a three wheel motorcycle to help her transport goods and people.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 22 years old. He and his wife Mary Wangari, have a nine-month-old baby. In 2007 he was employed as a motorbike rider to transport people and goods around Naivsaha town but he later decided to buy his own motorbike.  

John was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan. He plans to save the profis from the sale of his old motorbike and the funding from KADET buy more motorbikes and employ people to run them for him. He anticipates this will secure his income base.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha R. is an entrepreneurial married small businesswoman. She runs a café at Mbagala Machinjioni in Dar es Salaam. She prepares and sells both fried and cooked food to customers. She purchases the business goods from the foodstuff shops at Kariakoo city market business center and from the surrounding shops. She also runs a shop selling tires to customers which was started with her business income. She employs two workers to assist her running the business. She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 Tanzanian shillings to capitalize the business.

loans.use: To capitalize the business

loans.name: Shohib Group

texts.en:
Afghan Gull is the group leader of the Shohib Group. She is married and 50 years old. She has two daughters who are in school. She wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She has been involved in this business for more than 20 years and she is quite experienced in tailoring. She needs this small loan for her business. She needs a machine, a disk and a chair for her business. She is very happy with this loan because she will be able to support her daughters in a better way. 

She hopes to grow more in her business.

loans.use: She wants to buy a machine, a disk and a chair for her business

loans.name: Udeshika Mali

texts.en:
Udeshika Mali is a 39-year-old married woman living in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. She and her husband have two daughters and two sons. Udeshika and her husband run an auto shop where they sell spare vehicle parts and gasoline and motor oils. Every morning Udeshika and her husband go to deliver spare parts and other items for motor vehicles. They started this business in 2000.  

There is high demand for the spare parts, and because of the low competition in the area, she has seen initial success. Now she hopes to further expand.

Udeshika is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy spare vehicle parts for her business. Currently she does not have the financial capital necessary to grow her business. She is grateful to BRAC because of the support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy spare parts and motor oils for re-sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es soltera, tuvo 9 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella que esta estudiando, Teresa hace algunos meses vendía frutas y verduras en el mercado Señor de Arequipa, actividad que dejo de realizar porque esta ayudando a su hija en la crianza de su pequeño hijo, actualmente vende chicha a los trabajadores del taller de su hija, actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua y necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, maíz.
Teresa sueña con que sus hijos tengan un trabajo estable y prosperen.
texts.en:
Teresa is single. She had 9 children one of whom is a student and still lives with her. A few months ago Teresa was a fruit and vegetable merchant in the Señor de Arequipa market. However, she had to stop doing this work because she had to help her daughter raise her small son. She currently sells chicha (alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn) to the employees in her daughter’s workshop every day. Teresa is a member of the Suni, which means Abundant in Quechua, communal bank. She needs 1500 soles to buy sugar and corn. Teresa dreams with her children having stable jobs and that they prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and corn.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. sells fish, frozen meat and chicken at Abura.  Efua has received a junoir high education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a steel bender. Efua has been selling fresh and frozen fish and meat for six years. She helpd her husband in taking care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and meat to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and meat to sell

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sonia de 41 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor educación. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Emilio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia. Los productos que cosecha son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de obtener una buena calidad de productos, le favorece mucho en la venta de éstos y a muy buen precio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra de las plagas que pueden afectar su cosecha. Lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los sacos de papa, alverja, habas y oca, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy alegre y siempre pone orden en sus reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono, para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Emilio is 42 years old and a cheerful hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Sonia, age 41, and their five beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better education. The fields in which he works so hard to plant provide the main source of income for his family. His products are very popular at the wholesale market in Tarma, where he is known for offering high quality goods. Emilio is able to generate favorable sales and obtain a good price. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and protecting them from pests that can impact his harvest. He has been farming for 25 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting sacks of potatoes, peas, beans, and oca that are quite heavy and exhausting to carry. Sometime later he hopes to buy additional land so that he can increase his production.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Emilio knows that these funds will be very beneficial in developing his business. He is one of the happiest members of his Communal Bank and always tries to restore order during the meetings. The loan of 1500 PEN that he requested will be used to buy compost to make his land more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Uldarico J.

texts.en:
Uldarico J. T. is from the village of Balide Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 46 years old. Uldarico J. is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Uldarico J. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Uldarico J. has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Uldarico J joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Uldarico J. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Uldarico J. is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Uldarico J. from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his shop

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen T. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at the store around the market premises. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  

Hellen is 29 years old and married to a driver. She has a child who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 51 years old, married, and blessed with five children aged 29, 27, 24, 20 and 18.  Two of the children are still in school.  He is an entrepreneur who runs a butcher shop, and also does some farming to boost his income.  He used to run a cafeteria.  Stephen runs his business in the Mukuru Kayaba slums and has employed one person.  As a member of Faulu Kenya – in Eagles group – he is requesting a loan of 25, 000 KES to buy a refrigerator, glass display, and meat.  He hopes to excel in his business and buy his own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, glass display

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren L. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives with her family in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her oldest two children are students in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. 

Nyamsuren operates a small cafe named "Dulguun" in her town. Her cafe specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian meals and is a popular dining establishment in her community. She started her cooking business in 1996 with help of her sibling by selling homemade meals in a local market and they have built a successful business over the years. 

They used their earnings to buy a small pavilion that they use as a cafe today. Her cafe is located in a crowded place at the local market that attracts a lot of customers. 

Nyamsuren is a very diligent and modest woman. She is requesting a 600,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase necessary equipment and tools and to renovate her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment and tools

loans.name: Jaqueline Esmilda

texts.es: La señora Jaqueline tiene 42 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene en su casa una pulpería ella  vende leña, frijoles cocidos, frutas, golosinas, detergentes y granos básicos. Tiene 15 años de tener este negocio, el cual como una alternativa de fuente de ingreso, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Señora Jaqueline is 42 years old.  She is a single mother with  2 young children.  She runs a store out of her house where she sells wood, cooked beans, fruits, candy, detergents and basic grains.  She has been running this business for 15 years.  It serves as an alternative source of income and supports her family.  

She will use the loan to buy various products as she wants to increase her earnings.  In additions, she says that every day the products are more and more expensive.  This has been a challenge for her as the economic situation in her country becomes more difficult every day. She dreams of  continuing with her business and making sure that her children go to school and prepare themselves for the future.

loans.use: To invest in various products for her store.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang L., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Heang sells clothes and is a tailor, earning an income of about USD 4.3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Heang has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 1.5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.

She is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more clothes to resell, and in the future would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Ines Cordero

texts.es:
Don Inés es un señor trabajador él está ya jubilado, vive con su esposa y tienen 2 hijos de 25 y 30 años de edad, pero estos ya no dependen económicamente de él, este negocio lo inicio con su esposa y lo tienen ubicado en el mercado de San Jorge, ya que ellos viven ahí precisamente en el municipio de San Jorge departamento de San Miguel, ya tienen bastante clientela y son muy conocidos.
Actualmente él solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, pollo, papel higiénico entre otros que forman parte de los productos que ofrece a los clientes, esta inversión le dará mayor estabilidad y mejor atención, su objetivo es tener un negocio más rentable y recibir mejores ingresos que le mejoren su calidad de vida y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Inés is a hard-working man who is already retired.  He lives with his wife and they have 2 children aged 25 and 30 who are no longer financially dependent on him.  He started this business with his wife and it is located in the San Jorge market since they live in the town of San Jorge in San Miguel department.  They have a lot of customers and are very well known.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy oil, sugar, chicken, toilet paper and other products which he offers to his customers.  This investment will give him better stability and allow him to offer a better service.
