His goal is to have a more profitable business and to receive better income which will improve his quality of life and that of his wife.

loans.use: To buy basic food products such as oil, sugar and chicken

loans.name: Ya Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 26 year old Ya Yeabu K..  She is married and has no children.  She has 3 additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives, and they help her with her business.

In 2005, Ya Yeabu K. established her business selling plastic bowls and sets of pans. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed and to help with the upkeep of her family.  Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about 1,400,000 SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL.

Ya Yeabu K. has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to expand her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600,000 SLL.

In the future, Ya Yeabu K. plans to help her husband and build a house. She is very helpful and wants to be a wholesaler to other traders.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls and sets of pans

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto S.,es un hombre muy responsable en su trabajo, cada fin de semana sale muy temprano su puesto donde vende ropa usada, el es divorciado desde hace muchos años,y vive solo pero se preocupa por su bienestar y por su patrimonio en la vejez, sus hijos vivien fuera de la ciudad, el trabaja mucho pensando en ellos, ya que cada semana les envia dinero para su educacion, es por eso que el solicita este prestamo, para la compra de mas mercancia como, ropa y aparatos electricos para aumentar sus ventas y asi tener mas ingresos.
texts.en: Humberto S. is a very responsible man in his job.  Every weekend he leaves very early for his stand where he sells used clothing.  He has been divorced for many years, and lives alone, but he is worried about his well-being and about his wealth when he is older.  His children live outside of the city, and he works a lot thinking about them, since he sends them money every week for their education.  For this reason he is requesting the loan, so that he can buy more merchandise, such as clothing and electrical appliances, in order to increase his sales and have more income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his sales business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en L. propiedad que poseen. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a L. agricultura, desD. entonces aprendió todo lo necesario sobre las técnicas agrarias. Ahora lo aplica sobre sus propios terrenos, cultivando papa, maíz, habas entre otros productos, asimismo se dedica también a L. crianza D. vacas y ovejas que tiene en su propio establo. Sus padres L. apoyan en esta decisión, D. ser independiente en L. administración D. sus terrenos y es una fuente D. ingreso para su familia. Diariamente no deja D. trabajar en  el cuidado D. sus cultivos y sus animales  ya que esto le ha permitido tener mejores rentas en L. venta D. sus cosechas y D. los animales que realiza D. manera periódica. Su sueño es tener un establo granD. y más extensiones D. terreno. Es su crédito numero 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su actividad económica. El dinero lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono, fertilizantes y semillas mejoradas así como vitaminas para mejorar L. salud D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 23, lives with his parents in the property they own.  Since his childhood he’s been in farming.  Since then he learned everything necessary about agricultural techniques.  He now applies all that to his land growing potato, corn and lima beans among other products.  He also raises cows and sheep that he keeps in his own stable.  His parents support his decision to be independent and administer his own lands and it is a source of income for his family.

He works caring for his crops and animals every day because this has allowed him to earn better profits when he sells his crops or his animals, something he does periodically.  His dream is to have a larger stable and larger land area.

This is his second loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support.  Besides, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people that he knows.  He is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan he’s asking for that will be very useful in his economic activity.

He will use the money to buy sacks of manure, fertilizers and improved seeds as well as vitamins to improve the health of his animals.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure, fertilizers and potato and pea seeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanjiku

texts.en:
For eight years, Elizabeth Wanjiku M. has been operating a salon and a beauty school with a monthly profit of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) in Kahawa Wendani, just a few kilometers from the city center.

She is 41 years old and married to Charles, who also gives good support to the family. Together, they have two school-going children.

Elizabeth learned about KADET LTD through a friend and she is applying for her first loan of Kshs 80,000 from KADET. She plans to add stock of beauty and hair products so that she can serve her customers well, and buy more water tanks to store water since there is always a water problem .

With the anticipated profit, she will plow it back into the business for it to grow, and eventually open another branch in town. She hopes to grow her business and in the future, buy a plot to build a house and settle with her family.

loans.use: To add more stock of beauty and hair products and buy water tanks for storing water

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children and one infant child. To make a living, Lorena sells fruits and vegetables in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years.

In 2009, Lorena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Lorena is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables and root crops to sell. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and root crops to sell

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel Santos C. A. él es trabajador activo de la empresa Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como Técnico E.T.V tiene  veinte y dos  años  de trabajar para esta institución es casado   tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para compra de medicamento, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  solucionado problemas familiares y también ha mejorado su condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Daniel Santos C. Aviles is an active employee of the Ministry of Health and he works as an ETV technician. He has worked for this organization for twenty-two years. He is married and he has two young children. He has had five previous loans through Ceprodel and they have all been used to purchase construction materials to expand and improve his house. The loan he requests will be used to purchase medications. The loans granted by Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) have been a great help because he has been able to resolve some family-related problems, and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To pay for personal medical expenses.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua M. is a 60-year-old banana sales businessman who plys his trade in Nyabitete food market in the Rukungiri district of Western Uganda. It is now over 6 years since he began his business. What plays into his favour is the fact that he has a banana plantation where he is able to readily get bananas on a regular basis.

Joshua is, on the face of things, a dedicated and determined man who wants the best for the welfare of his family of 5 kids and wife. He says this business generates him 160,000 shillings a week.

With this loan, Joshua says he is going to upgrade and buy more manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for his banana plantation

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora C. vende ropa en una tienda que se encuentra en su casa con más de 5 años de experiencia este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de uniformes escolares ya que en pocos días comienza el año escolar en este municipio
Este negocio lo empezó poco a poco vendiendo ambulante y poca cantidad de vestuario y fue consiguiendo clientes 
Ella espera que con este préstamo logre vender estos artículos ya que como inicia el año escolar son de mucha demanda 
Martha está casada con 2 hijos su esposo se dedica al destace de cerdo
Doña Martha dice que los créditos con ceprodel le han ayudado para mejorar su negocio y a la vez aumentar el mismo
texts.en:
Mrs. C. sells clothes in a store located in her house.  She has over five years in business.  She will use this loan to buy school uniforms because this town’s new school term starts in a few days.

She started the business bit by bit selling door to door with a small amount of clothes and gradually acquired clientele.  She hopes with this loan to sell these articles because there is much demand because the school year is starting.

Martha is married and has two children; her husband butchers pigs.

Martha tells us that Ceprodel loans have helped her improve her business as well as to enlarge it.

loans.use: To buy pants and school uniforms as well as shoes.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Julieta is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling children's products such as toys, candies, notebooks, and writing materials outside a school campus. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Julieta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional  toys, candies, notebooks, and writing materials, etc.

loans.name: Prak's Group

texts.en:
This group group loan consists of five members. Mrs. Prak is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the others members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Prak is 49 years old and is a widow with a child who is attending a local school. 

Mrs. Prak is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow rice for a living. Now she wants to grow rice in the dry season, but she doesn't have enough money to support it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide for supporting her farming crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for supporting a dry season rice crop

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es: El señora Leydi dedicada a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado cercano a su domicilio la señora inicio sus ventas cuando no existía ninguna construcción el mercadito ahora ya cuenta con un puesto fijo, tiene muchos clientes que la conocen por su buena atención, y por la variedad de mercadería y también ofrece sus productos a precios diferenciados a los demás esto para ayudar de una u otra forma a sus clientas, el crédito  que solicita la señora es para incrementar su capital comprando abarrotes por cantidad  y así poder tener en lo posterior un almacén que es el deseo que tiene la Sra. Leydi, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leydi sells groceries in the market close to her home.  She began selling when there were no buildings, and now has a fixed post at the market.  She has many customers who know her for her good service and the variety of merchandise she offers.  She also offers her products at different prices from the rest in order to help her customers in one form or another.  

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital by buying groceries in bulk.  In the future, she wants to have a store.  Leydi is very thankful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Eddy Enrique

texts.es: Eddy Enrique se dedica se dedica a venta y elaboración de materiales de construcción.  Inicio con fondos propios, pues siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre muy servicial y que se siente muy contento al obtener este medio de vida. Esta no es la primera vez que ha solicitado créditos pues han sido de gran provecho para su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arena, piedrín, bloques, ladrillos, cerámica, cemento, hierro entre otros productos.
texts.en: Eddy Enrique makes his living by selling and manufacturing construction materials. He started this business with his own funds and is very happy to earn his income this way given that he has always been an attentive and helpful individual. This is not the first time that he has requested a loan -- they have been of great help to his business. He plans to use the current loan to purchase sand, bricks, cement, gravel, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito J., provincia Chucuito departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad, está casada t tiene tres hijos (2 independientes).  La señora estudió solo la primaria.
Trabaja   con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace nueve  años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. muebles, servicio D. orquesta y alquiler D. equipos D. sonido.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital D. su negocio para luego comprar un par D. parlantes para su orquesta.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo, quien a su vez realiza servicio D. taxi (transporte).
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn), located in the J. district in the province of Chucuito and the department of Puno. She is 50 years old and is married with three children (2 of them are independent). She attended only primary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nine years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in her grocery business.

Now she works in furniture sales, orchestra services, and renting sound equipment.

With this new loan of 800 PEN, she will increase her business capital in order to buy a pair of speakers for her orchestra. She works with her husband in her business; he also has a taxi service.

Her dream is to improve her business and above all to improve her income.

What she likes about the communal bank are the ease of obtaining loans and what her savings earn.

loans.use: to buy a pair of speakers

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim is 31 years old.  She resides in the Kampong Chnang province of Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sarim and her husband are employed at a garment factory, each earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 51 on other necessary expenses. 

Sarim is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase rice in husk to resell when the price is good. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Tarsisio

texts.en: Tarsisio is a 43-year-old married father of five children, and he  owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Being a basket-maker for 10 years has enabled him to pay for his children's school fees. Tarsisio's hardship is a lack of sufficient capital, but he dreams of setting up a crafts' centre and educating children. Tarsisio intends to use the loan to buy materials for weaving baskets.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving baskets.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  is married with six children and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She sells bananas on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in business for less than a year. 

Madina has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Walaa'

texts.en:
Walaa' is a 20-year-old young woman who is married with one child. She lives with her family in Jabalia Refugee Camp, which is located in Gaza Strip. Walaa' took out a $2,500 loan from FATEN to buy living room furniture. Walaa's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary that doesn't help him to buy furniture in cash. On the other hand, with the help of FATEN's loan she can purchase the needed furniture items.
Walaa' is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase living room furniture

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mujeres Activas” es un grupo de 15 mujeres que son muy bien organizada, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, y todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen quincenalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a las otras en su esfuerzos a mejorar su situación económica. Estas senoras estan muy animados para seguir participando en este programa, mejorando sus actividades económicas.
La Sra. Lucila es artesana, se dedica a esto desde que era niña, ya que su madre se lo había enseñado. Gracias a su arte ella puede ganar los ingresos que necesita para satisfacer las necesidades del Hogar. Ella sueña con que el arte de Paraguay sea conocido por todo el mundo. Ella comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, pinturas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo demás que necesita para la elaboración de sus artesanías.
texts.en:
The groups “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) is made up of 15 very organized, united, hard-working and cooperative women who help each other.  They are from Villarrica and all are friends and neighbors.  They meet every two weeks to offer support and help to each other in their effort to improve their economic situation.  They are very enthusiastic about continuing to participate in this program with their businesses.

Lucila has worked as an artisan since she was a child when her mother taught her.  Thanks to her art she can earn income that she needs to cover household expenses.  She dreams that she will become known throughout the world with her Paraguayan art.  She tells us that her efforts are because she wants to offer her family a better future.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, paints, thread, needles and all that she needs to create her handicrafts.

loans.use: To buy fabric, paints, thread, needles and more

loans.name: Gulsaara's Group

texts.en: Gulsaara is the leader of this group. She is 39 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She brings up two daughters, both of whom study at school. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Gulsaara breeds cattle. She also sews Kyrgyz national cloth, blankets and pillows. In this way, she earns 10,000 soms per month. Gulsaara applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing fabrics and materials, which are needed for sewing. In the future, she wishes to build a new house for her daughters. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena, 43 years old, is married to Julius and they have four children.  She owns a grocery shop which has been in operation for thirteen years earning a monthly income of KES.3,900.

Flomena is borrowing a loan of KES.50,000 from KADET. It is her second loan. She intends to use the loan to purchase more stock like vegetables and fruist etc.The anticipated profit will be used to improve the level of business stock.

Flomena hopes to excel in the business and eventually to start a cereals store.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Rimma

texts.ru:
Римма – разведена. Она сама воспитывает двоих дочерей. Римма живет в Каховке и работает на местном рынке, торгуя женской подростковой одеждой. Римма занимается этим видом торговли уже на протяжении нескольких лет. У нее товара на сумму 50 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль превышает 7 000 гривен. 

Римма планирует использовать кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить подростковую одежду к школе и увеличить прибыль благодаря дополнительным продажам. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Rimma is divorced.  She is raising two daughters on her own.  Rimma lives in Kahovka and works at the local market selling junior girls' clothes.  Pimma has been doing this work for several years.  She has stock worth 50,000 hryvnia, and her net profit exceeds 7,000 hryvnia. 

Rimma plans to use her loan for 10,000 hryvnia to buy juniors' school clothes and increase her profit through increased sales.

loans.use: to buy juniors' school clothes and increase her profit through increased sales.

loans.name: Phoebe's Group

texts.en:
Phoebe's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Phoebe is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Phoebe has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Phoebe has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens and will help Phoebe to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Phoebe hopes that in the future she will be able to become a teacher. 

Phoebe is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Phoebe’s future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Sanona

texts.ru: Санона проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 40 лет. Разведена. У нее двое детей. Она рядом с домом открыла ларек, где продает продукты питания и газеты. Санона два года как занимается торговлей. Кредит берет для покупки колбасных изделий, газированных напитков и канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Sanona lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 40 years old, divorced and has two children.  She opened a small store near her home, where she sells food products and newspapers.  Sanona has been involved in sales for two years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sausage products, carbonated drinks and office supplies.

loans.use: to purchase of sausage products, carbonated drinks and office supplies.

loans.name: Paula Marlene

texts.es:
Paula, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a un apiario (producción de miel), inicio con este negocio por su padre, lo atiende de lunes a sábado desde hace 3 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos y azúcar para las abejas, ya que requieren cuidados para que el apiario marche correctamente con buena producción de miel.
La aspiración de Paula es que sus hijos algún día puedan culminar los estudios, sean buenos ciudadanos, y contar con el apoyo siempre de la familia.
texts.en:
Paula lives with her husband and two children aged 7 and 4.  She runs an apiary (producing honey).  She started out in this business through her father.  She works from Monday to Saturday and has been in the business for three years.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy medicines and sugar for her bees as she needs to provide them with some care so that the aviary works correctly and produces a good amount of honey.  

Paula's aspiration is for her children to some day finish their studies, become upstanding citizens and always be able to count on their family's support.

loans.use: to buy medicines and sugar for her bees

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
Luciernagas es un grupo solidario que esta conformado por 7 mujeres muy trabajadoras e inteligentes las cuales se peocupan por el bienestar de sus familias. Ellas le pusieron así al grupo porque les gusto ese nombre; se encuentran en su primer ciclo y sus reuniones son en Garcia, N.L. Una de las integrantes del equipo es la señora Yolanda tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada, tiene hijos pero todos son mayores de edad y ya estan casados, ella solo cuida a un nieto de 4 años; habita en el municipio de Garcia, N.L.

Yolanda se dedica a la venta de tacos de guisos entre semana en obras (a los albañiles y trabajadores a quienes le fía y los fines de semana les cobra lo que consumieron) y los fines de semana vende barbacoa y menudo en General Escobedo, N.L., su esposo le ayuda a hacer la comida y es quien la translada en una camioneta. Ella escogio este negocio ya que además de que le gusta cocinar, le agrada que la gente disfrute de una buena comida en sus ratos libres, además de querer buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo e hijos con los gastos del hogar y para lo que se necesite. Con el dinero del credito que resivio surtirá mas alimentos y comprará un juego de vaporeras mas grande, ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Uno de los sueños mas grandes de Yolanda en tener un puesto fijo con estructura mas grande, varia sillas y mesas para que la gente que le compra también tenga la opción de comer ahí, así como los trabajadores y albañiles de la obra.
texts.en:
"Luciernagas" (Fireflies) is a solidarity group made up of seven very hard-working and intelligent women, who are concerned about the well-being of their families. They called the group this, because they liked the name. They are in their first loan cycle, and their meetings are in the municipality of Garcia, in the state of Nuevo Leon. 

One of the members of the team is Yolanda. She is 47, married, and has children; but all are adults and already married.  She is only looking after a four year-old grandson. She lives in the municipality of Garcia, in the state of Nuevo Leon. 

On weekdays, Yolanda sells tacos de guisos (tortillas filled with prepared meats, vegetables and sauces) at construction sites.  She sells to the construction workers to whom she extends credit, and then collects from at the end of the week for what they have eaten. On weekends she sells barbecue and menudo (tripe) in General Escobedo, Nuevo Leon.  Her husband helps her make the food, and transports it in a truck.

She chose this business, since besides the fact that she likes to cook, it pleases her that people enjoy a good meal in their free time. In addition, she wanted to find a way of helping her husband and children with the household expenses and other needs.  She will use the loan to stock up on food and to buy a set of larger steamers, as she has a lot of customers. 

One of Yolanda's greatest dreams is to have a fixed stand, with a larger  structure, and a few tables and chairs, so that her patrons also have the option of eating right there, including the workers from the construction site.

loans.use: To buy more food, and a set of larger steamers for her food stand.

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es:
Rosa es una microempresaria que ha luchado incansablemente para mejorar su calidad de vida, actualmente se dedica a la cría y engorde de pollos y credos, esta labor la realiza en compañía de su familia lo que ha hecho que la unión familiar se fortalezca con el negocio.

Actualmente, con la ilusión de aprovechar la temporada de fin de año Rosa quiere hacer algunas adecuaciones locativas a su negocio y comprar mas cerdos y pollos, pero no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo, por lo que solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mas animales y las modificaciones de infraestructura pertinentes para el bienestar de los pollos y los cerdos, as{i en la temporada de diciembre cuando sube la demanda ella tendrá la capacidad de comercializar, generar mas utilidades e incrementar proporcionalmente sus ingresos
texts.en:
Rosa is a micro-entrepreneur who has fought tirelessly to improve her quality of life. Currently, she raises and fattens chickens and pigs. She does this work with her family because family unity strengthens the business.

Now, Rosa wants to take advantage of this period of time near the end of the year. She wants to make some changes to her business and buy more pigs and chickens but she does not have the capital to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more animals and the infrastructure modifications necessary for the well-being of the pigs and chickens. December is the time of year when the demand for her products increases. She will have the capacity to market, generate more profits and proportionately increase her income.

loans.use: make infrastructure modifications and purchase pigs and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam has operated her tailoring shop in Nakuru town for the last 19 years. She is 38 years old, married to Jonathan and they have seven school-going children. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer during marketing in Nakuru and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of textile materials for her tailoring shop. In future, Miriam hopes to expand her tailoring business to wholesale and become one of the leading textile suppliers in other parts of the country.

loans.use: Add more stock of textiles

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Florencia runs a sari-sari store business. She sells items like bread, canned goods and soft drinks. Florencia is able to help her husband provide for their daily needs through her income from the store. She has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as bread, soft drinks and detergent soap. Florencia hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as bread, soft drinks and detergent soap

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline nació en la ciudad de Lima y vive en la comunidad de Pachar, ella tiene 43 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos.  

Jakeline desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Pachar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Ya son diez años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Jakeline requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería  como por ejemplo, fideos, tarros de leche, conservas, sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más.

Jakeline se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Jakeline pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Jakeline was born in the city of Lima and lives in the community of Pachar. She is 43 years old and has a common-law husband, with whom she has four children.  

Jakeline carries out her daily and economic activities in the city of Pachar. Her work is selling staple goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products. She has operated this business for ten years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. 

Jakeline needs the loan to buy merchandise such as noodles, canned milk, canned goods, sacks of rice and sugar, and other products. 

Jakeline is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule. Jakeline belongs to the  “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” ["Immaculate Conception of Pachar"] communal bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as noodles, canned milk, canned goods, sacks of sugar and rice, and other items.

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. 

Lourdesita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lourdesita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lourdesita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is single and lives in Cabal-asan, Maria, Siquijor. 

To earn a living, Joel is engaged in growing pigs and has had this business for one year.  

Each month, he earns about PHP 3,000 doing this work. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feeds, medicines and farm supplies for his pig raising business.

Joel has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Joel would like to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, medicines and farm supplies for his pig raising business.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina, vive con su esposo y su hija de 6 años de edad en casa propia, ella tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta básica hace 4 años vende: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, aceite, consomés, sal, achote, canela, el negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia ya tiene experiencia no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para  comprar más mercadería Y productos nuevos como: gaseosas, jugos, gatorade, churros, galletas, dulces de esa forma podrá tener variedad y debido a la temporada los productos se venden mas y las ganancias serán mejor cada día.
El sueño de Josefina es siempre mantener estable su negocio mantener siempre su clientela y que a ella y su familia tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Josefina lives with her husband and her 6-year-old daughter in her own home.  She has a store where she sells basic household products.  For four years she has been selling rice, sugar, beans, corn, oil, soups, salt, annatto and cinnamon.  She started the business on her own initiative.  She has experience and doesn't work fixed hours.

Josefina will use her loan to buy more merchandise and new products such as soda, juice, Gatorade, churros, cookies and sweets.  This will enable her to have a greater variety of products available.  During this season products sell better and her profits will improve every day.

Josefina's dream is to keep her business stable, to keep her customers, and for herself and her family to have what they need.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, Gatorade, churros, cookies and sweets

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Emelita is married with four children. Emelita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Emelita is a farmer and grows "palay" or rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her rice crop plantation.

Emelita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Emelita hopes to have a rice mill.

Emelita is the leader of a 4-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice crop plantation.

loans.name: Alon

texts.en:
Alone is 31 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Alone has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Alone has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of produce,like beans and rice, for sale, it will help Alone to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Alone hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business. 

Alone is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alone who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of produce, like beans and rice, for sale,

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband(also shown in the photo) income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shahida  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of PKR 20000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.  She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: María Aracelly

texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising, friendly and hard working woman. She started her business a few years ago operating a corner store. Mari notes that recently some government offices have been built across from her corner store and it has increased her customers. Nonetheless, Mari has not been able to keep enough stock in her store to meet the demands of her newly expanded clientele, for which she needs a loan of $475.

She has 4 children who are the source of her motivation to keep moving forward and to achieve a better quality of life. Mari and her children need your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una mujer emprendedora, amigable y muy trabajadora, ella inició su negocio hace ya algunos años, este consiste en la venta de abarrotes por lo que actualmente Mari ya tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes, ella comenta que hace poco se instalaron algunas oficinas de gobierno en frente de su tienda, por lo que esto la a impulsado a tener una mayor clientela. Sin embargo, Mari no cuenta con la capacidad de productos para cubrir con el incremento de su demanda, por lo que ella requiere de un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar mercancía y hacer frente este incremento.

Ella tiene 4 hijos, quienes son su inspiración para seguir adelante y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida, Mari y su familia necesitan de tu ayuda, apóyalos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.en:
Maria Susana is married with three children. The oldest works to help the family and the younger two attend school. Her husband is a mechanic, however, his salary was not enough to provide for the family needs and the education of the three children. So three years ago, Maria started selling shoes. She began selling to her friends and family and now she has many clients. To satisfy the demand of her clients, Maria needs a $750 loan which she will use to offer better service and variety to her clients. You have the power to help this family and your support would be a great blessing.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Susana es casada y tiene tres hijos, el mayor de ellos trabaja para ayudar a la familia y los pequeños asisten a la escuela. Su esposo es mecánico, sin embargo, el salario que recibe no es suficiente para proporcionarle lo necesario a su familia y para darles educación a sus tres hijos. Razón por la cual Maria se decidió a iniciar con la venta de zapatos desde hace tres años, inició vendiendo entre sus amigos y familiares y ahora tiene muchos clientes.

Para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus productos Maria necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de 750 dólares que empelara para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y una mayor variedad. En tus manos está el poder ayudar a esta familia, tu apoyo será de gran bendición.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: A trained fashion designer. Mrs. Rose O., a 55 years old dedicated woman and a leader of one LAPO groups in Nigeria. She has 10 years experience in fashion design. She is looking forward to having the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use:
To buy more sewing machines and
materials

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
We have very little left to buy for our house. We only need to buy gratings and a door for our house because my husband works all day and I stay home alone with my son and we need them for our safety. We are asking for a loan of $700.00 to install these safety measures.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tenemos poco que adquirimos la vivienda. Solo que nos esta haciendo falta las protecciones ya que todo el día trabajo mi esposo y nos quedamos solos el niño y yo, por seguridad necesitamos poner las rejas y portón a la casa. Solicitamos un préstamo de $ 700.00 Dlls. Para la colocación de protecciones.

loans.use: Safety measures

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia M., 49, and her husband, Isidro, 66, live in the city of Carapeguá. They are parents of six children (one daughter and five sons, one of whom passed away). All of their children are studying, one of whom is already working in a commercial house.

Florencia began selling cow milk thirty-five years ago and started this activity as a child learning from her parents. After marrying and becoming independent from her parents, together with her husband, they bought their own milking cows and continued working in this field since she was well-experienced with this activity. With much strength and perseverance, they have progressed and been able to increase their stock of cows in order to produce and sell more milk. Thanks to the profit they have gained, they have been able to construct a commercial salon on their own land. They have been able to rent out the salon to use as an extra source of income.

Her greatest dream is for her children to finish their studies and become professionals in the future. She is asking for a loan to invest in an extension in her house in order to attain a better distribution now that they have acquired more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Florencia tiene 49 años de edad y, su marido el señor Isidro 66, viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Son padres de seis hijos, una mujer y cinco varones de los cuales uno ya falleció. Todos sus hijos están estudiando y progresando, uno ya trabaja en una casa comercial.

Florencia se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca, hace ya más de treinta y cinco años, se inició en esta actividad que lo aprendió de sus padres cuando era niña. Después de casarse e independizarse compraron, junto con su marido, las vacas lecheras y continuaron trabajando en lo mismo ya que conocían bien el manejo de este negocio. Con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia llegaron a progresar, aumentando la cantidad de vacas lecheras, pudiendo así producir y vender más; gracias a las ganancias logró construir un salón comercial en su propio terreno, la cual actualmente alquila y le genera un importante ingreso extra.

Su mayor sueño es lograr que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la ampliación de su casa y lograr una mejor distribución ya que han adquirido últimamente más vacas.

loans.use: To extend her house.

loans.name: Agha Gul

texts.en: Agha Gul lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has one son. He has a shop where he sells clothes. Agha Gul has been selling clothes for five years. He has a lot of experience in his job. Now he would like to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new designs of clothes specially for women. He wants to attract more clients and make a good income to make a better future for his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy new designs of clothes

loans.name: Sopo

texts.en:
Sopo is a lady of 33 years with a son. She’s not married. She applied for this loan in order to buy chemicals and tools for her business.

She sells crops from her plantation at the market two days per week and she earns a profit of $96 USD ($240 ST) per day . She also works on her vegetable garden as well to supplement her income. She hopes her next loan will help in expanding the plantation and maintain her success.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy, who trades in provisions, is married with 5 children and she is 43 years old. She is from Edo state. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She learned business for a year and has been in it since 1990.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en: O. Kahramon lives in the J.Rasulov region. He is engaged in a home/family busines. Mr.O.  commercially sells  “sambusa” (it is the flour course with the meat that is baked in the coals according to the old recipes). His wife and the sisters are engaged in the business too. They make the special dough and filling but making the “sambusa” is his job. Now mr.O. requests the loan of 3800 STJ for an additional location.

loans.use: An additional location

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
For five years, Silvia has earned a living from food sales. Until they split up, she and her ex-husband helped her sister-in-law with a shoe business. Sadly, she and her husband divorced and she then went on to sell clothes for four years. The income that she received from the work wasn't enough, however, so the decided to switch to food sales. The earnings from her labor were invested in the business and in the education of her 10- and 16-year old children. Her two oldest children are now studying and working in Argentina.

She would like to get a loan in order to remodel her shop and make it suitable for food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace cinco años que Silvia se dedica a la venta de comida. Al inicio ella y su ex esposo ayudaban a su cuñada con la venta de zapatos, hasta que llego un momento en que ella y su ex esposo decidieron independizarse. Lamentablemente su esposo y elal se divorciaron y posteriormente, estuvo vendiendo ropa durante cuatro años, no obstante los ingresos que recibía de este trabajo no eran suficientes es por eso que tuvo la decisión de cambiar de negocio, es así que se animó con la venta de comida. Los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo lo vuelve a invertir y lo gasta en la educación de sus hijos de 16 y 10 años. En la actualidad sus dos hijos mayores estudian y trabajan en Argentina.

Ella desearía obtener un préstamo parea remodelar su puesto y adecuarlo para la venta de comida.

loans.use: Remodel space for food sales.

loans.name: Niza

texts.es:
Niza belongs to the Ricardo Palma communal bank, located on 349 Cesar Calvo D. Araujo St., in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 61 years old and the mother of 6 children. Her husband works for a company, but his income is insufficient to cover their daily household costs; that is why Niza used the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of ~$110 to invest in a small store.

Currently, her store has grown and now she sells more products and some clothing goods. Her children help her with attending to clients in the store and in carrying out the household chores, and in the afternoons, she leaves the store to buy the products that she needs.

With this $750 loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy groceries like rice, sugar, milk, soap, detergent, vegetable oil, bread, eggs, toiletries, etc.

Niza feels like a fulfilled woman; she is very hard-working and enjoys being active. She puts all her energy into pushing forward for the good of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Niza pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo D. Araujo 349, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una compañía, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Niza con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido ahora venD. mas productos y un poco D. pasamanería, la atención D. su bodega y las tareas domesticas las realiza paralelamente cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos, y en las tardes sale a comprar los productos que le faltan. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, detergente, aceite, pan, huevos, artículos D. tocador, etc. Niza se siente una mujer realizada es muy trabajadora le gusta estar activa y pone todo su empeño en seguir adelante por el bien D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith is very conscientious and the great love she has as a mother for her 2 young children, 10 and 4, drive her to keep working for a future that will allow them to get a good education and ultimately be successful in life. Edith works hard for them. She rented a small stand, 11 years ago, in the city's main market to sell moderately-priced clothing. She hopes to increase her sales and she's asking for a loan to buy a bigger and more varied inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Edith, es muy constante en su desempeño y el gran amor de madre que siente por sus 2 hijos pequeños de 10 y 4 años la impulsan a seguir trabajando por un futuro que les permita acceder a una educación de calidad a fin de afrontar la vida con éxito. Por esa razón Edith siempre ha estado trabajando, hace 11 años ha alquilado un pequeño stand en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para vender buzos a precios módicos. Su deseo es incrementar la venta de buzos y solicita un préstamo para adquirirlos en mayor cantidad y variedad.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang L. is 43 years old and a mother of five. She lives with her husband Hem Chheang Heng, 48, and children in the province of Pursat. One of her children attends college, the second works in a private printing shop, the third is in high school, and the other two attend primary school.

Mrs. Eang earns $1.66 per day as a wedding decorator and her husband, Mr. Hem, earns $2 per day as a soldier. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase decorative materials for her wedding decorating business. The loan will allow her to improve her business by creating more beautiful and elaborate decorations for her clients.

loans.use: To purchase decorative materials for her wedding decorating business

loans.name: Belem

texts.es:
Belem is a 24-year-old single mother, who has no support from anyone, with two children, ages 2 and 3. She has a part-time job and sells quesadillas at night. For her, it is very important to give her children a better life, so she needs to be able to have enough time to give to them. For this reason, she decided to start her business in her patio a year ago. Thanks to the flavor that she puts in her dishes, she has a large clientele, who have been recommending her meals to other patrons, allowing her to increase her earnings.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy a griddle, tables, and chairs. With your help, Belem will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Belem es madre soltera de 24 años quien no tiene apoyo de nadie, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 3 años. Ella tiene un trabajo de medio tiempo y por las noches vende quesadillas, para ella es muy importante el poder darle una mejor vida a sus hijos, así mismo requiere tener tiempo para atender a sus hijos por lo que decidió iniciar su negocio hace un año en el patio de su casa y gracias a su sazón tiene una amplia clientela, quienes la han ido recomendando y esto le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar comal, mesas y sillas. Con tu ayuda Belem saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase furnishings

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban A. is a 32-year-old man who keep his own store where he has sold spare car parts since 1994. He lives and works in a small southern village of the Imishli region. He is married and has 1 daughter, looks after his parents who live with him in his house. To improve his living conditions he needs to expand his business by purchasing more spare parts to sell. For this purpose he has applied for 1200 USD.

Qurban previouosly took a loan form AqroInvest and successfully repaid it.

loans.use: Expand his business by purchasing more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.en:
Mavludakhon Y.  is 32 years old. She is married with 2 adorable children. Mavludakhon has been able to combine her love of children with a successful business selling teenagers’ clothing at a busy market in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. Her business is one of the best in town with good quality products and several locations. 

Mavludakhon currently has one stall at the market. Eventually, Mavludakhon would like to open a store in a permanent facility. Mavludakhon has requested a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) to help purchase new inventory of autumn clothing for teenagers. She promises to repay the loan within 8 months. She will be able to help many teenagers keep warm and dry through the rainy autumn months and hopes to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock to meet demand as the season changes.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for teenagers for re-sale

loans.name: Marcia Fajardo

texts.es:
Inició su negocio como una mini pulpería vendiendo cosas pequeñas de alimentos, con créditos que ADIM le ha otorgado ella empezó a vender de todo tipo de productos alimenticios, en un crédito de mayor monto invirtió en ropa menor, tarjetas de teléfono, gas butano para uso domiciliar, etc. Actualmente está consolidando su negocio y quiere ampliarlo con una pequeña soda ubicada en el parque de la misma localidad. 

Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos pero quienes le apoyan directamente en el negocio son sus dos hijas que estudian y trabajan en el negocio. Ella expresa que con su negocio ella se siente como una pequeña empresaria capaz de realizar el proyecto que tiene en mente y que necesita el financiamiento de ADIM para cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
She began her business as a small grocery store, selling small items of food. With loans that Adim has granted her, she began selling all kinds of food products. In one loan of a greater amount, she invested in smaller clothes, telephone cards, butane gar for household use, etc. At present, she is consolidating her business and wants to expand it with a small soda stand located in the park at the same location.

She lives with her husband and her children, but those who she supports directly in her business are her two daughters, who are studying and working in the business. She says that with her business, she feels like a small businesswoman capable of achieving the project that she has in mind and that she needs the financing of Adim to reach her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Afqan

texts.en: Afqan K. is 54 years old, married and has four children. He lives with his entire family, as well as his parents, on a one-hectare property where he breeds sheep and sells them for meat production. He started his sheep breeding business in 1995 as there was no other financial source. In order to expand his business, he is requesting a loan of $1200 USD, which will be used to purchase 20 sheep to help to sell more sheep during the winter period and improve his living conditions. Afqan and his family appreciate your help!

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Mit's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mit A. is a group leader of six people who all live in Kampong Trea village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money to plant her rice field, so she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sun Lai, is a fisherman. Mrs. Mit A. is 20 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Mr. Tith B. is a 39-year-old man who lives in the Angk village of Kampong Cham province. He is a laborer, while his wife, Mrs. Meas Chrep (pictured on the left of the photograph), sells soup. In addition, they have five children: two children are employed in a garment factory, one is a motorbike taxi driver, another is a construction worker, and the youngest child attends the local school.

Even though he and his wife work extremely hard at their professions, they nonetheless generate very little income; as a result, they are unable to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve the family's standard of living and living conditions, Mr. Tith B. is seeking a loan in order to become a motorbike taxi driver; more specifically, with the loan proceeds, he would like to buy a motorbike to start a taxi business.

loans.use: To commence a motorbike taxi business by purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun N., 36, a widowed farmer who grows and sells yams, lives in Kampong Cham with her child, who is a student, and generally makes about $5 a day. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Virginia Filedia P. tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto con su compañero de vida, ella tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo a uno tiene a su cargo; ya que uno se caso y el otro estudia en el seminario. Ella desde hace cinco años trabaja en el sector comercio, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su casa no tiene división y es muy insegura por que es partes forrada con zinc, y lo que mas desea es poder vivir con una casa digna, es por eso que con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras a su casa. A si como incrementar su inventario que es la venta de ropa usada, golosinas y productos de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Virginia Filedia P. is 45 years old, lives with Juan Ramon Padilla, together with her life partner, she has three children of which she only cares for one; now that one is married and the other studies in seminary. She has worked in the commercial sector for five years, her plans for her family are to improve the living conditions since her house does not have division and is very insecure because parts are made of zinc, and what she wants most is to be able to live in a dignified house, which is why with this loan she is going to buy construction materials to make improvements to her home, as well as increase her inventory which is selling used clothes, household goods, and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mhammad has owned a mini market for two years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan.

Mhammad is special in his work because he stays open until late in the evening. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Mhammad decided on doing his business because he needed to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Mebel

texts.en: Mebel sells coolers. She travels to Leome to buy her coolers (a journey of about 5 hours by bus) and she travels once a month. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. Mebel is 50 years old and married, with 2 children. Mebel needs a loan of N 140,000 to purchase more coolers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more coolers to sell

loans.name: Grace M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Grace M. A. from Kyela. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 2 and 9. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents are too poor to care for them. Grace has been running a cereals (maize, rice, wheat etc.) business since 1998. A typical maize business is a stand on the side of the road where maize is often piled high in baskets.  Customers can scrutinize the quality of the product before they purchase it and can specify the exact amount that they would like to purchase. Maize is very important to the Tanzanian culture as it is used to make a staple dish called ugali, which is made solely of maize, flour and water.  Grace works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Grace currently earns about 300USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 675USD in order to buy more maize, wheat, a mallet and beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the stock. Grace thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize, wheat, a mallet and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Mrs Elvira B. lives in Barangay Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She is an active member of Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative (PMPC), which she joined in April 2006. She was inspired to be part of PMPC when she heard about the many positive benefits of the cooperative. She also wanted to make use of the credit facilities, especially for starting up her fish selling business.

Elvira requested the loan amount of 5500 PHP as additional capital for her fish selling business. Her hope is that her business would be sustainable and that she could live a more comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her fish selling business

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi A. is 35 years old. She is married and has a child. She sells medicines. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sakrat

texts.en: Sakrat sells underwear and slippers.  She is 32 years old and married with a child.  Sakrat lives in Badagry, in the Lagos state.  Sakrat hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more underwear and slippers to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase underwear and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Cette  femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce de puis 2000 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé, étant marié et mère de 03 enfants, elle aide son époux dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer avec ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu. Son stock de marchandises a un peu baissé, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de wages un crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de riz, 08 bidons d’huile de palme, 5 sacs de spaaghetti, 03 cartons de détergents « OMO » et divers.
texts.en:
This woman earns revenues from commerce in grocery items. She has been in this business since 2000 and acquires her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She is married and the mother of three. She helps her husband with day-to-day household expenses with what she earns in revenues. Her stock of merchandise has diminished a bit, and so she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy three sacks of rice, eight drums of palm oil, five bags of spaghetti, three boxes of "OMO" detergents, and various other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Jane Marie

texts.en: Jane Marie S. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 35 years old, is married, and has a school-aged child. Jane Marie operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Jane Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргул Сатторова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает трактористом. Сама Бозоргул более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает мелкий и крупный рогатый скот на рынке. Ей в этом также помогают дети. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Bozorgul S. lives in the Rumy district. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a tractor driver. Bozorgul has been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years. She raises and sells small livestock and cattle at a market. Her children help her as well. She is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Tuulima

texts.en:
"Tuulima T. (0) is a 84-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai.  She is widowed and has 10 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Tuulima owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Tuulima has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2005, Tuulima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuulima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Tuulima is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to rent land to raise additional crops.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Tuulima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr: Madame Amina est une femme qui habite le quartier d’Agoe Zongo à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a ouvert sa boutique en 2006 et cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans le foyer. Sa boutique est très connue des gens de son quartier qui la visitent à cause du bon accueil qu’elle a toujours su réserver à ses clients. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. Actuellement elle a un besoin pressant de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 cartons de lait, 05 cartons de savons, 07 boîtes de conserves de tomates, 06 bidons d’huiles, 12 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.

loans.use: Achat de lait, de tomates, de savons et de pâtes alimentaires

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel T. is from the city of Bañaderos Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Ritchel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ritchel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ritchel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ritchel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Ritchel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her retail store

loans.name: Ndatte

texts.fr:
Madame Ndatte G. commercialise des habits et chaussures d'enfants depuis 2004.  Elle est marie avec un enfant et elle habite a Camberene, une banlieue de Dakar.  Avec son crédit, elle envisage une augmentation de 20.000 frs de son revenu mensuel. 

Madame G. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndatte G. has sold clothing and children’s shoes since 2004. She is married with one child and lives in Camberene, a suburb of Dakar. With this loan, she anticipates a monthly revenue increase of 20,000 francs.
Mrs. G. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Child and Family Development Program (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially aims to protect children born into poor families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these children can receive loans with more flexible terms than ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received funding ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her selection of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old divorced mother of one son who is in school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town, but the majority of its inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation along with other trading activities. 

Elizabeth prepares and sells rice-porridge in the mornings. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Elizabeth buys the goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Dye Humberto

texts.es:
Dye tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a su madre y un hermano en el caserío La Arena, distrito de Motupe, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Motupe.

Hace dos años, con la ayuda de su madre, pudo comprarse una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado para el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que actualmente presta servicios de transporte entre la ciudad de Motupe y sus caseríos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad es el único sustento económico de su hogar ya que su padre los abandonó hace dos años.

Los caminos de la zona son muy accidentados y debido al constante uso su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir fallas mecánicas que dificultan el buen funcionamiento de su unidad móvil. Por este motivo Dye se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El gran anhelo de Dye es comprar otra mototaxi con la que pueda seguir brindándole el sustento a su familia. El es un joven responsable, empeñoso y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Dye, 18, is single and lives with his mother and brother in the La Arena settlement, Motupe district which is located two hours away from the city of Motupe. Two years ago, with help from his mother, he was able to buy himself a mototaxi (a three-wheeled, motorized, vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he currently offers transportation services between the city of Motupe and surrounding settlements. The earnings he gets from this activity is the only source of income for the family since their father abandoned them two years ago. The roads in the area are very rough and, due to the constant use it has been subjected to, his vehicle has started to have mechanical problems that adversely affect its proper functioning. This has forced Dye to have to call upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for help in the form of a 1000 new sol loan. Dye's great wish for the future is to buy another mototaxi so that he will be able to continue supporting his family. He is a responsible, enterprising and very hardworking young man.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Herman

texts.es: Herman tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y tiene vivienda propia. Herman trabaja como empleado de una empresa como electricista, y además presta servicio particular de electricista los fines de semana. Su empleo dependiente es seguro, y la competencia como electricista es baja, ya que no hay muchas personas que se dediquen a este rubro.
