El destino del crédito es para compra de moto para poder transportarse  en la misma. En Agrocapital ha pagado con bastante  puntualidad, también en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
Herman is 38, married, with one son and he has his own home. He works as an employee in a business as an electrician, and also offers his services as an electrician on weekends. His main work is steady, and there is little competition for electricians as there aren’t many people working in this field. The loan will be used to buy a motorbike for his own transportation. He has been quite punctual with his payments to Agrocapital, as well as in other business transactions. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doña Maria Luisa es un cliente nuevo que se dedica a la venta D. accesorios para el hogar en una ferreteria como chapas, sockets, interruptores, tambien mangueras, balanzas,exprimidores manuales y el ultimo pedido que tiene es por una gran cantidad D. botas que ella los venD. por sacos que contienen 50 pares D. botas D. trabajo D. goma, la cliente realiza sus entregas en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz y Montero, ella trabaja ya hace 10 años con su mama  y el itinerario implica ir a desaguadero para proveerse D. toda la mercaeria posible, los dias domingo viaja con direccion a santa cruz con escala en cochabamba, los dias martes y miercoles se dedican a entregar y cobrar por la mercaderia, temprano en jueves retornan a la Paz para abrir su ferreteria y los dias viernes  va a la feria del desaguadero frontera con Peru. La señora tiene el Apoyo D. su esposo Jose Luis quien se comprometio con el apoyo a su esposa en el pago putual D. las cuotas, ya que el señor trabaja como distribuidor D. la ferreteria en achumani y tiene constantes pedidos por la zona D. chasquipamapa.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Luisa is a new client who sells accessories, such as switch plate covers, light sockets, switches, also hoses, scales, and hand juicers in a hardware store. Her latest request has been for a large quantity of boots, which she sells in packs containing 50 pairs of rubber work boots to her customers in Santa Cruz and Montero. She’s been working with her mother for ten years and they travel to Desaguadero to see all available merchandise. On Sundays she goes to Santa Cruz and stops in Cohabamba. On Tuesdays and Wednesdays they deliver their merchandise and collect payment. They return to La Paz early on Thursdays to open the hardware store and on Fridays she goes to the marketplace on the Peruvian border. She has the support of her husband, Jose Luis, and they have both committed to repaying this loan on schedule. He works as a hardware distributor in Achumani and has many requests from the Chasquipamapa district.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercaderia

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.en:
Rosa Luz is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Rosa Luz is a single mother of three children, who range in age from 10 to 23.  

Rosa Luz has a small neighborhood general goods store in Patria.  She travels to the city of Cusco every few weeks to buy merchandise.   Rosa Luz also has a plot of land where she plants yucca and rice, located about a two-hour walking distance from her home.   She raises some chickens and ducks in her backyard which she also sometimes sells to supplement her income.  Rosa Luz also makes a delicious chilled juice from the fruit of the maracuya (passion fruit) tree in her backyard which is very popular with locals during the hot afternoons.  

Rosa Luz is requesting a loan to restock her store and to help pay for day laborers who will assist her with the yucca harvest.  She appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To stock general goods store and hire help for yucca harvest

loans.name: Fredys Javier

texts.es:
El señor Fredys E. es un caballero muy trabajador que se dedica a su propio negocio de laboratorio clínico donde atiende a sus pacientes todos los días en el mercado Mayoreo en el departamento de Managua.

El señor Fredys está solicitando el crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo para mejorar las condiciones del laboratorio y así brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes que a diario lo visitan en el laboratorio.
texts.en:
Mr. Fredys E. is a hardworking man who runs his own business, a clinical laboratory where he serves patients everyday in the Mayoreo market in the department of Managua.

Fredys is asking for a loan in order to buy more working materials to improve the conditions of his lab and thus offer better services to the clients who visit his clinic daily.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more working materials for his clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of used clothing in bales for resale

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma, de 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Danitza de un año y medio y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su bodega es la primera en abrirse en su barrio, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan.
Es por ello, que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su localidad. Lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el décimo préstamo de Zulma con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Zulma, 35, is a happy, hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her beloved daughter, Danitza, who is a year-and-a-half old, and what she most wants in the world is to give her a better quality of life. Her general store is the first one in the neighborhood to open. Its doors open at 6 in the morning, ready for shoppers who are up early and know that they can find what they want there. The thing that Zulma most likes about her work is talking with her customers and hearing about what's going on in the neighborhood. She has operated the business for 5 years and says that the aspect of the work that she least likes is having to be in the store all day without being able to leave. In the future, she would like to grow the business and provide her customers with an even better service. This is Zulma's tenth MFP loan and she expects to be able to repay it on time. She doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of the community bank where she is much respected because of the order that she brings to the group. She will use the thousand-soles loan she is applying for to buy more products to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. María Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, del Distrito de Morales, Región y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años, y es madre de 05 hijos todos independientes.
María Elena, su seguridad y perseverancia le llevo a iniciar  su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en general , ubicada en su casa un espacio amplio y acondicionado para  atender a sus clientes que diariamente acuden a comprar .Con  su primer préstamo de 
S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, implemento más su negocio comprando, leche en cajas, conservas de pescado, aceite en litros y otros.  
Con este préstamo de S/1,500.00 Nuevos Soles comprara más productos, como aceites, fideos, leche, arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas dulces y saladas en cajas y parte del dinero lo invirtió en  bebidas gasificadas cómo gaseosas y agua mineral en docenas, para su surtir su negocio.
María Elena, se siente con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the community bank "Las Moralinas" of the Morales district, region and department of San Martin. She is 51 years old, is married and is the mother of 5 children who are all independent. Maria Elena's security and perseverance led to start her own business selling groceries. Her store is located in her home in a spacious and conditioned space where she is able to attend to her clients daily. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles (PEN) she implemented her business further by buying more products such as oils, pastas, milk and sugar in sacks, cookies and crackers. She invested part of the money in soft drinks and mineral water to stock her business. Maria Elena is eager to keep working and is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing women like her to have opportunities in a medium where they can develop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope sells drugs, drinks and groceries in her shop located in front of her house. She also works as a nurse in one of the clinics in Lagos state, Nigeria. She used her last Kiva loan to stock her shop with more drugs and groceries. This attracted more customers to her shop, made more sales and increased her profit. 

She is married with four children. She is 42 years old. Her husband is a businessman. He clears and forwards goods at the port. He works hard to sustain his immediate family needs. She hopes for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more drugs, groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for choosing her as a borrower.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs, groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Griselda De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Griselda de la Cruz R., tiene 37 años y vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo trabaja en un taller torno, y ella labora como afanadora en un preescolar, ellos tienen tres jóvenes hijos. 

En el pasado tenían una pequeña venta de refrescos y comida, y se compraban materiales de uso personal y doméstico para vender, pero una mala administración, dio como resultado la quiebra inmediata de su fuente de ingresos, ahora ellos solicitan un préstamo para la apertura nuevamente de esta venta de comida y pulpería, ellos esperan se les brinde una nueva oportunidad para la llevar a andar este proyecto y así mejorar día a día sus condiciones de habitad y ofrecerle a sus hijos la posibilidad de un futuro más prospero.
texts.en:
Griselda de la Cruz R., 37, lives in Laureles Sur neighborhood; she’s married and her husband is a lathe operator. She is employed as a cleaning lady at a preschool; they have three young children. They used to have a small food and refreshment business where they also sold home and personal use items. However, poor administration led to the immediate failure of this source of income. They are asking for a new loan to reopen this food and grocery business. They hope that they will be given a new opportunity to succeed with this project so that their living conditions may improve and they can offer their children better prospects for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden D. sells fish and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell. Kiden is 29 years old and married  to a policeman. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Pangalalan. She is 42 years old and married. Lilia is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $163 a month from this activity. Her husband is a barber. 

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha C. is from the town of Banga. She is 64 years old. Editha is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 15 years already.

Editha joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Editha from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rebeca Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Rebeca  forma parte del Banco Comunal Corazones Felices, banco que se reúnen en la  parroquia del cantón Portoviejo llamada Andrés De Vera, su negocio es la venta de comida frente de su casa tiene mesas y sillas, ella mismo prepara la comida, trabaja desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche, los platos que más vende son carne con menestra y arroz con pescado frito, lleva tres años con su negocio.

 Está casada tiene dos hijos, el esposo trabaja como obrero en construcciones , es poco lo que gana pero es de gran ayuda para el hogar, la decidió  poner este negocio ya que su  esposo no estaba ganado bien y empezaron a tener problemas económicos, pero desde entonces tiene su negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

 Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en todo lo necesario para preparara los alimentos como; carnes, arroz y legumbres, sus clientes la buscan por su sazón, todos los días desde muy temprano se dedica a su trabajo y así sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
Rebeca is part of the communal bank Corazones Felices. This bank meets in a parrish of the Portoviejo canton called Andrés De Vera. Her business is selling food in front of her house, where she has tables and chairs. She prepares the food herself. She works from 2 in the afternoon until 7 at night. The dishes she sells the most are meat and stewed beans and rice with fried fish. She has been at this business for three years. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in construction. She earns little but it really helps the household. She decided to start this business because her husband wasn't making very much money and they started having financial problems. Since she has had her business, things have gone well for her. With this new loan, she will be able to invest in everything she needs to prepare the food, such as: meat, rice and vegetables. Her customers seek her out for her seasoning. She starts work very early every day in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 54 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con montañas y caminos de tierra). El tiene un restaurante en la parte delantera de su casa, su esposa y una de sus hijas le ayudan en su negocio. 

Antes de comenzar con el negocio, el construyo su casa con un dinero ahorrado y pudo construir la parte delantera de su casa donde iba a ser la sala en un local para su restaurante. Vende almuerzos con comidas típicas como llapingacho (papas con huevo y chorizos y una salsa de maní). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas y utensilios para el restaurante, en el futuro quiere readecua su local.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban area with mountains and dirt roads). He has a restaurant in the front of his home, and his wife and one of his daughters helps him with the business. Before starting the business, he built the house with money he saved and was able to construct a room at the front of it that he could use as a restaurant. He sells lunches of typical regional dishes such as Ilapingacho (potatoes with egg and chorizo in a peanut sauce). With the loan, he plans to purchase tables and utensils for the restaurant. In the future he wants to remodel his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and utensils for his restaurant

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario Q. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Rosario is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rosario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosario from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell at her shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva lender is a 33-year-old Lebanese man who is married and has two young children. He is the sole provider for his family and has worked as a farmer for the last eight years. Since 2008, he has managed his own farm, where he grows fruits and vegetables. Occasionally, he encloses portions of his crops in plastic tents to increase his farm's output and market his produce in nearby towns and cities over a longer growing season. He is applying for a loan for $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy seeds and other items for his farm. He estimates that this loan will help him increase his profits by 15 percent.

Note: Because of political and social concerns in Lebanon, we have made this application anonymous to protect the borrower (i.e., blacking out portions of the photo and not supplying names and locations.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these issues and encourages lenders to continue their support for borrowers in Lebanon.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen became Ameen s.a.l. in 2003,. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution that specializes in miicrofinance.

At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro- and small entrepreneurs and working poor, in order to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement to borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans worth $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 40, is married and has five children who are between the ages of 10 and 21, all attending school. Margaret has been operating her mixed farm in Kisii town, Western Kenya for over 20 years. Her farm produces maize, beans, tea leaves and vegetables which she sells to both the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. She also earns income from her retail shop in the same area.

Margaret has requested this loan of 90,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her cereals business. She says that being a victim of post election violence, the proceeds from this loan will help her rebuild her life and even acquire a home for her family. She also hopes that the proceeds will help her pay school fees for her children. Margaret hopes to expand her cereals business to wholesale status in the future and also open various cereals stores and supply to schools. She is grateful to Juhudi for the loans since they have helped her get organized again.

loans.use: To expand her cereals business.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: La señora María vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, vive con su esposo y su hijo de un año, la señora es empleada en una pensión y su esposo trabaja en mantenimiento de ascensores, con los ingresos que obtienen  mantienen a su familia, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El crédito será para la refacción de muros exteriores.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home in the Villa Exaltacion area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and one-year-old child. She is employed at a boarding house and her husband works in elevator maintenance. With their income, they support their family. This is the first time that Maria has requested a loan. The loan will be used for repairing exterior walls.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: restoration of walls

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph E. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 43 years old. Joseph is married and has 1 school-age child. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing public utility van services to local community members. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben C., 27, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its temples. C. is a tailor, earning an income of about five U.S. dollars per day. Her husband is taxi driver, also earning an income of about 5 U.S. dollars per day, and together their earnings cover family expenses.

Every month, C. has to spend U.S. $60 on food, U.S. $15 on electricity and water supplies, and U.S. $15 on other necessary expenses.  C. is requesting a loan of U.S . $1,000 to purchase more fabric for tailoring. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit from her business to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more fabrics for tailoring

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is a married woman who lives in Bargangay Ulalod, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Resohan/chainsaw and a charcoal business. Her husband Renaldo M., who is 48 years old, works as a Resohan to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 18 to 26 years old. 

Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past fourteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $237, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase additional wood so that she can continue to save up for the future of her business and for her family's welfare. Nenita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Luis Abismael

texts.es:
Luis tiene 18 años, estudia II año de Ingeniaría Agropecuaria, vive en Nueva Segovia, desde los 13 años ayuda a sus padres en las actividades agropecuarias y actualmente ellos le ayudan económica y moralmente con la Universidad; Comenzó su propio negocio hace 2 años con la venta de productos lácteos y contrato a alguien por que el comenzó a estudiar.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Desea terminar su carrera con buenas calificaciones y dedicarse al sector agropecuario.
texts.en:
Luis,18, is a second year student of Agriculture and Cattle raising.  He lives in Nueva Segovia.  Since he was 13 he has helped his parents with their farming and cattle raising chores and now they give him both economic and moral support at the university.  He started his own business two years ago selling dairy products and hired someone when he started his studies.

He negotiated this loan to invest in supplies for a university project: to grow cabbage.

He hopes to complete his studies with good grades and go into agriculture and cattle raising.

loans.use: Agronomy Students Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) Growing.

loans.name: Walter Georgino

texts.es:
Walter, tiene 30 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la mecánica y quiere comprar una motocicleta y algunos productos que requiere en su taller de mecánica.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de esta motocicleta y de los repuestos que necesita en el taller, con esta ayuda estará mejorando el transporte para Walter, también contara con repuestos para hacer las debidas reparaciones que los clientes le soliciten.
Sueña con un taller estable, que genere los ingresos necesarios para dar a su familia lo necesario diariamente.
texts.en:
Walter is 30 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department. He has a auto repair workshop and lives with his wife and sons. Walter has been working as a mechanic for 5 years and wants to buy a motorbike and various products that he requires for his workshop. 

Walter is seeking a loan to purchase this motorcycle and for the spare parts he needs in the workshop. With this help Walter's transport will be improved, and he will also have the spare parts required to make the repairs that his customers are seeking. Walter dreams of having a stable workshop, that generates the necessary earnings to meet his family's daily needs.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle and spare parts for workshop

loans.name: Elizabeth Ponce's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is from Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, married, and has one adult child. Elizabeth is the leader of a three-member loan group sponsored by PMPC. Although each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elizabeth P.’s Group. 

To make a living, Elizabeth buys and sells vegetables. She has been engaged in this business for six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 from PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell. This will be Elizabeth's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living standards. 



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 
About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kundy

texts.en:
Mr. Kundy H. and his wife, Mrs. Sreytouch Vuth, live on the island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2007 and have two sons. 

Kundy is a motorbike repairman and a blacksmith. He operates his business at home. His wife is a weaver. He is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase spare motorbike parts to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorbike parts to expand his business.

loans.name: Las Gaselas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Gaselas, esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos en  México, esta comunidad se distingue por tener una hacienda que fue fundada por Hernán C., este fue un inmueble importante productor de azúcar y granos, El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito.Elva A. L. es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de estambres negocio que inicio hace 3 años, solicita su préstamo para comprar mas productos, Tiene 34 años, estudio la preparatoria es casada, tiene una hija, sus clientes están a gusto porque siempre  encuentran los productos que necesitan, al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque con el crédito podrá comprar más producto para hacer crecer su negocio y obtendrá mayores ganancias con las que podrá seguir pagando los estudios de su hija.l
texts.en:
This group, Las Gaselas (The Gazelles), are located in the State of Morelos and it is distinguished for having an hacienda founded by Hernan C. (the conquistador). The property has been important as a producer of sugar and grains. The group is composed of 10 members and this is the first time they have solicited a loan.

Elva is a member of the group. She sells woolen yarn, a business she started some 3 years ago. Elva requests a loan to buy more products. She is 34 years old, studied in preparatory school, is married, and has a daughter. Her customers are happy because they always find the products they need.

Upon soliciting the loan, Elva feels content because with this loan she will be able to buy more products to make her business grow, and she will obtain greater earnings, enabling her to continue paying for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE (WOOLEN YARN) FOR THEIR BUSINESS

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos D. negocios y a brindar servicios. Maria Magdalena se dedica a elaborar artesanía. Su esposo D. Maria Magdalena confecciona joyas en oro y plata y ella lo venD. a instituciones públicas. Maria Magdalena requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como oro y plata.
 
Maria Magdalena pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas D. María” D. la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año D. funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena lives in the historic city of Cusco, department of Cusco, Peru. In the city of Cusco, people have all types of different businesses with different services. Maria Magdalena makes handicrafts. Her husband makes jewelry out of gold and silver and she sells it in public places. Maria Magdalena needs this loan to purchase materials such as gold and silver.

Maria Magdalena belongs to the Hijas D. Maria (Daughters of Mary) Community Bank through Kiva partner Asociacion Arariwa, Cusco, Peru. The community bank is in its third year of existence and is going well for all the members.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as gold and silver

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old, married and has two children aged 3 and 6.  He uses his bicycle to transport sodas over short distances.  He has been earning a living from this business for nine years.  He also does poultry and livestock farming, thanks to Faulu Kenya's helping him to buy cows and chickens.  He has also managed to install water in his house.  

He was previously supplying fruit for a living.  He has requested 60,000 Kes to get capital to start a charcoal business.

loans.use: To start charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es: El Sr C.  labora como conductor  es acompañado, tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga,  la oportunidad que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales arena, bloque ,cemento, cinz, piedrín, hierro, mano de obra.construire paded de mi casa que es de madera que  esta en  mal estado.
texts.en:
Mr. C. works as a driver and has a live-in parter and two children in his care.  This is his first loan through CEPRODEL.  He plans to use the loan to make home improvements and buy materials such as sand, bricks, cement, zinc, gravel, and iron.

He plans to build the walls of his house which are currently made of wood and in disrepair.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A., from Catadman, Ozamiz City, is 29 years old and still single. She is currently employed at Appliance Center and also sells Avon products such as perfume, lotion, beauty products, etc. to her neighbors and friends. Engaged in this business for four years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her first loan of P50,000 PHP to help in the construction of their new home and to purchase more Avon products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to help construct her new home and buy products for her Avon business

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok was born in 1950 and is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by its five members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Sok and her husband, Mr. Sim are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow corn for their family. Aside from being farmers, they also earn their living by making mats to sell. In order to increase their income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Sok would like to ask for a loan to buy mat supplies to support her mat business. 

This couple has three children: two are employed in a garment factory while the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy mat supplies to support her mat business.

loans.name: Luchando Contra La Pobreza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is named Luchando contra la pobreza (Fighting Against Poverty) and is located on a rural hill of Puerto Plata. Businesses in this group are: a small salon, vegetable selling, grocery store, and others sell clothing and miscellaneous products. 

Lucia R., the group leader, is a middle-aged woman who came to Esperanza in search of a loan two and a half years ago, and invested it in a small “colmadito” (grocery store) that sells staple foods and groceries. Now Lucia R. is excited to receive her sixth loan, which she will use as capital to buy enough inventory for her store. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing cooking oil, rice, sugar, and crackers. 

Lucia R. said that she hopes to continue to grow her business so that she will be able to help support her two grown children (25 and 27) in their college. When she is not working, Lucia enjoys attending her local church several times a week.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, and crackers

loans.name: Mayra Lucia

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cuanta con grandes iglesias que resaltan la belleza de esta ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio de todo tipo, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señorita. Mayra tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía de la casa. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia es Ingeniera en Sistemas y trabaja controlando un Cyber Internet, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en el pago de una parte de su maestría de Ingeniera en Sistemas.

Su meta es culminar con éxitos su maestría.
texts.en: Mayra C. is a member of the communal lender Mujeres de Trabajo, in the scenic city of Azogues, which has a beautiful architecture with several large churches.  Local entrepreneurs are very charismatic and do a brisk business.  Mayra is 24, single, lives with her parents in a rented house and contributes to household expenses.  Mayra is a systems engineer and works managing an internet cafe, from Monday to Saturday (8 a.m. to 5 p.m).  This is her second loan, and she seeks credit to offset expenses related to her Master's degree program in systems engineering.  Her goal is to finish her degree with success.

loans.use: to cover expenses for a Master's program

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como Chichubamba este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”,  tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hjos. Ella es profesora y trabaja como profesora auxiliar en el colegio particular “TIKAPATA”. Ya son dos años que trabaja enseñando y le va muy bien.   
 
Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, nos cuenta que compra cuyes los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo llegan hasta su casa, comerciante,  vecinos, familiares y dueños de restaurantes de la localidad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar para comprar cuyes y gallinas, alimentos y medicinas para sus animalitos. 
Su sueño es que crezca el negocio y tener una gran cantidad de animales menores.
texts.en: In the city of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru, there's a place called Chichubamba known for its beautiful scenery, gastronomy and the warmth of its people. Here we find Maritza, who belongs to the "Saywa - Chichubamba" community bank. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is a teacher and works as an assistant at "TIKAPATA" school. She has been teaching for two years and it is going very well. She also makes a living raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has a small farm at her house, and she tells us she raises the guinea pigs she buys for two to three months until they are ready to be sold, after which time she offers them to merchants, neighbors, family members and local restaurant owners. She plans to use this loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed and medicine for the animals. Her dream is to grow her business so she can have a larger number of small animals.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed and medicine for the animals

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en:
Taiba is married and is the loving mother of three children. Her husband works as a carpenter. She has been running a business selling different kinds of beddings for 12 years.  Taiba sells her products in the market of Isfara city. She sells basically fabrics, bed linens, blankets, unbleached calicos and handkerchiefs. Taiba buys her goods from Khujand city 2-3 times a month.  In the seasonal period from May to August, her daily revenue is about 200-300 TJS. Taiba plans to increase her assortments of fabrics and bed linens to expand her business.  To achieve that goal, she has requested a loan of 9,000 TJS. Let’s help her with this purchase and provide for her needs. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy bed linens and fabrics

loans.name: Nyakahanga Twetungure Group

texts.en: Ruth, 36, is a farmer by profession. The married mother of five mostly grows and sells bananas, tea leaves and sorghum. She has been in this business for the last six years. Where she does her farming in Kihihi, there is always a ready market for the crops she grows. This in a way explains the reason why she decided to start this business. She says this business generates monthly revenue of 180,000 shillings. With this Kiva loan, Ruth plans on purchasing better manure for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase better manure to apply on her farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also care of several other family members and earns a living by sell charcoal six days a week. Margaret has been in this line of work for the last seven years and also runs a small business on the side selling used clothing. She is applying for this loan from MCDT SACCO of 1000,000 to buy more bales of clothes to sell and build her own stall. Her biggest challenges include transportation, but she is committed to grow her current businesses, begin selling clothes imported from overseas and start a new business renting out rooms to visitors. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. One of her largest monthly expenses is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim, 50, is a widow woman who lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City.  To earn a living, she opens a small business inside her house for selling coffee and other soft drinks to her neighbors or other travelers. From this business, Mrs. Kim could make around $10 each day to ensure that her family lives a comfortable life. 

She is a hard-working woman who tries to make money to feed her four single children, most of whom are enrolled to school. Furthermore, they always assist her in selling coffee when they have time away from school. In order to increase her profit as well as making her business successful, Mrs. Kim would like to ask for some funds from Kiva lenders to add more investment so as she can use it to buy additional coffees and soft drinks for selling.

loans.use: to buy additional coffees and soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La Sra. Betty pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas II” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 41 años y tiene 03 hijos en edad escolar.

Empezó vendiendo jugo D. naranja y toronja por las mañanas y como vio que las ganancias no eran suficiente para sus gastos familiares pensó en otro negocio. Con un capital D. S/.300.00 y el apoyo D. su esposo compró un carrito salchipapero (comida al paso) para que venda por las noches, así poco a poco fue ganando clientela. Actualmente continúa vendiendo jugos D. frutas D. la región y por las noches venD. “salchipapas” y otras variedades como “pollo broster” y “salchipan”, además refrescos y gaseosas.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 comprará  productos e ingredientes al por mayor D. esa manera disminuirá sus costos, comprará papas por sacos, aceite por galones y condimentos, además comprará envases descartables que utiliza en su negocio. 

Betty es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es tener un negocio en su propia casa vendiendo sus productos y dedicarse además a otros negocios que le permitan crecer y mejorar económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad D. continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the "Las Golondrinas II' (Swallows II) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province and department.  She is 41 years old, married, and has three school-age children.

Betty started out selling orange and grapefruit juice in the mornings.  She saw that the profits she was making were not enough to cover her family expenses and so decided to start another business.  With 300 Peruvian soles in capital, and the support of her husband, she bought a cart for selling 'salchipapas' (Peruvian fast food).  She would make her sales in the evenings and gradually acquired customers.  She currently continues selling juices maD. from regional fruits and, in the evenings, she sells 'salchipapas' and other food such as fried chicken and 'salchipan' as well as soft drinks and soda.

Betty will use this loan for 2,500 soles to buy products and ingredients wholesale.  In this way, she will reduce her costs.  She will buy potatoes by the sack, oil by the gallon, and herbs and spices.  She will also buy disposable containers that she uses in her business.

Betty is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to have a business in her own home, selling her products.  She would also like to have other businesses that would allow her to grow and improve her financial situation.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for having given her the opportunity to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, potatoes, oil and disposable containers

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is 40 years old and married.  He is a hardworking, determined and aggressive businessman.  He runs a motorbike transport business to earn a living.  He was able to start the business after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to buy a motorbike.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has also learnt how to manage his business.  This has helped him to retain his business.

Obadiah hopes to own a transport company in the future.  He needs a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old and married to Nancy. They have no children for now. He has been running a stationery shop for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to cater for their needs.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy envelopes, pens, and exercise books to add to his stationery shop inventory. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his stationery shop. His hopes and dreams are to open a big stationery shop, buy a plot of commercial land and build rental houses which will improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy envelopes, pens, and exercise books to add to his stationery shop inventory.

loans.name: Alexandra Esther

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. Hace tiempo atrás  estudio belleza en una Academia en Montecristi y obtuvo el título de artesana en belleza.

Nuestra amiga tiene un salón de belleza en su casa en el cual  realiza diversos trabajos como  tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre otras cosas que realiza para satisfacción de sus cliente. También vende productos de Esika, Lebel, Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas)  el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, tratamientos, esmaltes  y productos de Avon y Yanbal. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran salón de belleza en Manta.
texts.en:
The Primero de Agosto village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. It is the place where the famous straw Panama hats are made.
Alexandra lives here. She is 34 years old, and she and her husband have three children, 11, 7, and 3 years of age. The two older children attend school. Her husband is a security guard. A while back, she studied cosmetology in a school in Montecristi and earned her license.
Our friend has a beauty salon in her house where she performs a number of treatments, including dyes, cuts, and manicures, among others, to her clients' delight. She sells beauty products by Esika, Lebel, Yanbal, and Avon in addition to carrying out her other tasks. She works from 8 a.m. till 9 p.m. or even later if her clients need her services. She's had her business more than 8 years and it's going quite well.
Alexandra will use this loan to buy dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, and Avon and Yanbal products. She is a founding member of the village bank and she likes it because it makes it easier to obtain loans.
Her dream is to have a large beauty salon in Manta.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, hair treatments, nail polish, and Avon and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Bernadette M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. is very pleases to introduce this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They are among the first applicants to receive a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in this city. They have applied for a loan of 9,500,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf. 

Bernadette is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kono, Bernadette, who is 51 years old, has been in the teaching profession for 30 years. She is single with five children, all of whom attend school. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase furniture and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Saniya

texts.en:
Saniya is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Saniya has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which provides an outside catering service to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Saniya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase flour and cooking oil, and will help Saniya to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Saniya hopes that in the future she will be able to own a house. 

Saniya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Saniya's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Gloria Marisol

texts.es:
Gloria, es comerciante D. ropa, ella vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, el negocio D. Gloria surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja D. manera ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo y hasta el momento ha adquirido experiencia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ropa: blusas, camisas, ropa interior D. dama, la compra le permitirá crecer en el negocio, atender mejor a los clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio fuerte, abastecido D. ropa nueva, atender un lugar específico, D. preferencia un local propio, para estar más cerca D. la familia.
texts.en:
Gloria sells clothing. She lives with her husband and two children. Gloria grew her business through her own efforts, as a traveling salesperson with no fixed daily schedule, and has obtained experience through working.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy blouses, shirts, and women’s underwear, as these purchases will help her increase her business and to take care of her clients better which will increase her income. 

Her dream is to have a strong business, stocked with new clothing, and have a site for her business in her own home in order to be closer to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, shirts and women's underwear

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas e socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris, tiene 59 años y 5 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 15 años.
Felicitas venD. carne D. chancho, queso y reparte en las casas, siempre se dedicó a la venta D. carne, tiene una chacra donD. tiene algunas reses, le encanta estar en su Banco Comunal porque aprenD. muchas cosas que le ayudan a poder ser mejor madre, comerciante, las capacitaciones le ayudan a administrar mejor su negocio. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando comprará carne D. chancho.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Arco Iris (Rainbow) Communal Bank. She is 59 years old, has 5 children, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.

Felicitas sells pork and cheese door to door. She has always been in meat sales, and she owns a small farm with some cattle. She loves her communal bank because she learns a lot of things that can help her be a better mother and businesswoman. The training sessions help her better manage her business. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase pork.

loans.use: to purchase pork.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 18 años, es soltero y vive en el centro poblado de Puerto Amargura, LLochegua. Cuando Nelson apenas termino la secundaria, se puso a estudiar en "CETPRO" instituto de carrera corta, ahí estudió mecánica en motos y motocicletas, una vez terminado su carrera se dedico a trabajar en el taller de su tío. Desde entonces la gente lo conoce como un buen trabajador, de ahí montó su propio taller y fue que empezó a trabajar de manera independiente y percibiendo ganancias. Actualmente tiene mucho trabajo, que tiempo le falta para reparar las motos de sus clientes. Sin embargo su unico inconveniente es no tener todas las herramientas necesarias, todo esto por el poco capital que tiene, es por esta razón que Nelson recurre a MFP, por un préstamo para poder comprarse mas herramientas y equipos para su taller. Él esta satisfecho por lo que hasta ahora ha logrando, gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes le dieron. Este será su segundo credito por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles comprará herramientas y equipos para su taller.
texts.en: Nelson is 18 years old and unmarried.  He lives in the town of Puerto Amargura, LLochegua. Nelson had just finished high school when he enrolled in a short-term studies program at CETPRO technical college. There, he studied motorcycle mechanics.  After completing his studies, he began working in his uncle’s garage.  Since then, people have come to know him as a hard worker.  From there, he set up his own garage and began to work independently and make profits.  Now he has so much work that he doesn’t have enough time to repair his customers’ motorcycles.  However, his only drawback is not having enough money to buy all the all the tools he needs. For this reason, Nelson is returning to MFP for a loan to purchase more tools and equipment for his garage.  He is satisfied with what he has achieved so far, thanks to the support his parents have given him.  This will be his second loan and once more, he promises to make his payments on time.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will purchase tools and equipment for his garage.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for his garage. ,

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.ru:
Bahadur 51 god. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Lachin regiona , seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so sovyey lubimoy i ochen drujelubnoy semyoy. Bahadur jenat i imeyet 4 detey. 

Eto uje tretaya ssuda Bahadura perviye 2 ssudi on oplatil udachno i bez zaderjok. On ochen blagodaren Lenderam i Kive za ssudi kotoriye bili predostavleni yemu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Bahadur is 51 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin Region, now living in the Baku Region together with his beloved and close-knit family. Bahadur is married and has four children. This is Bahadur’s second loan; the first two loans were repaid successfully, without delays. He is very grateful to lenders and to Kiva for the loans he had obtained. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy the necessary work tools for his business.

loans.use: to buy necessary work tools

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
AMADOU HABITE DANS UN DEPARTEMENT DE LA REGION DU SUD AGE DE 41 ANS.IL EST MARIE D'UNE FEMME ET A 4 ENFANTS ,3 SONT A L'ECOLE  PRIMAIRE.
AMADOU FAIT LE COMMERCE DEPUIS 1988.AVEC CE CREDIT,IL AUGMENTE LA MARCHANDIS DANS SA BOUTIQUE,IL DEMARE SA JOURNEE DE TRAVAIL DE 8H A 20H.AVEC SON BENEFICE IL A ACHETER 2 MOTOS TAXI JAKARTA,ASSURE LES DEPENSES DE SA FAMILLE ET LES FRAIS SCOLAIRE.
AMADOU DANS L'AVENIR COMPTE OUVRIR 2 BOUTIQUES POUR SES 2 PETITS FRERES
texts.en:
Amadou lives in in a department of the Southern region. He is 41 years old, married and has four children, three of whom attend primary school.

Amadou has been a retail merchant since 1988. His workday extends from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm.

With this loan he will replenish his shop's supplies. His profits will enable him to buy two Jakarta taxi motorcycles, manage family expenses and tuition fees.

In the future he plans to open two shops for his two younger brothers.

loans.use: replenish store supplies

loans.name: Les Militant De Ferrier 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Andre est le coordinateur de son groupe MILITANT DE FERRIER. Il est celibataire et  a 0 enfants.

Andre habite dans la région de  Ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Andre a dirigé son  commerce de vetement pendant les 5  dernières années. Andre voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec produits du vetemen

Andre  dit que ses défis principal est de un grand commercant. Andre dit que son but principal son rêve est possede un bon commerce.
texts.en: Andre is the facilitator of the MILITANT DE FERRIER group.  He is single and does not have any children.  Andre lives in Haiti, in the Ferrier region, where electricity is rare and access to water is very limited.  Andre has been selling clothes for 5 years.  Andre is requesting a loan in order to invest in the clothing business.  According to Andre, his main challenge is to increase his business.  Andre says that his main goal and dream is to own a good business.

loans.use: To invest in the clothing business.

loans.name: Mebelyn

texts.en:
Mebelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Mebelyn has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mebelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mebelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, 30 years old, is married and has 4 children. She lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Maricel has owned and operated a general store for 1 year, earning a monthly income of 2,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Maricel has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Arquimides Antonio

texts.es:
Arquímedes, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura el cual cosecha frijoles y maíz, no tiene un horario fijo para atender sus labores.
El préstamo lo necesita para invertirlo en alquiler de dos manzanas de tierra para sembrar sus productos y comprar los insumos agrícolas como: herbicidas, abono y semilla para que este año sean mejores sus cosechas y poder darles lo que necesitan su familia.
El sueño de Arquímedes es mejorar económicamente para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Arquímedes lives with his wife and two children. He works in agriculture harvesting beans and corn. He does not have a fixed schedule to tend to his labors.

He needs this loan so he can rent just about 3-1/2 acres of land to plant his crops and to buy agriculture supplies such as herbicides, compost and seed so that this year the crops will be better and he will be able to give his family the things they need.

The dream of Arquímedes is to improve his financial standing so that his family does not lack anything.

loans.use: to rent 3-1/2 acres of land to plant his crops

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
To earn a living, Mary Jean has a general store business. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Mary Jean has been a member of PMPC for one year. She is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. Mary Jean is married with two children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Astrid De Jesus

texts.es:
Astrid se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes siempre les quiere brindar una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar decidió iniciar su propio negocio y así contribuir económicamente en su hogar. Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años tiene un taller de confección donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado captar muy buenos clientes y tiene la oportunidad de generar 3 empleos en su taller. Con el ánimo de iniciar su línea de confección propia, Astrid busca que un préstamo le permita comprar una máquina plana más insumos de confección como telas e hilos, y así iniciar la confección de su línea propia.

De esta manera podrá cumplir su sueño de tener una confección propia y así seguir creciendo en su taller. Además, con su línea propia generará mayores ingresos para su hogar brindando una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos y su esposo y también podrá tener la oportunidad de seguir generando empleo.

loans.use: Comprar una máquina plana más insumos de confección como telas e hilos, y así iniciar la confección de su línea propia.

loans.name: Mariela Karina

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó trabajando tiempo atrás con su ex-esposo en la pesca artesanal, hasta que se separaron y ella siguió realizando esta labor.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 5 am en el puerto de Santa Rosa.  Al momento se encuentra separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad y uno de ellos asiste a la escuela fiscal de su área.  Desea a futuro poder incrementar su negocio y tener más ventas.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pescado y otros mariscos.

loans.use: Compra de mariscos

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 38-year-old mother of three who live with her family in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Life hasn’t been easy for this hard working woman who lost her formal employment some years ago. She has had to take on the responsibility of feeding her children and family by herself because her husband also has no formal job. Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice Poultry farming for Alice was not difficult. Her parents kept poultry. For the past five years, Alice has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Alice is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Alice is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met. 
You can be part of Alice life. Help her improve her business and her life with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is married with two children.She lives in Lumo,adjacent to the Dar es Salaam International Airport(DIA),in Dar es Salaam.Khadija is self employed and own a shop near her residence.Khadija is a housewife and has only a primary education.With the help of her husband she managed to open the shop.The shop sells different consumable items.Mainly food items,which have high turnover.The shop provides her with an opportunity to raise her children.She would like to expand her business by adding a stock of items in the shop, so that she can meet costs of educating her children and help her husband in raising the family.The shop employs herself and her sister.To expand her business she needs USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.en:
Norma is married, has two kids who are 9 and 12 years old, her husband is an electrician and is self-employed. Four years ago, Norma started her business of making and selling school uniforms, since her husband had no job at the time. In order to cover household expenses, and have an extra income, she started with this trade she was already familiar with. She received a loan, and was able to buy a sewing machine to start working.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$825, which she will use to purchase fabrics, threads, and raw materials she needs to make the uniforms. She is eager to get ahead. Her great work has allowed her to continue with her business, and have clients who like her work. Norma would like her business to grow, and she needs your help and affection. You can help improve her life and her family’s.

La señora Norma es casada, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, su esposo es electricista y trabaja por su cuenta. Hace cuatro año que la señora inició su negocio de elaborar y vender uniformes escolares, porque su esposo no tenia trabajo y para poder salir de los gastos del hogar y obtener un ingreso extra, ella empezó con esto porque ya conoce este oficio, consiguió un préstamo y así fue como compro una máquina de cocer para elaborar sus costuras.

En estos momentos ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 825 dólares que empleara en la compra de telas, hilos y la materia prima que necesita para elaborar los uniformes. Ella tiene enormes deseos de superación, su buen trabajo le ha permitido continuar con su negocio y ubicarse en el gusto de sus clientes. Norma quiere que su negocio crezca y necesita tu cooperación y cariño, tú puedes hacer que mejore la vida de ella y de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, and raw materials.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella A. has a supermarket where she sells all kinds of things. She is 33 years old and married with a child. She hails from Uromi of Edo State, Nigeria. She wish for the above loan for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more provisions  to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
After working for another mechanic for 8 years, Francisco Banitez J. decided to start his own business three years ago in the hope of gaining more money. He is 37 years old, married, and a father of two sons. His elder son, who is 16 years old, helps him at his mechanic shop. His other son is 10 years old and is studying at school.

Francisco mainly works on fixing large trucks and pick-up trucks. He works from Mondays to Saturdays all day long, starting at 7 in the morning and usually working until late at night when he finishes his work for the day.

After opening his own shop, he has accumulated a large group of his own clients that always seek his services. With his previous loan, he was able to purchase machinery that cost $900 to elevate the trucks. He is very grateful for the loan he received previously because the machine he purchased has helped him a lot in minimizing manual labor. Now he is seeking a loan to purchase more parts for a truck that he is working on.

loans.use: Purchase parts for a truck.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim S. is a 51-year-old widow and lives with her one child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works selling grocery products to the people in her area, which enables her to generate around $5 profit each day. Her single child works as a teacher, earning $80 each month.

Mrs. Chim S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand for this coming Pchum Ben festival. (The fifteen day of the tenth month of the Khmer calendar marks the Pchum Ben festival. This is a time when the spirits of the dead ancestors walk the Earth. And the living can ease their suffering by offering them food to eat.)

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand for this coming Pchum Ben festival

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is married with ten children and she’s 44 years old. She decided to create this business because she lives near the sea and thinks this is one of the good and profitable business in Samoa because this is an area where many tourists come to have fun. She applied for this loan in order to buy tools needed for making Samoan fales (open huts) for tourists and for beach decorations. She gets more than ten tourists per week and she usually makes $300ST ($120USD) per week and earns more during Christmas and New Years' time. She is very happy with her business because not only does she get money from  it, but also the opportunity to meet tourists and tell them about the Samoan culture. She hopes her next loan will help her improve her business and make the fales and beach decorations look nice.

loans.use: To buy tools for building Samoan fales and beach decorations

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Mr. Denis is a 65 year old married man. He lives with his wife, his 17 year old daughter and his grandson.
