Mr. Denis is retired, and he receives his pension every month, but that money is not enough to feed his whole family, since he is the sole breadwinner. He makes windows for houses. He has 30 years of experience, and all of his work is done by hand by melting aluminum in order to shape the window. He is a very dedicated worker, and as such he has a good reputation in the area of Memorial Sandino where he lives. He needs the loan in order to buy aluminum, glass and rivets so that he can keep on making windows and meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Denis tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, con una hija de 17 años, vive con su esposa, hija y un nieto.Don Denis es jubilado y recibe mensualmente dinero del seguro social, pero este dinero es muy poco para alimentar a su familia, ya que es el único sostén de ella. Trabaja haciendo ventanas para las casas de habitación, tiene 30 años de experiencia, y todo este trabajo lo hace artesanalmente, la manera en que lo hace es fundiendo el aluminio para darle forma a la ventana. La dedicación que pone en su trabajo lo ha hecho merecedor de una muy buena fama en el barrio Memorial Sandino donde éste reside; es por eso que necesita el crédito para comprar aluminio, vidrio y remaches para seguir haciendo ventanas y poder suplir las necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy aluminum, glass, and rivets for his business.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en: In Nakifuma, a location dominated by farming, Francis, the chairperson of Mayangayanga Development Group has taken his own path. He is a businessman dealing in shoes for men, women and children. He buys the shoes from Kampala twice a week and sells them to locals in the daily markets around his home. He is 45 years old and married with six children, plus nine of his brothers’ children whom he cares for. He is our client and has always been prompt with his payments. His main aim is to buy more shoes and increase his income to enable him to complete paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes of different sizes and types

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía has been selling ceviche (fish meat) on a mobile stall in Matucana market. for ten years. She has four children, the oldest is 21 years old and is from her first relationship. For some time she had to bring her up by herself, until three siblings arrived from Sofía's new relationship. Her children have had a better upbringing thanks to the business, however it has been hard for her to start from scratch. Her husband also helps her with the housework, selling ceviche on another stall. They both want to be able to open a restaurant in the area and convert it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace diez años Sofía vende ceviche en un puesto ambulante en el mercado de Matucana. Ella tiene cuatro hijos, la mayor tiene 21 años y es producto del primer compromiso de su madre. Durante un tiempo tuvo que trabajar solo para ella, hasta que tuvo tres hijos más con una nueva pareja. Brindarles una mejor crianza a sus hijos la animó a vender comida, aunque ha sido duro para ella empezar de cero. Su esposo también la ayuda con el mantenimiento de la casa vendiendo ceviche en otro puesto. Ambos desean en un futuro poder abrir un restaurante en un local y convertirlo en restaurante.

loans.use: Obtain a premises to open a restaurant

loans.name: Jheny Marisol

texts.es:
Jheny has belonged to the Community Bank 2000 for two years. Jheny is a single mother, 36 years old and has two children. Jheny sells consumer products and works for a distribution company. She sells in the city of Ayuchucho, Huanta, and plans to create a computer game room for children. Jheny needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in the purchase of a washing machine for her house and a computer game. The dreams of Jheny are that her children will become professionals and build the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C.Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Jheny pertenece al Banco Comunal Dos Mil hace 2 años.

Jheny es madre soltera, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Jheny es agente vendedora de productos de consumo, trabaja para una empresa distribuidora. Sus ventas lo realiza en la ciudad de Ayacucho y Huanta. Jheny tiene proyectado implementar un salón de juegos electrónicos para niños.

Jheny necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una lavadora para su casa y un juego electrónico.

Los sueños de Jheny son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir la segunda planta de su casa.

loans.use: Jheny needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy a washing machine for her home and a computer game.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is a man with many good qualities. He is honest, hard working, and is a social person. He began a business to earn an extra income and to have an activity that would make him feel useful. He is retired and receives a small pension from the Mexican Postal Service. Since his the amount he receives from his pension is quite a small amount, he decided to start his own business. He began his business in January 2004, after his wife went on a trip to San Antonio, Texas, to see their daughter. His wife mentioned the idea of opening a business to their daughter and she decided to help them. Their daughter helped them get big packages of used clothing from the United States for them to sell to their friends and neighbors in Mexico. It has been a very good business for them. Now his wife travels every three months to the United States to get the clothing, or if they need clothes earlier, their daughter sends them the clothing.

Now they need a loan of $300, which they will payoff in three months. They will use the money to buy more used clothing and to have a better variety of clothing, which will give them the opportunity to increase their income. With your support they will be able to progress more with their business.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Carlos es una hombre muy honesto, trabajador y muy sociable. Inició el negocio Para tener un ingreso extra y tener una actividad para sentirse útil, ya que lo pensionaron del Servicio Postal Mexicano y su pensión es pequeña por lo cual tuvo la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio. Comenzó en Enero de 2004, por esas fechas su esposa fue a visitar a su hija que vive en San Antonio, Texas y le comentó que querían abrir un negocio, fue entonces que su hija le dijo que ella le ayudaba a conseguir pacas de ropa usada para que ellos las vendieran entre sus vecinos y amistades, lo cual hicieron y les fue muy bien. Ahora su esposa viaja cada 3 meses por ropa, o si necesitan antes dependiendo la temporada, su hija se la manda.

Ahora necesitan un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar ropa usada de temporada y tener un mejor surtido que nos permita aumentar nuestras ganancias. Con tu apoyo ellos podrán progresar.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Savri

texts.ru:
Savri is an old client of ours who pays off her loans on time. She knows now that she was able to use the loan successfully to expand her business and wants to continue her credit history. She wants to use this loan to buy summer t-shirts, shorts and bermudas (long shorts). She needs a loan of 2,500 somoni (US$750).

Translated from Russain by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Саври наша давнишняя клиентка , которая вовремя погашает свой предыдущий кредит.Она поняв что смогла использовать займ в цели расширения своего бизнеса , хочет продолжить свою кредиторскую историю.следующий займ хочет взять для завоза летних футволок и шорт, бермуд.Она дала заявку на 2500 сомони.

loans.use: Sales of men's clothing

loans.name: Top

texts.en:
Mr. Top Y., 57, sells oxen that he buys from villagers and resells for profit. He makes about $4 per day. His wife sells beef and makes about $3 per day. They have seven children, one of whom is married. They all live in Preksdey Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia.

Because of the increasing cost of living, his wife has to work hard every day to increase their income so Mr. Y. is applying for a loan to buy an ox to sell. He hope the loan allows him to expand his business and increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim L. S., 61, sells vegetables in the local food market while her husband, Yim Sophat, is a private doctor. She typically makes US$50 each day in revenue, working as a middle man, purchasing vegetables from the growers and reselling them in the market. Her husband makes US$15 per day of income and they have six children who have all married and have started their own families outside the home. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to allow her to purchase a larger amount of vegetables to resell in the market. She has seen that there is client demand for the goods, but she lacks the capital needed to expand her business. This investment will allow her to increase her daily profits and she is optimistic about the investment.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mrs Sok Vanna's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which is located in Kaoh Kaev Leu village in Kandal Province consists of twenty-three people who plan to use the loan for a variety of purposes. For instance, Mrs S. V., who is the village bank president, is requesting a loan to buy zinc to fix her house's roof because it is now the rainy season. Mrs S. V. and her husband, Mr Pal Chhorn, are farmers in the local village. Mrs S. V. is 53 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are enrolled in the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The members who have end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy zinc to fix her house's roof.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: El joven Jose N., es una persona joven de 32 años de edad, es soltero no depende nadie de él, habita en casa de su señora madre quien por falta de recursos economicos no le pudo dar  estudios, pero como todo microempresario tiene la vision de salir adelante crecer economicamente, tener su propia casa. Actualemnte se esta dedicando a la venta de ropa variada, y comesticos los que compra  en managua, dependiendo de su demanda, comercializando de forma ambulante, mas adelante pretende instalar una tienda donde ofertar su mercaderia de manera fija. El credito sera invertido para capital exclusivamente de trabajo ya que se avecinan los meses buenos y su demanda se ve incrementada.
texts.en:
Young Jose N. is a young person of 32 years of age. He is single and has no dependents. He lives in a house with his mother who, lacking economic resources, was not able to give him an education. However, like many small business entrepreneurs, he has a vision of getting ahead and growing financially and having his own home. Currently, he is dedicated to selling a variety of clothing and cosmetics that he buys in Managua. Depending on demand, he sells them on foot. Later, he aims to establish a store where he can offer his merchandise from a fixed location. This loan will be invested solely in working capital since the good months are approaching and demand will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu K. is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She and her husband are unemployed and raising cattle for sale, which is their only financial source to feed five children. Gullu`s children are also engaged in helping their mother with cattle. 

Gullu raises cattle and then sells them at the market. She also provides her family with milk products. Gullu buys cattle almost twice each week. After fattening them, she sells them.

With the help of this loan, she plans to increase her livestock and construct a comfortable winter cow-shed for her cattle. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase four calves. She and her family are counting on your help!

loans.use: To purchase two calves and build a cow-shed

loans.name: Warlin

texts.en:
Warlin P., 33-year old father of two children, farms a family-owned rice field in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. As the head of the family, he chooses to work under the heat of the sun just to earn a living and provide what his family needs. He is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase 1 sack of certified seeds and 3 sacks fertilizer for the next planting season. Imbued with strength and industry, he never gets tired plowing the fields to ensure enough food for their table. Hard work is the only thing he can give to provide enough things for his family.

“I dreamed to have a more convenient life for my wife and my children,” he uttered. This has fueled his intention to double-time his work to be a more productive farmer. CEV has been helping him to improve his yield every harvest. By joining in the organization, he has easy access to the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEV offers.

loans.use: To purchase  fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn P., 45, lives in Ka Ort Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she is a housewife who takes care of her five children, one a garment factory worker, another a security guard, two students and one yet too young to attend school. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phorn, is a policeman who makes a small salary.

In order to improve family living conditions, Phorn is requesting a loan to become a poultry middleperson, buying and then reselling chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens to resell.

loans.name: Herman

texts.id: Herman menekuni usaha bengkel jual beli dan pasang ban untuk mobil dan sepeda motor. Hal ini sesuai dengan pendidikannya yang lulusan Sekolah Tehnik Mesin. Saat ini ia tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya lelaki yang juga membantunya dalam menjalani usaha ini. Usahanya berkembang setelah ia memutuskan untuk menjual tempat tinggalnya yang lama dan berpindah ke lokasi baru yang tempatnya sangat strategis yakni di penggir jalan utama yang menghubungkan Denpasar dan Gilimanuk. Karena merupakan jalan utama, banyak kendaraan yang melintas di tempat usahanya. Seringkali Herman merasa kewalahan karena usahanya masih kecil dan tidak bisa melayani kebutuhan pelanggan dengan baik. Untuk mengatasi hal itu, Herman membutuhkan dana sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dana itu akan dipergunakan untuk membeli aneka jenis dan ukuran ban serta sebuah dongkrak untuk mengangkat mobil yang besar. Herman optimis usahanya akan berkembang dengan baik, karena ia percaya dengan layanan yang baik kepada pelanggan, mereka akan puas dan akan datang kembali ke bengkelnya dengan lebih banyak pelanggan baru.
texts.en:
Herman is in the vehicle service repair business buying, selling and installing tires for cars and motor cycles. This is in line with his education as Engine Technical school graduate. Today he stays with wife and son, who also helps him in running the business. The business grew after he decided to sell his living quarters, and move to a new very strategic location on the side of main road between Denpasar and Gilimanuk. Since it is on the main road, many vehicles pass through his business. Many times Herman felt overloaded, since his business is still small and could not give enough service. To solve it, Herman needs capital for Rp. 5,000,000.- (translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp 10,000-12,000) to expand his business. That funds would be used to buy several assortments of size and type/brand of tires, and also equipment to lift large cars. Herman is optismic that his business could expand well, since he is confident about his good service to his clients, and they would be satisfied and would return to his shop with more new clients.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more type and size of tires

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel D. C. is a business-minded young woman at age 21. She is still single and lives with her parents in Barangay Alibagu Ilagan, Isabela which has a big population.

Jonabel has been in the direct-selling business of AVON and NATASHA products for two years. She is hoping that her business will grow so she can help her parents and her future family. To realize her plan, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 4, 000. She is also planning to buy a retailer mobile phone SIM and venture into another business: electronic loading, and later on into the food-vending business. She has a lot of business plans but she lacks financial capital to pursue her goals in life. She always keeps in mind that “honesty is the best policy”. For her, someone must be honest to become successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase addtional products and a retailer mobile phone

loans.name: Kathryn

texts.en: Kathryn A. is 44 years old. She is married with four children. She lives with her family in Abeka, a suburb of Accra. For the past eight years she has been selling plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls etc.  She is requesting a loan to buy more plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her income used to support her family. Kathryn is a member of a community group called Winners Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan. It is Kathryn’s dream to help her husband provide their children with the best education.

loans.use: To purchase plastic products

loans.name: Irene Janeth

texts.en:
Irene Janeth V. T. is a married, 29-year old micro-business entrepreneur. Irene Janeth has two children, who are 14 and 1 and in various stages of education. They both live at home with the family.

Irene Janeth operates a small general store that sells general food and beverages, cosmetics, and other basic products for the home. She would like to borrow money in order to further diversify her inventory of products, and for this primary reason, Irene Janeth seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders. She has received nine loans from Fundación León in the past, and each has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the store’s monthly revenue. Irene Janeth dreams of making enough money one day to make improvements to her home and save enough money to provide a sound education for her children.

Irene Janeth V. T. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando Sánchez Hernández tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado oriental, ellos tienen once hijos de los cuales cuatro están a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos y darle estudios , don Rolando desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento , y las plagas que atacan al cultivo , el inicio sus trabajos agrícola con el apoyo de sus padres , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para poder tener una buena producción y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando S. H., 49, lives in the neighborhood Juan Ramon Padilla with his wife, who works as a vendor in the market on the east side of town. They have 11 children, 4 of whom still live at home. Rolando began working as a farmer 30 years ago with the support of his parents, and has continued that work despite difficulties with pests and a lack of proper financing. Today, the loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of fertilizers and other agricultural supplies in order to produce a good yield and sell his crops at a better price. With the increase in income, Rolando hopes to improve the living conditions of his four children and make sure they have access to a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farm supplies

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana esta casada con el señor Santiago A. y ellos tienen 2 hijos.  Posee una despensa ubicada en su hogar hace 11 años. Allí surte a sus vecinos y amigos de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, panificados, carnes, bebidas etc. También cuenta con el apoyo económico de su marido quien es oficial de la policía y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

En esta oportunidad necesita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías tales como: bebidas, arroz, azúcar, panificados y otros de manera a poder aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías y así tener una mayor variedad de las mismas.
texts.en:
Adriana is married to Santiago A., and they have 2 children. For 11 years she has had a store located in her home. She provides her neighbors and friends with all types of basic needs supplies like rice, sugar, bread, meat, drinks, etc. She also counts on economic support from her husband. He is a police official, and he helps with the household expenses. She needs a loan to buy merchandise like drinks, rice, sugar, bread, and more. That way she will be able to increase her stock and have a better variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks, rice, sugar, bread, and more

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Miguel esta ubicado en el mercado San Miguel del barrio Guanacaste de la ciudad capital, la cordinadora del grupo es Jesica S. que tiene  35 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, ella tiene dos empleadas que le ayudan a cocinar y a atender a los clientes que llegan a comer a su local, ella tiene tres hijos y es madre soltera, con las ganancias que le deja su negocio ella les da educacion, vestimenta y alimentacion.
La Sra. Maria V. tiene 68 años de edad quien tiene una venta de frutas y medicinas naturales en el mercado San Miguel, ella es una persona de la tercera edad que ha luchado para poder salir adelante, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos con la cual mantiene su hogar.
la Sra. Virginia R. tiene 61 años de edad quien tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, ella ha luchado tambien por mucho tiempo para poder salir adelante con su familia, actualmente ella le ayuda a sus nietos con la alimentacion. 
este grupo a logrado crecer ya que son bien unidas y se ayudan entre si.
todas ellas necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is located in the San Miguel market in the Guanacaste neighborhood of the capital city. The coordinator of the group, Jesica S., is 35. She sells sweets. She has two employees who help her cook and wait on the customers who come to her place to eat. She has three children, and she is a single mother. With the earnings from her business, she gives her children education, clothing, and food. Maria V., 68, sells fruits and natural medicines in the San Miguel market. She is an elderly person who has fought to be able to get ahead. This is her only source of income to support her household. Virginia R., 61, sells sweets. She, too, has fought for a long time to be able to get ahead with her family. She currently helps feed her grandchildren. This group has been able to grow because they are so united, and they help each other. All of them need a loan to be able to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits, juices, soft drinks, tortillas, cheese, cheese products, beef, pork, chicken, cups, paper plates, beans, rice, coffe, natural medicines

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en: Girlie T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 40 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Girlie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Girlie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Girlie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma A. is 31 years old. He is married and the father of one child who is currently breastfeeding. He lives with his wife at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. He operates a licensed chemical shop with his wife in the village where they hail from. It is his desire to provide a better education for his child through his business proceeds. He owns and operates a pharmacy shop called ‘George Boamah Chemical Store’. He is the person who supplies the surrounding villages with pharmaceutical drugs. He's gotten training on how to administer drugs for patients. A. has passion and commitment for what he is doing and because of that, lots of people buy drugs from his shop. He requests a loan to buy assorted pharmaceutical drugs, which are frequently demanded by his customers. He takes delivery of drugs from Kumasi in the Ashanti. He also has a direct supply from the wholesalers. He would be grateful for support. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Nsawom” which literally means God has a hand in it.

loans.use: For the purchase of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice ia a 47-year-old trader. She is married and a mother with two children. Both kids are currently in school. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort brings a livelihood to the family. Beatrice supports her kids through the sale of used clothing. Used clothing has a very big market share in Ghana as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a market for many women. 

Beatrice has been in this business for the past nine years. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bed sheets, used towels and sometimes kid’s wear. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also for renting a store to trade.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Gulnar's Group

texts.en: Gulnar, 52, is a widow with five children. Two of her daughters and a son live separately. She lives with one daughter, a college student and a younger son, who is disabled. Gulnar is their sole provider. When Gulnar got married, she was given a cow as a wedding gift. Then she began growing barley and clover on her land. Now, along with farming, she even purchases sheep for fattening and resale. Her daughter helps her look after the cattle and the farm. During twenty years of exerting gigantic labor and efforts she has built a house, bought a car and paid for her children’s education. Her monthly income consists of 250 dollars. The academic year is starting in a month and Gulnar does not have funds to pay for her daughter’s college education. She would be very happy to obtain a loan. Some of her other plans include purchasing fuel and lubricants needed for harvesting crops of barley and clover as she will sell them according to her needs and use the proceeds to repair her house. Also she is making preparations for the marriage of her daughter and is saving money for her daughter’s dowry. These are Gulnar’s partners: Asel, 24, is a saleswoman in a duty-free shop. She is enrolled in college as an external student. She decided to apply for a loan to pay for her education. Kerimbek, 47, works as a livestock breeder in a cooperative association and also grows clover and corn. He wants to obtain a loan for purchasing two calves to raise. Alchakul, 47, is a widow and the mother of four children. She has her own land and grows corn and clover. She needs a loan to buy a calf and to put new gates on her house. Anarkul, 47, has two children. Her house is under repair and she needs a loan to purchase cement and to buy a heifer. Anara is the deputy leader of this group. She is married and has raised five children. She keeps cows and sells milk. She needs a loan to buy two calves for sending to pasture and selling them upon return. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of 4 children. She has owned a mini market since 2007 in order to earn income to help satisfy the needs of her family, in collaboration with her husband. Today, Hiyam is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
"Nora T. (0) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Saleaumua.  She is married and has 12 school-aged children.  To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Nora has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Nora joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase young crops to raise.  Nora is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Nora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Leydie Wasty

texts.fr: Leydie est une dame qui a appris la couture ; elle avait ouvert un atelier de couture et disposait même des apprenties couturières. Malheureusement, elle avait fermé son atelier parce qu’elle n’avait pas assez de clients, alors qu’elle devrait régler les frais de location de son atelier. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est lancée en 2004 dans la vente de certaines boissons alcoolisées, de pâtes alimentaires, de lait, d’eau minérale. Avec cette nouvelle activité, elle arrive à subvenir à ses propres besoins ; elle exerce ce commerce dans le quartier d’Agoè Réserve à Lomé, où elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Elle a besoin en ce moment de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cela qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 bouteilles de la boisson Pastis, 10 bouteilles de Golden Dry, 20 boîtes du vin Bonita, 01 carton du lait en conserve, 01 boîte de tomates et une boîte de pâte alimentaire spaghetti. Cette dame n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.

loans.use: Achat de boissons alcoolisées, de tomates, de lait, de pâte alimentaire

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome A., 32, views herself as a humble and hardworking Kenyan.  She is married to a laborer and has two children, aged 5 and 15 yrs old. Her business is a tailoring shop which makes dresses and embroidery for female clients.  She currently has four employees and faces challenges with machine maintenance.  She will use the proceeds of this KES20,000 loan to buy a new sewing machine and cloth.  Her ultimate goal is to expand the business to the point where it can fully support her and her employees.

loans.use: A new sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Liliams Evelyn

texts.es:
La señora LILIAMS EVELYN Z. A., tiene 20 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS 5 ESTRELLAS . Ella  Es soltera y presenta estudios superiores de enfermería técnica, pero nunca ejerció porque cada que le ofrecían trabajo era poco el pago, por ese motivo decidió crear su propio negocio empezando a vender productos naturales. 
La socia se dedica a la compra y venta  de  productos naturales que los vende por catalogó y también con producto en mano (stock). Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró ropa para   caballeros, damas y niños para vender a sus familiares y amistades.
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará productos naturales que se encuentran en oferta para abastecer su stock y también comprará otros productos que le han pedido.
La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así cubrir sus propios gastos.
texts.en:
LILIAMS EVELYN lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad, department, Perú. She is 20 years old and a member of the LAS 5 ESTRELLAS (5 STARS) communal bank. She is single and has finished training as a technical nurse but has never practiced her profession because each job she was offered was very poorly paid. Because of this, she decided to create her own business starting with the sales of natural products. She buys and sells natural products both that she stocks and has on hand and via catalogue. With her first 300 sol loan she bought clothing for gentlemen, ladies and children which she sold among her friends and family. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy natural products which are on sale to add to her stock and will also buy other products for which she already has orders pending. She hopes to increase her profits so that they will be enough to cover her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Mariam has owned a bakery since 2007. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She sells mankoucheh. Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are za'atar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Mariam is known for her good and tasty mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

Mariam requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for her bakery. This is her second loan cycle and she has always repaid on time. She decided on this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on opening a restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her bakery

loans.name: Katherine Frida

texts.es: Katherine tiene 22 años, vive en casa de su padres y sus hermanos, Katherine termino la secundaria no pudo realizar estudios superiores por  carencias económicas.Katherine  hace 2 años volvió a iniciar el negocio que tenían sus padres antes del terremoto, en el desastre sus padres perdieron su casa y casi toda la mercadería que se encontraba en ese entonces, se dedicaban a la venta de golosinas y abarrotes en general. Katherine inicio el negocio con ahorros propios producto de su trabajo como obrera de planta en una Agro Exportadora, Katherine realiza las ventas de su mercadería en su vivienda, y a sus clientes les brinda un trato muy calido y agradable, ella atiende su negocio en las mañanas y su madre la ayuda en las tardes ya que ella labora, su clientela ha ido incrementándose, y la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma zona donde ella vive, solicita el crédito para la compra de la mercadería que ofrecerá en la temporada navideña. Katherine desea poder estudiar Administración de Empresas en la Universidad, por ese motivo sus ahorros los invierte para poder tener mayores ingresos y así poder pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Katherine is 22 years old and lives at home with her parents and siblings. She completed her secondary school education but has been unable to attend any university courses for economic reasons. Two years ago she restarted the business her parents had before the earthquake. In the disaster, her parents lost their house and almost all the merchandise that they had. Since then, they have devoted themselves to the sale of candy and grocery items. Katherine began the new business with her own savings that she earned from working in the fields at an Agro Exportadora ("Exporter of Agriculture"). She sells her merchandise at home and offers her customers warm service and good prices. She serves her customers in the mornings and her mom helps her during the afternoons. Since she has been working, her clientele has been increasing and the majority of her customers are from her own neighborhood. Katherine is asking for a loan so she can buy merchandise to offer during the Christmas season. Ultimately, she would like to attend university and study Business Administration. For this reason, she is investing her savings to be able to bring in more income and be able to pay for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Bethia Ines

texts.es:
La señora Bethia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 03 hijos, quienes dependen de ella. Estudio hasta quinto de secundaria.
Bethia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino. 
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró ovejas.

Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de ganado (2 toros).
Su visión hacia el futuro es mejorar su negocio y comprar mas  ganado vacuno.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los interese que son bajos, además de la puntualidad de sus socias.
texts.en:
Bethia is a member of the communal bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” in the district of Pilcuyo in El Collao province. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 dependent children. She completed her studies through the fifth year of secondary school. Bethia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 4 years; she has a business buying and selling livestock (cows and sheep.) She tells us that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy sheep. She needs a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of livestock (2 bulls.) Her vision of the future is to improve her business and buy more cattle. What she likes most about her communal bank is that the interest rates are low, and also the other members are punctual with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 bulls

loans.name: Try Us Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Try Us' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses.

Suliaman K. on the left in the photo is the leader of this group. The 52-year-old was born in Magburaka town and is married to a businesswoman; they have eight children between the ages of three and twenty-seven.

Sulaiman sells rice and palm oil (the favorite cooking oil in this country). He has been in this business for a very long time. With his share of the loan, he will buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice, as much as the loan will permit.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: El señor Jose F. A., tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y viven de manera independiente, el mayor logro del señor jose Felix seria el poder brindarle a sus hijos un hogar optimo donde pueda ubicarse  y que convivan como familia, el señor se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura (cultivo d ela Pitahaya)uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado, han sido las plagas y para esto, el señor F. solicitó un prestamo para darle a la cosecha un mantenimiento mas optimo invirtiendo el prestamo en la compra de fertilizante y fungizidas, esto le traeria mayores ingresos, pudiendo darle la posibilidad de visualizar a corto plazo la planificacion de la reconstruccion de su casa y asi dejarle a sus hijos su legado.
texts.en:
Jose F. A. is 54 years old, married and has four children, all who are fully grown and live on their own. Felix's greatest achievement would be to be able to provide his children with an optimal home they can move to and live together as a family. Jose has made a living for 30 years as a farmer (cultivating Pitahaya, a regional fruit). One of the main problems he has encountered has been plague, and because of this Jose is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and fungicides so he can give his crops optimal maintenance. This will bring in better profits, allowing the possibility of seeing his plans to renovate his house come to pass in short order, thus leaving his children his legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and fungicides to provide his crops with better maintenance

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Brigida H. se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa comercializada por ella misma en su localidad donde vende todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños en su localidad. 

Ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la ropa entre la que se encuentran pantalones y camisas. Está confiando que su crédito será otorgado y así continuará en dicha venta para mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in Managua, Mrs. Brigida H. has a business selling clothing. She conducts the sales personally at her stall, where she sells all types of clothing for women, men, and children. She is asking for a loan to purchase clothing such as pants and shirts. She is confident that her loan will be granted, and that she will continue in said business to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of ready-to-wear for children

loans.name: Ketty Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Ketty forma parte del banco comunal Alianza formado  en la ciudad de Portoviejo provincia de Manabí donde podemos disfrutar de hermosas playas durante todo del año, es socia actica desde hace tres ciclos, junto a su esposo montaron su negocio de  reencauchadora que lo tienen hace tres años ya; su cónyuge se encarga de viajar  a otras ciudades a comprar las llantas usadas  en  un promedio de treinta por semana para luego reencaucharlas y sacarlas a la venta,  al mes vende un aproximado de 100 llantas que las distribuye entre Portoviejo y Quito en esta última ciudad un primo se encarga de comercializarlas.

Para la señora Ketty mantener firme este negocio no ha sido nada fácil y gracias a los créditos obtenidos de la Fundación Espoir han logrado mantenerlo a flote y espera seguir con su negocio que es su sustento diario.  Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar más llantas usadas para reencaucharlas e incrementar su negocio y tener un stock suficiente para ofrecer a sus clientes.
 
El sueño de nuestra socia es poder ve realizado los sueños de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ketty is part of the Alianza Communal Bank. It is in the city of Portoviejo in the province of Manabí, where we can enjoy beautiful beaches all year. She has been an active member for three cycles. She and her husband started a retread business, and they have had it for three years. Her husband travels to other cities to buy the used tires. He buys an average of about 30 tires a week. Then they retread the tires and sell them. They sell approximately 100 tires a month, which they distribute between Portoviejo and Quito. A cousin sells them in Quito. Keeping the business solid has not been easy for Ketty. Thanks to the loans received from the Espoir Foundation they have kept it afloat. She hopes to continue with this business, which is her daily support. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more used tires to retread. She will increase her business and have sufficient stock to offer her customers. Her dream is to be able to see her children’s dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used tires to retread and increase her business
